Huawei Technologies is a leader in providing next generation telecommunications networks, and now serves 35 of the world's top 50 operators, along with over one billion users worldwide. The company is committed to providing innovative and customized products, services and solutions to create long-term value and growth potential for its customers.

Huawei's products and solutions encompassing wireless products(HSDPA/WCDMA/EDGE/ GPRS/GSM, CDMA2000 1xEV-DO/CDMA2000 1X, TD-SCDMA, WiMAX), core network products ( IMS, Mobile Softswitch, NGN ), network products(FTTx, xDSL, Optical, Routers, LAN Switch), applications and software(IN, mobile data service, BOSS), as well as terminals(UMTS/CDMA). Major products are designed based on Huawei's ASIC chipset and utilize shared platforms to provide quality and cost-effective products.

At the end of Dec. 2008, Huawei has over 100,000 employees, of whom 48% are dedicated to R&D. Huawei's global R&D centers are located in Bangalore in India, Silicon Valley and Dallas in USA, Stockholm in Sweden and Moscow in Russia in addition to those in Beijing, Shanghai, Nanjing, Shenzhen, Hangzhou and Chengdu in China.

For more information about Huawei, please visit http://www.huawei.com

column2: The National Healthcare Group (NHG) is a leader in public healthcare in Singapore, recognised at home and abroad for the quality of its medical expertise and facilities. Care is provided through an integrated network of six primary care polyclinics, acute care and tertiary hospitals, national specialty centres and business divisions. Together they bring a rich legacy of medical expertise to our philosophy of integrated patient-centred care.

column1: <div>

column2: NHG's vision is ""Adding Years of Healthy Life"". This vision goes beyond merely healing the sick to the more difficult and infinitely more rewarding task of preventing illness and preserving health and quality of life. With some 20,000 staff, NHG aims to provide care that is patient-centric, accessible, seamless, comprehensive, appropriate and cost-effective.

column1: <div>

column2:
As the Regional Health System (RHS) for Central Singapore, it is vital for NHG to partner and collaborate with stakeholders, community advisors, and voluntary welfare organisations. Together with our patients, their families and caregivers, we aim to deliver integrated healthcare services and programmes that help in Adding Years of Healthy Life to all concerned.","You will have the opportunity to be a key member of an interdisciplinary research team (HOMER, which stands for Health Outcomes and Medical Education Research) to examine issues related to population health and health professions education. You will work closely with healthcare professionals and administrators to conceptualise and conduct rigorous research studies that can improve the healthcare sector and the health of the population.

Responsibilities 

  • Design and conduct research studies to address population health and education needs
  • Evaluate and implement population health and health professions education research
  • Pre-process, analyse, and interpret data to make recommendations so as to improve the healthcare sector and the health of the population
  • Manage research projects with stakeholders from various disciplines/ institutions
  • Conduct research workshops
  • Communicate findings to academic and practitioner communities
  • Improve the efficacy of health professions education activities in NHG and the surrounding systems supporting those activities
Requirements
  • A postgraduate degree in population health sciences, epidemiology, health economics, anthropology, communications, education, human computer interaction, human factors, organizational behaviour, psychology, social work, sociology, knowledge management, statistics, data analytics, business analytics, or other related disciplines.
  • Candidates without postgraduate qualifications but with strong research skills/ experience will also be considered
  • Proficient in data analysis, machine learning, and the use of at least one software such as R, STATA, Python
  • Proficient in sampling methods and survey designs
  • Experience in GIS and relevant work experience  in healthcare settings and population health will be an added advantage
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills, able to articulate thoughts readily
  • Passionate about quantitative and/or experimental research
Please elaborate in your CV on your quantitative skills/experience (e.g., familiarity with which analytical techniques and corresponding software).

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

The Continental-NTU Corporate Lab: Future-Oriented Continental Urban Society (FOCUS) Lab invites applications for the position of Research Fellow. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 

The research work will focus on the design of a technical architecture for privacy-aware data extraction and edge-cloud applications deployment in automotive CPS.

Responsibilities will include

  • Develop a technical architecture for privacy-preserving data extraction in automotive CPS
  • Develop an algorithmic framework for edge-cloud applications based on the above technical architecture and its demonstration with sample applications
  • Prototyping of the developed solution and active participation in related commercialization activities
  • Participation in project management activities and coordination among various academic and industrial stakeholders.


Job Requirements: 

  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related fields
  • Background and research experience in CPS security, particularly, network security.
  • Implementation experience in translating research ideas to prototypes (simulators, testbeds, etc.).

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

We are seeking a Research Engineer I to work on a computer vision project at the School of Computer Science and Engineering. The Research Engineer I will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms for 3D scene understanding. The Research Engineer I is expected to have a solid background in relevant areas.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • To independently undertake research in computer vision and machine learning

  • To produce research reports and/or publications as required by the funding body or for dissemination to the wider academic community

  • To provide support to any students associated with the project

  • To attend, contribute, and where necessary lead relevant meetings

  • To undertake any other duties relevant to the programme of research

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent

  • Strong background in machine learning and computer vision

  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: Symrise is a global supplier of fragrances, flavors, food, nutrition and cosmetic ingredients. Its clients include manufacturers of perfumes, cosmetics, food and beverages, pharmaceuticals and producers of nutritional supplements and pet food.

Its sales of approximately € 3,520 million in the 2020 fiscal year make Symrise a leading global provider. Headquartered in Holzminden, Germany, the Group is represented by more than 100 locations in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia, the United States and Latin America.

Symrise works with its clients to develop new ideas and market-ready concepts for products that form an integral part of everyday life. Economic success and corporate responsibility are inextricably linked as part of this process.
Symrise – always inspiring more…

Senior IT Specialist

This position will be responsible to develop, maintain and support the organisation IT systems such as Computer Hardware, Software, Video Conferencing, Networks and Database Systems & Servers while ensuring that the IT environment is always secure and available while able to deliver services that meets or exceeds users’ expectations. 

The Position

  • Maintain all system hardware and software and install and perform regular maintenance on all software and associate ancillary equipment.
  • Maintain subject matter expertise in all applications for systems and maintain knowledge on all new and upcoming technologies and provide support to all production activities and resolve all technical issues in IT systems.
  • Provide advice, support & guidance to staff & management with respect to technical issues, networking, operations, application and desktop support
  • Provide technical support, training, and direction to users to ensure effective use of systems
  • Participate in, and at times lead projects to implement new systems and technologies
  • Provision, setup and maintain VMware and Hyper-V virtual machines
  • Ensure all servers is being properly backup according to the backup policies and perform data restore periodically
  • Proactively conduct health check on all applications, servers and network devices and maintain stipulated SLA uptime agreement
  • Proactively follow up and resolve outstanding issues with vendors, do escalation when necessary
  • Monitor network bandwidth usage and perform timely audit on suspicious/malicious activity in company network and end-client computer 
  • Implement and enforce all IT Security Standards related to PCs, servers, network, router, internet and WAN network
  • Evaluate all system practices and recommend improvements and modifications to all systems to reduce cost and upgrade systems and maintain knowledge of all company IT assets
  • Perform research and implement all technical solutions for all systems and ensure compliance to all company objectives and provide regular status reports to management and perform various tests on systems to ensure smooth workflow.
  • Maintains and updates the quality records according to the standard guidelines on identification, filing, storage, maintenance and disposition of these records.
  • Assists in control and proper maintenance of internal documents received where applicable.
  • Provides feedback to manager about the purchase of products and services supplied by vendors to assist in vendor evaluations.

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Min Degree in IT/Computer Science with more than 5 years of related working experience in End User Support with Hands On Experience in implementing & management of servers/networks.
  • Good Working Knowledge in the following technologies such as Windows OS, Server OS, M365, Azure Cloud, Dell Server & SAN, VMWare ESXi, Cisco Networking Switching and IP Telephony.
  • Customer centric with a problem solving approach.
  • Self-Motivated, Dynamic and Results Driven.
  • Strong in Project Management, ability to deliver under pressure and stay professional in challenging environments.
  • Provides clear communications, good interpersonal skills, and sensitive to cultural differences.
  • Flexible to take on different tasks/activities

The School of Social Sciences invites interested candidates to apply for a Research Assistant position. The position is for one year and renewable. The position will support an MOE funded project to incorporate a video-mediated communication component into an existing game application so that users can play the exergames within the video call environment.

Job Responsibilities

  • Gather requirement for proposed mobile game app and specification of app that requried for integration with teleconferencing software (e.g. Zoom, Facebook Messenger)

  • Design, build and maintain mobile game app (iOS or Android platform) integrated with teleconferencing software (e.g. Zoom SDK, Facebook Messenger)

  • Specific duties include but are not limited to ensuring the quality and performance of the applications / platforms, identifying and fixing application bugs, maintaining the core code, and implementing updates to the application/platform

  • Work with other team member to conduct evaluation study with end-users and refine app based on collected data/feedbacks

  • Work with team to prepare project reports


Job Requirements

  • Bachelor degree / Diploma in Game Programming, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related fields, and relevant work experience

  • Fresh graduates are welcome to apply

  • Development experience in mobile application is a plus

  • Interest in research for serious games development

  • Familiar with game programming languages such as Swift, Objective-C, C#, Unity, iOS and/or Android development

  • Good analytical, organizational, communication and interpersonal skills

  • Able to work independently and as a team member on multiple projects

  • Good communication and writing skills


We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As part of an integrated academic health system, NUH is committed to transforming care, shaping the next generation of healthcare professionals and leveraging translational research to improve health outcomes. The hospital is also the principal teaching hospital for the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: For more information, please visitwww.nuh.com.sg | www.nuhs.edu.sg

column1:
","
A Clinical Research Coordinator in the Division of Nephrology, Dialysis and Renal Transplantation is responsible for coordinating ongoing clinical and translational research studies in the Division. The Division is the only centre for Paediatric Dialysis and Paediatric Renal Transplantation in Singapore, and is a regional referral centre for patients with complex Paediatric Nephrology conditions. The Division maintains an active clinical and translational research programme in keeping with this, with particular strengths in renal immunology and renal genetics.
The Challenges
  • To regularly screen inpatient and clinic lists for suitable patients for inclusion in research studies, based on study inclusion criteria.
  • To recruit patients, including obtaining informed consent.
  • To coordinate research visits with patients’ planned clinical visits and biospecimen collection, so as to facilitate patient participation in research.
  • To maintain up to date study logs, ensuring compliance with existing directives by the Institutional Review Board.
  • To extract and collate clinical data from the medical records of research participants.
  • To draft new applications to the Institutional Review Board, as well as amendments to existing study protocols, under supervision.
  • To maintain existing study databases, e.g. longitudinal 2D-echocardiographic measurements in paediatric chronic kidney disease patients. Training in statistical methods of data analysis will be provided if interested.
  • To assume additional responsibilities as assigned by supervisor(s)
Job Requirements
  • Minimum Diploma in Biomedical science or equivalent
  • Entry level candidates may apply. Training will be provided for all the roles above.
  • Interest in research is a bonus. Career development opportunities will be provided to those exploring a career in academic research.
  • Possess good interpersonal, strong team and communication skills.
  • Able to work independently after training, and demonstrate initiative.
  • Possess basic computer knowledge
  • Able to work overtime or on Saturdays when required, with appropriate off-in-lieu arrangements provided.
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
Please indicate in the subject title as: ""Applying for position of Clinical Research Coordinator (Contract), Paediatrics (DL)”
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

8,computer research,/en/job/senior-research-scientist-technical-lead-section-manager-robotics-9414166,9414166,Senior Research Scientist / Technical Lead / Section Manager (Robotics),False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",25-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Background

The Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) develops high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance the competitiveness of Singapore’s manufacturing industry. It collaborates with various multinational and companies in the Precision Engineering, MedTech, Aerospace, Automotive, Marine, Oil Gas, Electronics, Semiconductor, Logistics, and other sectors.
The Adaptive Robotics Mechatronics (ARM) group in SIMTech focused on providing key technologies and expertise for the development of robotics and automation systems. We envisioned to be the leading innovator and most respected automation technology partner for Singapore industry.
The ARM group consists of four teams focusing on research in robot manipulation, mobile robotics, actuation and control as well as design and simulation. Our main research and competencies areas include mechanism design and analysis, thermomechanical modelling, actuator design, real time control design, software architecture design, and artificial intelligence.
  • The robot manipulation section works on research and technology development in new robotic mechanisms and intelligence including force control end-effector modules, adaptive grippers, robotics manipulation and AI for material handling.
  • The mobile robotics section works on development of scalable reconfigurable mobility platform technologies to achieve mobile robot building blocks to quickly customize and synthesize task optimized mobile robots.
  • The actuation and control section uses multi-physics multi-objective optimization approaches to improve control performance as well as the development of new motors and drive electronics.
  • The design and simulation section works on technology development in automation methodologies, electromagnetic, thermofluid vibration analysis, virtual prototyping system design optimization as well as multi-physics modelling simulation.
SIMTech, a research institute under the ncy for Science Technology and Research (A*STAR), is inviting applications for Senior Research Scientist position in the following areas:
  • Industrial Robotics / Reconfigurable robots / Adaptive handling
  • Robotics for Construction/Build Environment
  • Traction Motor design and/or Drives electronics control and development
Responsibilities
  • Identify new research trends in the research community and establish a research team and research roadmap to pursue research in these emerging areas
  • Pushing research boundaries within own research area and to lead the planning and execution of the research roadmap
  • Develop research proposals to secure research grants
  • Lead major initiatives/programmes/projects to push translational research.
  • To eng industry to identify industry needs and technology gaps; Identify and/or support strategic projects, opportunities and propose technical roadmap aligned with business and customer requirements
  • Work in a team of multi-disciplinary experts to execute and deliver on project deliverables
Required Background
  • PhD in mechanical/electrical/electronics engineering or computer science.
  • 5 ’ experience in executing and/or managing RD projects in the relevant area of expertise
  • Knowledge and experience in some industrial sectors are preferred
  • Recognized as a technical expert in research domain and able to influence the research community ly and worldwide
  • Proactive team player and technically motivated to solve problems, innovate and deliver to internal and external customers
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to spark ideas and generate concepts and inspire peers
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: At ST Engineering, our purpose is to apply our technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Our dedication to excellence and our strong track record have earned us a distinctive reputation for quality and trust as a global technology, defence and engineering group. Our diverse portfolio of businesses spans the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments.

We succeed because of our ability to deliver what our partners and customers need. Together, we transform and future-proof cities to make them more mobile, more secure and more liveable for communities. With our expertise and facilities around the world, we keep aircraft flying safely and seagoing vessels operating efficiently.

We help nations protect their citizens by meeting their air, land and sea defence needs and equipping their fighting forces to perform on the battlefield. Our cybersecurity and critical systems help our customers enforce public and homeland security in an increasingly digital world. And our satellite communications equipment contribute to much of the world’s network connectivity.

KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital has evolved over the decades, since its founding in 1858, into a regional leader in Obstetrics, Gynaecology, Paediatrics and Neonatology. Today, the 830-bed hospital is a referral centre providing tertiary services to handle high-risk conditions in women and children. More than 400 specialists adopt a multi-disciplinary and holistic approach to treatment, and harness the latest innovations and technology for the best medical care possible.

As an academic healthcare institution, KKH believes that world-class clinical training and research are imperative in raising the standard of care. Hence, the Hospital has adopted a culture of innovation as it strives for world-class clinical leadership.

As we continually raise the bar on clinical excellence, we are sensitive to our patients’ needs for a pleasant hospital experience – one where they receive seamless service and enjoy the warmth of compassionate care in a healing environment.","

11,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-electrical-electronics-engineering-computer-engineering-9408245,9408245,Research Fellow (Electrical & Electronics Engineering / Computer Engineering),False,False,,,,Nanyang Technological University,23-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604393R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

The Data Management and Analytics Research Lab at the School of Computer Science & Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (DAML) seeks applications for the position of Research Assistant. The Research Assistant will work on a funded data science grant, and will work closely with the Principal Investigator at DAML to support the University's research on entity resolution and data cleaning.

The project seeks to use data analytics to extract and clean bibliographic data sources and address the challenging name disambiguation problem of authors.

The Research Assistant will be responsible for research and development of techniques for addressing name disambiguation problem in bibliographic data sources. Through taking part in this project, the Research Assistant will have the opportunity contribute positively to research at the intersection of entity resolution and data science, which has important implications in real-world bibliographic data sources such as DBLP, Scopus.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Research in name disambiguation problem

  • Implement novel techniques for data integration, data cleaning, and name disambiguation using Python

  • Assists with the editing and preparation of manuscripts, reports and presentations

  • Engage in discussions with PI and collaborators

  • Perform other tasks as required by the Principal Investigators

Job Requirements: 

  • Bachelors in Computer Science-related areas with a focus in Data analytics

  • Solid programming and application development skills with experience in Python

  • Ability to read and understand methodologies in research papers

  • Fluent in English and good team-player

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The Clinical Research Coordinator will work closely with the Division of Allergy, Immunology & Rheumatology team to work with a team of research staff to coordinate and ensure the smooth running of a new clinical study on immune responses to the COVID-19 vaccine in children, and other research studies within the Division, to contribute to increasing and maintaining high quality, scientifically robust research within the Department of Paediatrics, NUH.

The Challenges
  • Assist PIs to recruit, schedule, screen, perform research-related procedures and follow-up subjects in each clinical study, in strict adherence to the study protocol, Singapore Good Clinical Practice Guidelines and other applicable regulatory and ethical requirements.
  • Coordinate study-related finances and logistics.
  • Maintain version control on study documents, ensures accuracy of data collected and answers to data clarification requests in a timely manner.
  • Entry and validation of study data, extraction of relevant information from medical records, reporting of adverse events, maintenance of investigator files and other essential documentation.
  • Responsible handling of patient samples in adherence to the study protocol and coordinate courier services from source to laboratory storage/processing facility.
  • Handle communications between clinical trial industry sponsors and PI/Co-Investigators.
  • Assist in communications with DSRB/IRB staff regarding study-related ethics applications, amendments and status reports.
  • Assist in administrative aspects of grant applications and grant management upon award.
  • Perform clinical procedures that are relevant to the clinical studies which may include skin prick testing to a variety of allergens, intradermal testing, patch testing, drug and food challenges and venepuncture.
  • Support in other functions such as general administration.
Job Requirements
  • Degree/Diploma in Medical Science/Biomedical Science/Allied Healthcare or Nursing
  • Experience in clinical studies and training in Good Clinical Practice is an advantage
  • Competent in phlebotomy or willing to learn with appropriate training and accreditation
  • Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Highly motivated, has initiative, meticulous and diligent with excellent organizational skills
  • Be comfortable with children
  • Have a positive attitude towards learning and self-development
  • Competency in basic computer literacy skills
  • Comfortable with performing simple clinical procedures with appropriate training
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
Please indicate in the subject title as: ""Applying for position of Clinical Research Coordinator (Contract), Paediatrics (ET)”
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1: 15,computer research,/en/job/analyst-pulses-centre-grant-contract-9368072,9368072,"Analyst, PULSES Centre Grant (Contract)",False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Health Services Pte Ltd (SingHealth HQ),14 hours ago,False,,,200002698Z,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div>

SingHealth HQ is the headquarters of SingHealth, the largest public healthcare cluster in Singapore. We focus on cluster-wide, strategic core functions for the organisation and work closely with our institutions and care teams to facilitate excellent care for our patients.

We offer a diverse variety of roles that you can fulfil your career aspirations in. You can choose from domain areas such as medical and clinical services, regional health system, research, education, organisational transformation and informatics, as well as corporate services including operations, finance, human resources, legal and communications. These comprise healthcare administration roles and other unique jobs such as genetic counsellors and clinical research nurses.

","

The SingHealth Population-based, Unified, Learning System for Enhanced and Sustainable Health (PULSES) Centre Grant is funded by the National Medical Research Council to build population health research capabilities and foster multidisciplinary collaborations to address the unmet healthcare needs of our population.

You will support the department’s analytic function by managing large volumes of data in adherence to data governance standards. You will support the Principal Investigators (PI) in performing data analysis and design solutions by applying algorithms to process large datasets as well as supporting the PI in abstract, poster and manuscript preparation.

In addition, you will assist to provide training support for users of the research database/analytics system(s).

You will collaborate with other analytics professionals to develop new project proposals and reports/manuscripts for the expansion of research analytics role in SingHealth Regional Health System.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Public Health, Mathematical Sciences, Health Sciences or any related science discipline or equivalent
  • At least 2 years’ working experience in relevant field of research (health services research preferred)
  • Familiarity with clinical/research database management systems and processes will be advantageous
  • Experience in data analytics using hospital and healthcare databases
  • Working knowledge of advanced data analytics software (e.g. R/Python, SPSS, Stata) and Business Intelligence visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, OBIEE) will be considered favourably

16,computer research,/en/job/associate-clinical-research-coordinator-9366727,9366727,Associate Clinical Research Coordinator,False,False,,,SGD,National Cancer Centre Singapore Pte Ltd,14 hours ago,False,,,199801562Z,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,National Cancer Centre,"

The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) has evolved over the past 20 years to become one of the leading regional centres for cancer treatment and research. It has pioneered the one-stop multi-disciplinary approach to cancer treatment and is now home to oncologists, surgeons and researchers, dedicated to the care and treatment of a growing number of cancer patients.

Today, NCCS see close to 65 per cent of the public sector oncology cases in Singapore. To deliver the latest cancer care and treatment, clinicians work closely with researchers who conduct robust cutting-edge clinical and translational research which has received international recognition.

NCCS strives to be a global leading cancer centre, and shares its expertise and knowledge by training the next generation of medical professionals.

","

Job Description

The Associate Clinical Research Coordinator (ACRC) shall assist all levels of Clinical Research Coordinators (CRCs and above), in coordinating clinical research. The ACRC has to ensure that trial- related work is conducted and recorded in accordance with the protocol, Good Clinical Practice (GCP) Guidelines, all applicable regulatory requirements and the Clinical Trials Office Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) as well as instructions from her superiors.

You will support and assist in the following trial related activities:-

  • Assigned to take over trials that have completed treatment phase or trials that involve few simple procedures.
  • Data collection and management including resolving data discrepancies,
  • Tracking of trial expenditures and timely invoicing (where applicable), etc. 
  • Administer quality of life questionnaires or any other surveys as and when required.
  • Assist in performing trial procedures which include taking and recording patients’vital signs performing ECGs; collecting data; other trial-related procedures.
  • Assist in collection and delivery of biological specimens eg blood, urine and tissues. The ACRC is required to assist in processing and delivery of specimens whenever necessary.
  • Assist in the inventory of study materials such as laboratory kits, patient diaries and case report forms to ensure adequate supplies are maintained to conduct the trials.
  • Assist in the collection of medical records or duplicate radio-diagnostic films and ensuring that the items are collected in accordance with specific request forms.
  • Assist in the managing the Clinical Trials Office’s Medical Records Trolley and the transportation of medical notes in the Trolley between Medical Records Office and the Clinical Trials Office. The ACRC shall also assist other CTO staff to obtain medical notes and other source documents.

 Requirements:

  • Diploma in Life Sciences/Nursing
  • 2 years of related working experience an advantage
  • Knowledge in venepuncture/cannulation would be an added advantage
  • Good time-management and communication skills
  • Able to work independently and detailed oriented
  • Computer literate

We are looking for a Research Assistant at NUH Department of Medicine in the field of public health focusing on chronic disease prevention. You will be part of an interdisciplinary team that responsible for the development and evaluation of a digital e-counselling platform (HOPE – Healthy living with Online suPport & Education) to engage and support individuals with elevated cardiovascular disease and diabetes risk factors, and to help them adopt lifestyle changes to reduce the levels of these risk factors.
You will work within a multi-disciplinary team which includes clinicians, nutritional epidemiologists, dietitians and experts in human-computer interface. You will also work with experts in behavioural sciences/marketing and physical activity who are active collaborators. 
The Challenges
  • Proficient in conducting literature reviews and appraisals of publications.
  • Conduct research study activities like recruitment, data collection, data analysis and data management.
  • Provide research expertise to conduct study evaluations and clinical trial.
  • Work closely with principal investigators, research associates/ assistants, and program manager to execute studies by planning, preparing study protocols, and implementing these studies efficiently.
  • Prepare and apply projects’ ethics applications.
  • Liaise with collaborators to bridge clinical and scientific information in order to integrate both into new and ongoing projects.
  • Provide research updates to stakeholders on regular basis.
  • Analyse and evaluate research outcomes.
Job Requirements:
Qualification:
  • Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Science/ Public Health/ Social Science.
Experience:
  • Minimum 2 years research experience (recruitment, data collection, and/or data analysis).
  • Good knowledge in Quantitative Analysis, Epidemiology, or Psychology would be an advantage.
  • Familiar with data analysis using software like STATA, SPSS, or the like.
  • Possess leadership qualities and strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment with different groups of stakeholders.
  • Astute critical thinking skills and ability to learn quickly.
  • Prior experience in publication of research findings would be an advantage.
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
Please indicate in the subject title as: ""Applying for position of “Research Assistant_Dept of Medicine (Contract)”
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column1:
","

The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Principal Research Scientist.

The Principal Research Scientist will work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics. The role entails the responsibility of project planning, scheduling and formulating operation management policies, coordination with stakeholders for operations management and organization of cybersecurity events like hackathons, seminars etc. The job also requires coordination with researchers for preparation and submission of reports.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Perform project planning, scheduling and formulate operation management policies

  • Coordination with stakeholders for operations management

  • Organization of cybersecurity events (like hackathons, seminars etc.)

  • Coordination with researchers for preparation and submission of reports

Job Requirements: 

  • ​A PhD degree in IT, Computer Engineering, or any other relevant field

  • Minimum 8 years of experience after PhD degree, preferably in cybersecurity research or IoT system architecture, including at least 4 years of project management experience

  • Applicants with a master's degree and a minimum of 12 years working experience will be considered

  • A proven track record of international publications in relevant fields

  • Familiar with IoT, virtualization and distributed systems

  • Experience in international research collaboration, security information and event management (SIEM), malware analysis, machine learning, cyber physical systems (CPS), or security architectures/frameworks is a plus

  • Proficient in technical reporting/presentations

  • Good verbal communication skills and be ability to work independently and in a team to realize the proposed works

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

20,computer research,/en/job/associate-clinical-research-coordinator-oe-with-optometry-background-9410262,9410262,Associate/Clinical Research Coordinator (OE) (with Optometry Background)),False,False,2800,4200,SGD,Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI),24-Mar-22,False,,24 days,199704888Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC) was incorporated on 3 March 1989 and commenced operation in October 1990. It is the designated national centre for ophthalmology within Singapore’s public sector healthcare network, with a faculty of close to 80 ophthalmologists and more than 800 staff. SNEC spearheads and coordinates the provision of specialised ophthalmological services with emphasis on quality education and research.

SNEC manages more than 330,000 patient visits and performs over 35,000 surgeries and laser procedures annually.  The centre offers a full spectrum of subspecialties addressing every part of the eye – Cataract, Corneal & External Eye Disease, General Cataract & Comprehensive Ophthalmology, Glaucoma, Neuro-ophthalmology, Ocular Inflammation & Immunology, Oculoplastic, Paediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus, Refractive Surgery, Surgical and Medical Retina.

Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) was established in 1997 as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. It is the research arm of SNEC, and affiliated to the National University of Singapore (NUS) and the Duke-NUS Medical School, as part of the SingHealth-Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre.

Over the years, SERI has invested considerable resources into its research infrastructure and in the training of the next generation of clinician-scientists, clinician-researchers and scientists. In two decades, SERI has grown from a founding team of 5 to over 200 researchers, doctors and support staff, and is the largest eye research institute in the Asia-Pacific region.

A global leader in eye research, SERI ranks ahead of its counterparts in the US, UK and Japan in terms of ophthalmology publications per capita. Tapping on its close affiliation to SNEC, SERI is in the unique position to translate basic research into cutting edge clinical care by enabling the development of new treatments for a variety of eye diseases.

","

Established in 1997, SERI is Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI’s mission is to conduct high-impact eye research that prevents blindness, low vision and major eye diseases common to Singaporeans and Asians. Over the last decade, SERI has conducted landmark research projects that have led to tangible outcomes, patient benefits, and success stories. It has paved the way for significant improvements in how eye diseases are treated and prevented, not just for Singaporeans or Asians, but on a global scale.

SERI has grown from a founding team of five in 1997 to a faculty of more than 238 staff, encompassing clinician scientists, scientists, research fellows, PhD students and support staff. This makes SERI one of the largest research institutes in Singapore, as well as the largest eye research institute in the Asia Pacific region. SERI has also over 230 adjunct faculties from various eye departments, biomedical institutes and tertiary centres in Singapore. SERI has published an impressive array of 4,504 scientific papers, and has secured external peer-reviewed competitive grants worth more than $360 million. As of August 2021, SERI’s faculty has been awarded with more than 755 national and international prizes and filed 145 patents. 

Are you searching for an opportunity to apply/develop your skills and expertise? Joining the SERI family would provide you the chance to join a global team and learn alongside with one of the top and globally renowned researchers, as well as develop your knowledge and skills further in a friendly and team-oriented working environment!

For the role of a Clinical Research Coordinator, you will be working in the Research Clinic Platform at SERI, with the following responsibilities,

  • Plan, schedule and carry out of day-to-day clinical activities and procedures including vision, refraction, retinal photography as well as questionnaire administration for our research participants
  • Prepare various study materials (data collection forms, consent forms, screening log forms etc.).
  • Maintain Investigator Site File (ISF) and update screening log and enrolment logs
  • Undertake data entry and preparation of reports to share the study status (e.g. recruitment etc.,) with the supervisor
  • Serve as primary point of liaison and coordination between investigators, ancillary departments, research subjects, and/or regulating bodies
  • Ensure all clinical activities are carried out and complied in accordance with established research protocols and standards
  • Must be able to work independently in a dynamic environment
  • Perform other job-related duties as assigned by supervisor

Requirements

  • Diploma/degree in Optometry.
  • Fluent in Malay and English due to the need to communicate with Malay/English-speaking patients
  • Must be willing to be based off-site for recruitment of research patients
  • Good teamwork and organization skills. Able to work meticulously and independently.
  • Able to commit for at least a year.
  • Computer competency including proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Note: Package will commensurate with qualifications and experience

21,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-iora-9411527,9411527,Research Fellow (IORA),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,24-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

Institute of Operations Research and Analytics (IORA) at National University of Singapore (NUS) offers an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Research Fellow to work on and manage analytics projects with our industry partners. The projects aim to develop new analytics tools utilizing unique datasets and research and experimental development on machine learning techniques.  A major part of this role will be focusing on a research collaboration with a leading semiconductor manufacturing company.

Your project management and technical skills are the foundation of this role as you will be working within multidisciplinary and international project team of leading researchers. As an important and integral member of our research team, you will be managing some of our industry projects and working closely with faculty members, research scientists, and PhD students. Our researchers can mine production-level data, develop mathematical models and algorithms to derive new insights. Part of your job is to communicate complex data and algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower our industry partners to act based on the research insights. Your business knowledge, interpersonal/communication skills are therefore a requirement to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team.

Requirements

The University values courage and creativity, openness and engagement, inclusion and diversity, and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a Research Scientist who has:

  • a completed PhD in computer science, operations research, econometrics, statistics, or related field
  • evidence of managing research projects
  • evidence of ability to conduct high-quality research
  • strong mathematical and programming background and problem-solving skills
  • an emerging track record of academic publications
  • an ability to work in a collaborative team environment
  • excellent communication skills
Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

ABOUT SERC
Science and Engineering Research Council (SERC) of A*STAR promotes public sector research and development in the sciences and engineering. At SERC, we:  
  • Support world-class research in A*STAR institutes in a wide range of fields including communications, AI data science, cybersecurity, modelling and simulations, materials, chemicals, microelectronics, manufacturing technologies and metrology;  
  • Plan and promote research in strategic areas to create knowledge and innovation that drive the development of knowledge-intensive industries;   
  • Eng an extensive network of industry partners via various programmes to facilitate a seamless flow of technologies from conception to commercialisation.  
JOB DESCRIPTION
A Senior Officer / Assistant Head in Infocomm Cluster of SERC is required to support the strategising and managing of A*STARs RD initiatives in digital technologies, such as: 
  • AI and Data Science 
  • Communications (eg. 5G) and Internet-of-Things
  • Digital trust technologies (e.g. privacy preservation and distributed ledger technologies) 
  • Cybersecurity Digital Twinning and Modelling Simulations 
Quantum Computing The officer will be part of a dynamic Infocomm Cluster team which shapes public sector research and innovation to deliver economic and societal outcomes for Singapore through:
  • Strategic planning, coordination, and collaborations in digital technology RD with Ministries Public ncies partners, research Institutes, Institutes of Higher Learning, and industry sectors  
  • Long-term RD planning and stakeher engments that shape and contribute directly to the national RD nda  
  • Technology foresighting and masterplanning to optimise RD investment portfolio and ensure alignment with national priorities   RD programme strategy development and design, which entails convening relevant public ncies, enterprises, and research entities (within A*STAR and from Institutes of Higher Learning) into collaboration programmes and securing necessary manment support and resources for programme initiation  RD programme execution and manment, including planning for subsequent technology translation and commercialisation  
  • Strategic development and reviews of digital technology capabilities in A*STAR Research Institutes   ??         Research proposals evaluation, project reviews and grant manment
JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • Background in Engineering, IT or Computer Science, with preferably 2 or more of working experience in these fields   
  • Ability to think strategically and analyse issues from different angles   
  • Knowledge in a broad range of digital technologies, digital industry, their trends, challenges, and potentials   
  • Passion in shaping research and innovation in digital technologies to bring about economic and societal outcomes for Singapore   
  • Proactive learning attitude, attention to details and results-oriented 
  • Comfortable with delivering outcomes in complex environment within challenging timelines

25,computer research,/en/job/clinical-research-coordinator-9366405,9366405,Clinical Research Coordinator,False,False,,,SGD,National Cancer Centre Singapore Pte Ltd,14 hours ago,False,,,199801562Z,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,National Cancer Centre Singapore,"

The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) has evolved over the past 20 years to become one of the leading regional centres for cancer treatment and research. It has pioneered the one-stop multi-disciplinary approach to cancer treatment and is now home to oncologists, surgeons and researchers, dedicated to the care and treatment of a growing number of cancer patients.

Today, NCCS see close to 65 per cent of the public sector oncology cases in Singapore. To deliver the latest cancer care and treatment, clinicians work closely with researchers who conduct robust cutting-edge clinical and translational research which has received international recognition.

NCCS strives to be a global leading cancer centre, and shares its expertise and knowledge by training the next generation of medical professionals.

","

As a clinical research coordinator, you will be actively involved in coordinating clinical trial activities according to the study protocol and in compliance to the ICH Good Clinical Practice guidelines and the Health Products (Therapeutic Products) Regulations under the Health Product Act.

You will support and assist the Principal Investigator in the following trial related activities:-

  • Patient screening and recruitment,
  • Monitor subject’s compliance to their treatment and follow-up,
  • Data collection and management including resolving data discrepancies,
  • Management of biological specimens (where applicable),
  • Monitor adverse events and safety reporting, maintain and organise the investigator site files, preparation and submissions to the ethics committee and where applicable, to the relevant local health authority,
  • Tracking of trial expenditures and timely invoicing (where applicable), etc. 

Requirements:

  • Degree in Life Sciences/Nursing, or Diploma in Nursing with minimum 6 years working experience as CRC
  • 2 years of related working experience an advantage
  • Knowledge in venepuncture/cannulation would be an added advantage
  • Good time-management and communication skills
  • Able to work independently and detailed oriented
  • Computer literate

column3: At the Cutting Edge of Medical Education

Duke-NUS Medical School (“Duke-NUS”) is Singapore's first and only US-style graduate medical school. Established as a landmark collaboration between Duke University and the National University of Singapore (NUS), Duke-NUS offers a holistic medical education against the backdrop of an extensive medical research that is integrated with the largest public healthcare cluster, the Singapore Health Services (“SingHealth”). This is an opportunity to perform a significant role in Singapore’s healthcare infrastructure and biomedical landscape.

Job Description
The Chronobiology and Sleep Laboratory (CSL) at Duke-NUS Medical School, Singapore, is seeking a postdoctoral fellow to carry out research under the theme of “Sleep and Learning”. The research fellow will lead research projects to identify factors that give rise to individual differences in sleep and learning in university students, and strategies for improving sleep and learning. The research fellow will be responsible for analyzing behavioral and physiologic datasets, and preparing reports and manuscripts. The fellow must have a strong track record of creativity and problem-solving, as evidenced by published work in peer-reviewed journals.    
 
Previous experience in sleep or learning research is preferred, but not required. Individuals with a background in the following areas will be considered: cognitive neuroscience, psychology, engineering, and computer science. Competitive applicants will have experience analyzing large data sets with a solid background in statistics.
Job Requirement
  • PhD degree in psychology, neuroscience, the life sciences, computer science, statistics, or engineering
  • Strong computer and analytical skills
  • Proficient in R, Python, Matlab and/or other programming languages.
The applicant should include a CV, cover letter, and writing sample (e.g., peer-reviewed publication or thesis). Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Fellow in the Department of Computer Science, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large scale experimental systems, and improving the well-being of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems.

The Research Fellow will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator on one or more research projects. The research fellow will help the Principal Investigator conduct research in Artificial Intelligence (AI) by offering new theoretical perspectives on and engineering approaches to human aware decision making. In particular, the research fellow is going to explore new conceptual and computing frameworks for decision making in complex, uncertain, and changing environments. Special focus will be placed on the underlying mechanisms and dynamics of integrating learning with planning and decision making, representation change, perception, communication, and interaction in real-world environments.

The candidate should possess experience or interest in at least one of the following research areas:

Decision-theoretic AI, relational and probabilistic modelling, causal modelling, statistical learning with multimodal information, planning and model-based reinforcement learning, transfer learning in sequential decision processes, knowledge- and data-driven representation, computational neuroscience, computational cognitive science, and AI applications in health and education

The position is available immediately. The initial term of appointment will be 1 year with possible extension to 2 years. The selected candidate will be offered strongly competitive salaries and benefits, support to travel for dissemination of research results, and substantial freedom to build a strong research profile of his/her own.

Qualifications

Job Requirements:

A PhD degree in relevant areas; strong system-building and management skills; keen interests in working with emerging technologies and frameworks; good communications skill in both written and verbal English.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
﻿
This job focuses on software development for robotic and computer vision systems.

This includes development of algorithms for robotics as well as enabling technologies such as computer vision.
Responsibilities:
  • Develop algorithms and implement software solutions for computer vision and robotics applications
  • Software development in C++/Python
  • Software testing, debugging and deployment
  • Hardware-software integration for developing robotics applications
  • Must be hands-on and work well within a team of hardware and software engineers
  • Technical write up and presentation
Job Requirements
  • Diploma/Bachelors in Robotics or Computer Science Engineering or relevant discipline
  • Programming/software development experience (GUI, drivers, Linux-based development)
  • Experience with robotics or computer vision will be advantageous
  • Willing to learn and adapt to new technology quickly
  • Technically motivated to solve problems, innovate and deliver on time to customers
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The National Dental Centre of Singapore is the first and largest dental specialty centre in Singapore. National Dental Centre of Singapore offers you a challenging career with unlimited opportunities. Come join our team and make a difference in the lives of people.
","

You will work closely with Assistant Director, Research and Director, Research in the translation of Oral HealthTech Innovation From NDCS and National Dental Research Institute Singapore (NDRIS) and building R&D partnerships with industry.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop translation and business prospects of Oral HealthTech Innovation primarily tissue engineering, oral microbiomics, and oral health medical devices.
  • Perform technology scans and follow technology trends to identify state-of-the-art and emerging technologies, systems and best practices relevant to Oral HealthTech Innovation
  • Advise the researchers and clinicians on the translations pathways and strategies for their research, including spinoff
  • Apply for suitable translation grants to scale-up the technologies and more market ready
  • Engage institutional and industrial contacts, facilitates communication, tracks progress and milestones and identifies opportunities and scope for enhancing the relationships.
  • Develop potential commercial applications and attract business partners for test-bedding, co-development and out-licensing Oral HealthTech Innovation
  • Involve in the structuring and negotiating term sheets and licenses for out0licensing of Oral HealthTech Innovation with external parties; liaising with SingHealth IP Office on IP Management.
  • Structure the collaboration agreements between NDCS/NDRIS and the external collaborator, and liaising with SingHealth Legal Office on contract drafting and revision
  • Overseeing internal diligence procedures prior to agreement signing
  • Develop new scientific and industrial partnerships, strategic joint ventures or startups for Oral HealthTech Innovation
  • Assists in the preparation of business plans for spin-off and proposal for co-development and test-bedding partnerships
  • Prepare technology offers, presentation and marketing materials for professional meetings, seminars, conference and trade shows. Follow-up on post-meetings or event to scope and coordinate the actionable items
  • Outreach to industry, government agencies and research institutions/universities, both locally and internationally to promote NDCS/NDRIS research expertise for partnership.

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • At least a Bachelor's Degree in Biomedical sciences, software engineering or computer science related to life-science is preferred.
  • Minimum 3-5 years' working experience in relevant technology assessment, business development; Technology transfer or commercialization experience in a medtech or startup environment is preferred.
  • Deep understanding and knowledge of medical technology innovation, translation and commercialization
  • Strong project management experience is required
  • Strong experience in dealing with difficult corporate partners and in negotiating complex deal structures and agreement for industrial collaborations.

Other criteria:

  • Resourceful, strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Customer centric, creative thinker and inquisitive
  • Ability to work independently with dedication and team-oriented approach
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

31,computer research,/en/job/research-associate-ocular-epidemiology-9354402,9354402,Research Associate (Ocular Epidemiology),False,False,3400,5000,SGD,Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI),22-Mar-22,False,,24 days,199704888Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC) was incorporated on 3 March 1989 and commenced operation in October 1990. It is the designated national centre for ophthalmology within Singapore’s public sector healthcare network, with a faculty of close to 80 ophthalmologists and more than 800 staff. SNEC spearheads and coordinates the provision of specialised ophthalmological services with emphasis on quality education and research.

SNEC manages more than 330,000 patient visits and performs over 35,000 surgeries and laser procedures annually.  The centre offers a full spectrum of subspecialties addressing every part of the eye – Cataract, Corneal & External Eye Disease, General Cataract & Comprehensive Ophthalmology, Glaucoma, Neuro-ophthalmology, Ocular Inflammation & Immunology, Oculoplastic, Paediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus, Refractive Surgery, Surgical and Medical Retina.

Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) was established in 1997 as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. It is the research arm of SNEC, and affiliated to the National University of Singapore (NUS) and the Duke-NUS Medical School, as part of the SingHealth-Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre.

Over the years, SERI has invested considerable resources into its research infrastructure and in the training of the next generation of clinician-scientists, clinician-researchers and scientists. In two decades, SERI has grown from a founding team of 5 to over 200 researchers, doctors and support staff, and is the largest eye research institute in the Asia-Pacific region.

A global leader in eye research, SERI ranks ahead of its counterparts in the US, UK and Japan in terms of ophthalmology publications per capita. Tapping on its close affiliation to SNEC, SERI is in the unique position to translate basic research into cutting edge clinical care by enabling the development of new treatments for a variety of eye diseases.

","

Established in 1997, SERI is Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI’s mission is to conduct high-impact eye research that prevents blindness, low vision and major eye diseases common to Singaporeans and Asians. Over the last decade, SERI has conducted landmark research projects that have led to tangible outcomes, patient benefits, and success stories. It has paved the way for significant improvements in how eye diseases are treated and prevented, not just for Singaporeans or Asians, but on a global scale.

SERI has grown from a founding team of five in 1997 to a faculty of more than 238 staff, encompassing clinician scientists, scientists, research fellows, PhD students and support staff. This makes SERI one of the largest research institutes in Singapore, as well as the largest eye research institute in the Asia Pacific region. SERI has also over 230 adjunct faculties from various eye departments, biomedical institutes and tertiary centres in Singapore. SERI has published an impressive array of 4,504 scientific papers, and has secured external peer-reviewed competitive grants worth more than $360 million. As of August 2021, SERI’s faculty has been awarded with more than 755 national and international prizes and filed 145 patents.

Are you searching for an opportunity to apply/develop your skills and expertise? Joining the SERI family would provide you the chance to join a global team and learn alongside with one of the top and globally renowned researchers, as well as develop your knowledge and skills further in a team-oriented, flexible and friendly working environment!

The Ocular Epidemiological Research Group at SERI conducts ophthalmic epidemiologic research via machine learning in Singapore and Asia under the Singapore Epidemiology of Eye Diseases (SEED) programme. SEED aims to determine the biomarkers, risk factors for cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease and impact of major age-related eye diseases, including age-related macular degeneration, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, and vision impairment via machine learning. We conduct large population-based studies and multi-centre collaboration research with a particular focus on diseases that are prevalent in Asia-Pacific. In addition, together with Retina and Glaucoma Research Groups at SERI, we are conducting several clinical projects, collectively involving over 100,000 study subjects, with comprehensive image and genetic data.

We are inviting suitably qualified candidates for the position of Research Associate for machine learning under the Singapore Epidemiology of Eye Diseases (SEED) programme.

For the role of a Research Associate, you will be working in the Ocular Epidemiology Research Group with the following (but not limited to) responsibilities,

  • Assist Principal Investigator (PI) and Research Fellow in developing study plans and conduct literature reviews to aid grant applications and scientific manuscripts.
  • Prepare reports and ethics applications
  • Perform image processing (e.g. Python, MATLAB).
  • Perform data validation and analysis using advanced data analytics software (e.g., SPSS, STATA, SAS).
  • Perform data validation and analysis using advanced machine learning platforms (e.g., TensorFlow, Caffe, pytorch, etc.).
  • Coordinate and communicate with funding organizations, and collaborators
  • Assist in study execution, managing project timelines, and participate in the preparation of abstracts, posters and presentations
  • Interpret and present study results
  • Train and manage junior coordinators and students
  • Perform other related or additional duties assigned by the PI

Requirements:

  • A Master’s degree in computer science, computer vision, robotics, public health, biostatistics or relevant disciplines is preferable
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Advanced knowledge in statistical analysis and machine learning
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and to multi-task several projects at a time
  • An analytical mind, drive and dynamic personality
  • He/ She can additionally be assured of a fulfilling and challenging career in a fast-paced and dynamic organization. We strongly encourage continuous education and development through our in-house training programmes and external courses.

Note: Package offered will commensurate with qualifications and experience.

",[],Senior Executive,,,Master's Degree,,Contract,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9354402&advertisement_id=9352773&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,701718,Outram,sg

32,computer research,/en/job/research-analyst-asian-institute-of-digital-finance-9410910,9410910,"Research Analyst, Asian Institute of Digital Finance",False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,24-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The Asian Institute of Digital Finance (AIDF) is a university-level institute in NUS, jointly founded by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), the National Research Foundation (NRF) and NUS. AIDF aspires to be a thought leader, a Fintech knowledge hub, and an experimental site for developing digital financial technologies as well as for nurturing current and future Fintech researchers and practitioners in Asia.


We invite applications for the position of Research Analyst who will be housed in the Department of Computer Science, School of Computing (SoC) under Principle Investigator, Professor Liang Zhenkai for research grant ref: NRF/UP#1, titled: 'Security and identity management of digital infrastructure for FinTech services.'


We are strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems and improving the wellbeing of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems.

Qualifications

The Research Analyst will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects under the NRF grant. He/she should possess experience or interest in at least one of the following research areas:

  • Security
  • Systems and Networking


Job requirements:

  • A Bachelor's degree with Honours  in a relevant area;
  • Programming skills in C/C++.
  • Experience in research.
  • Experiences with the following areas will be preferred
    • Program analysis
    • System/OS kernel development
    • Audit log analysis
    • Trusted hardware programming
Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Organization: Asian Institute of Digital Finance

Department : FinTech Research

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 13785
