column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

column2: As part of an integrated academic health system, NUH is committed to transforming care, shaping the next generation of healthcare professionals and leveraging translational research to improve health outcomes. ","
A clinical research coordinator will assist Principal Investigator or Co-investigators to monitor the administration and progress of a clinical trial.
The Challenges
  • Oversee overall clinical operations related to the conduct of the clinical trials.
  • To adhere to compliance with Research Governance, Good Clinical Practice, Data Protection and Ethical Requirements.
  • To ensure the study and study procedures are conducted in accordance with the study protocol
  • To participate in patient recruitment.
  • To ensure study entry criteria are fulfilled.
  • To ensure informed consent procedure is followed.
  • To coordinate patient visits for future tests and procedures.
  • To schedule visit according to study protocol.
  • To organize and participate in site initiation visit.
  • To work in collaboration with study team to ensure trial preparedness.
  • To monitor patients throughout the study to ensure study drugs are given according to protocol requirement.
  • To arrange for clinical and laboratory investigations to be carried out according to protocol.
  • Ensure results of investigations and X-ray films are collected.
  • Maintains records of additional investigations for invoicing purposes.
  • To collects and collates research data, ensuring its accuracy and completeness.
  • Ensure timely and accurate transcription of information on source documents, paper case report forms (CRFs), or electronic CRFs.
  • To label and ensure biological specimens are delivered in the correct conditions as specified in the trial protocol.
  • To assist investigator(s) in adverse events / serious adverse events reporting.
  • To maintain confidentiality on patient data.
  • To work with pharmacy to maintain drug accountability logs.
  • To raise payment request forms for billing to companies
  • Creation and maintenance of all trial files, including the trial master file, and oversight of site files.
  • To work with company in developing and implementing recruitment plan to ensure long-term recruitment target is met.
Job Requirements:
Qualification:
  • A life science degree or nursing degree is preferred. The relevant degree subject area is life and biomedical science.
  • Experience:
  • Scientific qualification preferred but other suitable qualification will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team.
  • Good patient interaction skills.
  • Be flexible and self-motivated.
  • Ability to write clearly
  • Possess excellent organisational skills.
  • Enjoy paying attention to detail.
  • Computer literacy.
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
Please indicate in the subject title as: ""Applying for position of “Clinical Research Coordinator_ Haematology-Oncology (Contract)”
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Borries Pte. Ltd. develops and manufactures specialised scanning electron microscope dedicated to image known and unknown viruses. It can not only be used in research but also in health institutes like hospitals. We want to be part of the global effort to prevent pandemics from happening again.","

Job Description:

The Senior Software Engineer performs research, prototyping, design, development, integration and/or sustaining of full stack of web-based applications for our cutting-edge virus diagnostic equipment.

Responsibility:

  • Research and comprehend contemporary concepts in computer science in order to integrate full software for equipment, desktop computers and the cloud. column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As part of an integrated academic health system, NUH is committed to transforming care, shaping the next generation of healthcare professionals and leveraging translational research to improve health outcomes. The hospital is also the principal teaching hospital for the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry.

The Challenges
  • The jobholder will be part of the team conducting the “BREAst screening Tailored for HEr (BREATHE)” programme (https://blog.nus.edu.sg/breathe/); assisting Principal Investigator or Co-investigators in the building and monitoring of the administration and progress of a screening program.
  • To adhere to compliance with Research Governance, Good Clinical Practice, Data Protection and Ethical Requirements.
  • To ensure the study and study procedures are conducted in accordance with the study protocol.
  • To conduct patient recruitment.
  • To ensure study entry criteria are fulfilled.
  • To ensure informed consent procedure is followed.
  • To coordinate participant visits for future tests and procedures.
  • To schedule visit according to study protocol.
  • To work in collaboration with study team to ensure program preparedness.
  • To arrange for screening investigations to be carried out according to protocol.
  • Ensure results of investigations and mammographic/ultrasound reports are collected.
  • To collect and collate research data, ensuring its accuracy and completeness.
  • Ensure timely and accurate transcription of information on source documents, paper case report forms (CRFs), or electronic CRFs.
  • To label and ensure biological specimens are delivered in the correct conditions as specified in the protocol.
  • To maintain confidentiality on patient data.
The Requirements
  • Preferably a relevant degree/diploma in Life Science or Biomedical Science, and with knowledge and experience in conducting research. Entry level candidates are welcome to apply.
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team.
  • Possesses a self-initiated and self-motivated attitude with flexibility.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to write clearly.
  • Enjoys paying attention to detail.
  • Computer literacy.
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The Institute of Microelectronics (IME) is a research institute of A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, with an aim to add value to Singapore’s semiconductor ecosystem by developing strategic competencies, innovative technologies and intellectual property, and enabling enterprises to be technologically competitive. R&D at IME focuses on the semiconductor technology chain, such as smart integrated circuit design, wafer fabrication process technology, packaging and assembly and reliability testing and analysis. IME has also established application-driven programmes with its R&D efforts focused in new technologies such as IoT on the Edge, Heterogeneous Integration, System in Package, Sensors, Actuators & Microsystems, Power Electronics and Medtech.","

關於華碩

華碩為美國《財富》雜誌評比「世界最受推崇企業之一」，並榮登美國《富比士》雜誌「全球最受信賴企業排行榜」及英國《路透社》「全球科技100強」。產品類別橫跨主機板、顯示卡、筆記型電腦、智慧手機、螢幕、路由器及全方位的科技產品解決方案，並積極拓展電競產品及開創AIOT新領域的各種應用。華碩致力追尋無與倫比的科技創新，為全球使用者創造體貼人心的智慧生活與無所不在的幸福感，以成為「數位新世代備受推崇的科技創新領導企業」為品牌願景。華碩全球員工數約14,500人，擁有世界級研發菁英超過5,000人，產品行銷全球70多個國家，營業額超過100億美元。

For more details, please visit https://www.asus.com/sg/.

We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The National University of Singapore invites applications for Research Assistant for Cardio-Sleep related research study in the Department of Medicine, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine.  Cardio-Sleep team is recruiting research assistant. We are seeking motivated personals to join our team to investigate therapeutic potentials of sleep medicine in the cardiac protection and remodeling. Position and salary will be offered based on educational background and research experiences. The job is available immediately and will be initially contracted for one year and renewable on satisfactory performance.

Purpose of the post

The Research Assistant (RA) will be responsible to, and work closely with, the Principal Investigator and study team members to ensure the successful completion of the trial on time. The RA's principal role will be to work in general practices such as recruitment, questionnaires administrating, data collection, data entry, data analysis and related sleep study activities. Secondary role includes ad-hoc administrative duties.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

The Research Assistant will liaise with the relevant personnel and authorities in hospital to smooth the process of recruitment and data collection and will be accountable to the Principle Investigator (PI). The RA will be able to:

  1. Oversee the general management of the project; 
  2. Provide administrative and secretarial support to the project, such as organizing regular meetings to maintain regular communication with other members of the research team and collaborate with the study sites;
  3. Undertake the day to day running of the project at the study site, e.g.  Collaborate with team members at the study sites, recruitment, conducting of questionnaires, biological measurements, data collection at hospitals/participants' homes;
  4. Coordinating and conducting of research related sleep study for the recruited subjects, e.g. setting up, monitoring, overseeing overnight study;
  5. Conduct literature searches, using SPSS system to enter data, and analyse data and maintain trial database, as well as assist in preparing both progress and final reports of the project;
  6. Research paper drafting and/or writing;
  7. Maintain the highest standard of professional conduct and record keeping in accordance with policies and procedures; 
  8. Assist with any other duties of a similar nature that are delegated by the PI.
Qualifications

The applicant should:

  1. Bachelor's Degree in Medical Laboratory Science / Biomedical Science or equivalent, degree in Science, nursing/medicine or related disciplines are also welcome; preferably with some experience in sleep medicine and/or research;
  2. be able to work independently and in a team, have an investigative nature, attention to detail; and
  3. have knowledge of computer applications, e.g. SPSS, MS office, PowerPoint, SAP, RemLogic.
  4. have experiences in the sleep medicine areas of research will be an added advantage; preferably able to conduct, reads and score sleep study and CPAP titration.

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Additional Information

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

Department : Medicine

Employee Referral Eligible: No

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. Job Description

The National University of Singapore invites applications for a Research Assistant in the Department of Medicine, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine.

Main duties and responsibilities

The Research Assistant will be responsible to work closely with the Principal Investigator (PI) and his study team to successfully deliver research outcomes in the areas of ageing, stroke and cardiovascular diseases.

An emphasis will be placed on prospective candidates' abilities to design studies that crosses different techniques involving cell biology and medication interventions.

Familiarity and experience with laboratory techniques including ELISA, PCR, sample processing and/or immunohistochemistry are important requirements.

Preference will be given to candidates who are able to analyse omics data and with familiarity with statistical softwares including SPSS or R.  

Qualifications

The applicant should:

  1. Have a good degree in life sciences, biomedical sciences, biochemistry, or equivalent from a well-recognized university, with a minimum of 2 years experience.
  2. Able to work independently and in a team, and must have good interpersonal and communication skills
  3. Possess good organizational skills
  4. Have knowledge of common computer applications, e.g. MS office, PowerPoint, Excel, SPSS, 'R', Stata etc

Appointments will be made on a yearly contract basis with the possibility of extension.

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

COVID-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for successful employment with NUS.

The Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) is Singapore’s fourth public university, and one of the first universities in the world to incorporate the art and science of design and technology into a multi-disciplinary curriculum. SUTD was established in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and seeks to advance knowledge and nurture technically-grounded leaders and innovators to serve societal needs.

Also in collaboration with Zhejiang University and Singapore Management University, SUTD, a research-intensive university, is distinguished by its unique East and West academic programmes which incorporate elements of entrepreneurship, management and design thinking. Graduate opportunities include the SUTD Technology Entrepreneurship programme, the Master of Science in Security by Design, and various SUTD PhD programmes. www.sutd.edu.sg.

","

iTrust, Centre for Research in Cyber Security at SUTD, seeks to hire a qualified individual to fill the position of Deputy/Manager. He/she will report to the iTrust Center Director or nominee to assist in:

  1. Day-to-day iTrust office and lab operations and administration;
  2. Managing a new programme to award scholarships to recipients enrolled in SUTD’s Masters Programme; and
  3. Publicity and outreach efforts (newsletter, website, visits, internships etc.)

An ideal candidate would be an independent and resourceful individual with project management (finance, HR, reporting, administrative) and events experience. Interactions with faculty, staff, as well as personnel from the government and industry will form part of the duties of the Deputy/Manager, requiring effective interpersonal and communication (writing, presentation etc.) skills.

Applicants must have acquired:

  1. a degree in any field (preferably engineering); and
  2. at least 3-years of work experience with demonstrated abilities of the above duties.

Good writing skills would be a plus. Knowledge in cyber security and computer networking is advantageous though not mandatory.

Knowledge in cyber security, Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) or technology translation and transfer is advantageous though not mandatory.

column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

We are committed to build advanced technologies to help hospitals diagnose medical conditions of patients. Founded in Singapore, we are a rapidly growing machine learning company. We have a strong team of deep learning scientists, software engineers and medical experts, and are currently inviting aspiring individuals to join us to create huge and meaningful impact to the medical industry in Asia.

","

Research Engineer - Machine Learning

About us

BioMind is a multiple award-winning Artificial Intelligence (AI) company providing machine intelligence solutions to assist in diagnosis and treatment. We pride ourselves in empowering physicians through our proprietary deep learning applications. Driven by a large multidisciplinary group of medical, data science and regulatory specialists, we envision to scale AI-enabled healthcare expertise globally.

What are we looking for

A strong technical guy with a geeky background like Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics who loves programming, solves tough problems, fascinated by Math and Physics and wants to learn artificial intelligence and build deep learning models. Machine learning background is not a requirement.

The Candidate

Our aim is to align you with the activities which truly interest you; will stretch you technically; help you grow and impact on billions of patients.

Some of the things you will learn

  • Computer Vision / Image Segmentation, Localisation, Classification
  • Deep Learning Techniques, Research Techniques, Paper Writing
  • Deep learning tools: TensorFlow, NumPy, Pandas, Sklearn, SciPy, Seaborn
  • Building deep learning models, understanding the learning mechanisms
  • Learning from professors from MIT, NUS, Tsinghua.
  • Interacting with top neurologists and doctors

Education

Master / Ph.D. in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Engineering.

We can offer you

  • Master, Teach, Learn – The opportunity to work with, learn from and share knowledge with ultra-smart colleagues in a culture of collaboration and technical excellence. We groom our employees and make sure that they stay at the cutting edge of the technology stack.
  • Impact – Huge potential to make a positive contribution across our business, people and partners
  • Remuneration – Competitive pay with share award for top performers.

Job Description

Applications are invited for the following full-time position in the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health:
Research Assistant x 1 (1 year minimum, up to 3 years)


A research assistant position is available in the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health to support a Principal Investigator in research projects in the areas of non-communicable disease (cardiovascular) epidemiology, Modelling Metrics and digital health.

Major duties and responsibility of the post includes managing, extracting, analysing and document data from databases or raw datasets. In addition, candidate is required to do report writing, presentations, and publication of results and findings in peer-reviewed journals. Furthermore, he/she will need to contribute to development and writing of research grant proposals.

Candidate must be an independent mature worker who is well-organized and has an eye for details.

Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. He/she must possess the ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals. Good proficiency in the following areas is essential:
1. Statistical software (R, Stata or Python).
2. Microsoft Office Applications, particularly MS Word, Excel (preferably with proficiency in Visual Basic)

Good proficiency and experience in the following areas is preferred:
1. R (preferred), Stata or Python
2. Scientific writing
3. Survey design
4. Desirable: qualitative research
5. Desirable: knowledge of reading ECG's or willingness to learn

Recruitment is open immediately and will continue until the position is filled. Applicants should send a brief statement of interest, CV, three named references, and other supporting documents during the application.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Qualifications

The successful applicant is expected to possess at least a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Statistics, or a Master's degree in Public Health with a strong quantitative background. Alternatively, Bachelor's degree in computer science or Mathematics, with relevant experience in data science may be considered.

column1: 53,computer research,/en/job/senior-associate-data-management-support-platform-9381450,9381450,Senior Associate (Data Management Support Platform),False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI),24-Mar-22,False,,24 days,199704888Z,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC) was incorporated on 3 March 1989 and commenced operation in October 1990. It is the designated national centre for ophthalmology within Singapore’s public sector healthcare network, with a faculty of close to 80 ophthalmologists and more than 800 staff. SNEC spearheads and coordinates the provision of specialised ophthalmological services with emphasis on quality education and research.

SNEC manages more than 330,000 patient visits and performs over 35,000 surgeries and laser procedures annually.  The centre offers a full spectrum of subspecialties addressing every part of the eye – Cataract, Corneal & External Eye Disease, General Cataract & Comprehensive Ophthalmology, Glaucoma, Neuro-ophthalmology, Ocular Inflammation & Immunology, Oculoplastic, Paediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus, Refractive Surgery, Surgical and Medical Retina.

Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) was established in 1997 as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. It is the research arm of SNEC, and affiliated to the National University of Singapore (NUS) and the Duke-NUS Medical School, as part of the SingHealth-Duke-NUS Academic Medical Centre.

Over the years, SERI has invested considerable resources into its research infrastructure and in the training of the next generation of clinician-scientists, clinician-researchers and scientists. In two decades, SERI has grown from a founding team of 5 to over 200 researchers, doctors and support staff, and is the largest eye research institute in the Asia-Pacific region.

A global leader in eye research, SERI ranks ahead of its counterparts in the US, UK and Japan in terms of ophthalmology publications per capita. Tapping on its close affiliation to SNEC, SERI is in the unique position to translate basic research into cutting edge clinical care by enabling the development of new treatments for a variety of eye diseases.

","

  • To do data management and De-identification of research projects.
  • To create and maintain the documents related to data management/de-identification of different projects assigned.
  • To coordinate with project coordinator for different research projects.
  • Other ad-hoc administrative duties as and when assigned by the supervisor.

Job Requirements

  • Diploma in computer science or IT related / computer science.
  • Meticulous, attention to details to complex data.
  • Familiarity with computer systems and software. Knowledge of access or related database preferred.
  • Effective time management and organizational skills.
  • Good team player.
  • Able to multitask and work efficiently as part of a team or independently, depending on the assigned task and on the situation.

The National Heart Centre Singapore (NHCS) is a national and regional referral centre for cardiovascular diseases. It provides one-stop comprehensive preventive, diagnostic, therapeutic and rehabilitative cardiac services for heart patients.

Each year, NHCS handles over 120,000 outpatient consultations, 9,000 interventional and surgical procedures and 10,000 inpatients. Its clinical outcomes for heart attack treatment, balloon angioplasty with stenting and coronary bypass surgery have been shown to be equivalent to international standards.
Established in 1998, NHCS is the pioneer in cardiovascular care in Singapore.

","

We are looking for a research fellow with medical background, and interest in cardiac imaging, risk prediction and Artificial Intelligence (AI). You will be part of the Cardiovascular Systems Imaging and AI team reporting to the Principal Investigator. The team will work with local and global research institutions, and multiple industry partners. You are responsible for the progress of the research projects under your care and are expected to demonstrate research expertise and capability, such as in the area of cardiac CT imaging. You will assist the Principal Investigator to lead and supervise junior researchers and be involved in research collaborations. The selected candidate will be offered employment on 2-year renewable contractual terms.

  • Medical Degree and PhD in Life Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
  • Experience in biomedical engineering, biological/life science or related research field is preferred
  • General laboratory experience
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting
  • Good organisational skills

Job Description

A research associate position is available in the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health to support the Principal Investigators in research projects in the areas of statistical genetics and multi-omics.

The group focuses on epidemiology of common human diseases and complex traits. The position emphasize on analyses of longitudinal epidemiological data and high-dimensional data derived from high-throughput technologies such as genome-wide genotyping/sequencing, methylation, metabolomics, proteomics to understand the pathogenesis of one or more of these diseases.

One of the primary projects is the National Precision Medicine Programme. It is a ten-year roadmap to prepare Singapore for precision medicine. Whole genome sequencing and methylation data will be generated in the next three years. Novel methods to process, perform quality control and association analyses will be the major focus.

Major duties and responsibility of the post includes managing, extracting, analysing data from omics datasets. In addition, candidate is required to do report writing, presentations, and publication of results and findings in peer-reviewed journals. Furthermore, he/she will need to contribute to development and writing of research grant proposals.

Candidate must be an independent mature worker who is well-organized and has an eye for details. Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. He/she must possess the ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals.

Qualifications

Good proficiency in the following areas is essential:

  1. Statistical software (R)
  2. File management and data analysis in the Unix/Linux environment
  3. Perl or Python
  4. Microsoft Office Applications, particularly MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel (preferably with proficiency in Visual Basic)

The successful applicant is expected to possess at least a Master's in genetics, statistics, computational biology, bioinformatics, computer science or mathematics. Relevant experience in data analyses will be considered.

Recruitment is open immediately, and will continue until the position is filled.

For further enquiries, please contact Dr Sim Xueling at ephsx@nus.edu.sg. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

column2: About Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: A*STAR is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: About the Institute of High Performing Computing (IHPC)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
The Institute of High Performing Computing (IHPC) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, committed to advancing science and technology, and develop leading edge applications through high performance computing and computational science. IHPC seeks to promote and spearhead scientific advances and technological innovations through computational modelling, simulation and AI, and to develop impactful applications to further economic growth and improve lives. IHPC’s research foci are in computing science and AI; large scale complex systems modelling; social and cognitive computing; and computational engineering mechanics, fluidic dynamics, electronics and photonics, materials science and chemistry.","

column1: * Build world-class capabilities and excellence in Resilient and Sustainable AI to be recognized by international research communities
* Work with AI scientists in IHPC to develop resilient and sustainable AI algorithms and solve challenging real-world problems, and publish high-impact papers to advance science
* Execute programmes to ensure timely delivery of project milestones with high-quality outcomes
Requirements
* PhD degree in Computer Science/Electrical & Electronics Engineering/Computer Engineering or equivalent
* Research experience in one or more areas of AI, such as Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Natural Language Processing.
* Knowledge in one of the AI programming frameworks, e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX;
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills

* Strong communication and presentation skills

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
﻿
We seek a passionate and committed candidate to work on the fabrication and development of quantum devices with the long-term goal of building a scalable and error free quantum computer and related quantum metrology. The design of relevant quantum devices and the development fabrication recipes for realising such devices will be a crucial area of research and development.
This position resides in the Quantum Materials and Devices group at the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE), A*STAR. As part of our research team, you will contribute to the fabrication of devices and document process recipes for our research in quantum devices with the goal of building qubits in 2-dimensional (2D) material platforms. You will also participate in the measurement of the devices including setting up of measurement protocols, data collection and analysis.
Main Responsibilities
  • Design and fabrication of 2D material-based devices.
  • Develop process fabrication and etching recipes.
  • Contribute to device characterization and measurements.
  • Provide technical documentation and manuscript writing.
  • Contribute to or lead in grant writing depending on level of experience.
Job Requirements
  • PhD degree in physics, applied physics, materials science, electrical-electronics engineering, or related fields.
  • Laboratory experience in materials processing and device fabrication. Well-versed in lithography and etching techniques. Experience with 2-dimensional materials strongly preferred.
  • Ability to work unsupervised and collaboratively with a team.
  • Resourceful in problem solving and critical thinking.
  • Meticulous and analytical in experimental work.
  • Good presentation skills (written and verbal).
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

A research assistant position is available in the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health to support the Principal Investigators in research projects in the areas of statistical genetics and multi-omics.

The group focuses on epidemiology of common human diseases and complex traits. The position emphasize on analyses of longitudinal epidemiological data and high-dimensional data derived from high-throughput technologies such as genome-wide genotyping/sequencing, methylation, metabolomics, proteomics to understand the pathogenesis of one or more of these diseases.

One of the primary projects is the Diabetes Study in Nephropathy And other Microvascular Complications (DYNAMO). DYNAMO aims to determine the genes and processes involved in the development of diabetic kidney disease, to identify them for earlier intervention. We have measured genomics, lipidomics and proteomics across diabetic samples in the community and hospitals. Outcomes and phenotypic traits are to be analysed with the multi-omics data to derive insights on the pathways to developing diabetes complications.

Major duties and responsibility of the post includes managing, extracting, analysing data from omics datasets. In addition, candidate is required to do report writing, presentations, and publication of results and findings in peer-reviewed journals. Furthermore, he/she will need to contribute to development and writing of research grant proposals.

Candidate must be an independent mature worker who is well-organized and has an eye for details. Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. He/she must possess the ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals.

Qualifications

Good proficiency in the following areas is essential:

  1. Statistical software (R)
  2. File management and data analysis in the Unix/Linux environment
  3. Perl or Python
  4. Microsoft Office Applications, particularly MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel (preferably with proficiency in Visual Basic)

The successful applicant is expected to possess at least a Bachelor's in genetics, statistics, computational biology, bioinformatics, computer science or mathematics. Relevant experience in data analyses will be considered.

Recruitment is open immediately, and will continue until the position is filled.

For further enquiries, please contact Dr Sim Xueling at ephsx@nus.edu.sg. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

Job Description for process and ultra-high vacuum specialist
We are looking for a passionate and committed candidate to work on the development and characterization of quantum materials with the long-term goal of building a scalable quantum computer. A key requirement for developing such technologies is that device fabrication and advanced characterization processes need to be developed.
This position resides in the Quantum Materials and Devices group at the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE), A*STAR. Being part of our research team, you will contribute to the development of fabrication process recipes and the maintenance of research equipment critical to our research in quantum materials including but not limited to 2-dimensional (2D) semiconductor devices, topological insulator devices and conventional semiconductor devices.
Main Responsibilities
  • Development of process fabrication recipes
  • Maintenance and servicing of ultra-high vacuum systems.
  • Occasional prototyping and upgrading of experimental systems.
  • Assistance with device characterization.
  • Technical documentation.
Job Requirements
  • Minimally a bachelor’s degree in physics, or applied physics, or semiconductor process engineering related fields. Related postgraduate degrees are a bonus.
  • Laboratory experience in semiconductor device fabrication processes and familiar with vacuum technology. Ability to build ad hoc instrumentation is a bonus.
  • Ability to work unsupervised and collaboratively with a team.
  • Resourceful in problem solving and critical thinking
  • Meticulous and analytical in experimental work.
  • Good presentation skills (written and verbal).
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

The National University of Singapore invites applications for Research Assistant for Department of Urology, National University Hospital. Our department provide clinical care to current patients in need of excellent, peer reviewed ethical management, and we lead in providing for future patients by contributing to teaching undergraduate medical students healthcare professionals and innovative research. More information on the department is available at http://medicine.nus.edu.sg/medsur/. This research position will be made on a 1-year contract basis in the first instance, with the possibility of extension.

Purpose of the post

We are looking for a highly motivated Research Assistant candidate to join our research programme focusing on Kidney Cancer and Kidney Transplant. The candidate is expected to work in a dynamic and multidisciplinary environment. The candidate will be responsible to, and work closely with the Principal Investigator and study team members to ensure the successful completion of the studies on time.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

The candidate will organize and coordinate the studies, and support the team to analyze the data and write up reports in time.

The candidate will be able to:

  1. Oversee the general management of the project as the Study Administrator;
  2. Screen and recruit patients for appropriate studies
  3. Work independently: conduct literature search, analyze data, prepare both progress and final reports of the project.
  4. Maintain the highest standard of professional conduct and record-keeping in accordance with policies and procedures;
  5. Handle DSRB/IRB applications and submissions
  6. Provide assistance and training to other staff or students when necessary;
  7. Provide support to the research group as delegated by the PI.
Qualifications
  1. A bachelor degree in biology or similar; preferably with experience in research
  2. A good publication record
  3. Ability to work independently and in a team, an investigative nature, attention to details
  4. Experience in computer applications, e.g. Photoshop, Excel, MS office, PowerPoint and SPSS.

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

Applications are invited for several research assistant positions at the National University of Singapore (NUS) in the area of Automated Program Repair.
These positions will be part of a Singapore Ministry of Education (MoE) Tier 3, multi-year research program named ""Automated Program Repair"" which has been funded 2022-2027. This is a large research program involving several research projects in analysis, verification, test generation and applications related to program repair.
To see work done on program repair at NUS, kindly see the webpage https://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~abhik/projects/Repair/index.html
In the new program, we will take this work forward further. The vision of our research program is to retain the workflows of software construction as they exist today in the form of Continuous Integration (CI) systems, and yet support automated software evolution with formal correctness guarantees, thereby engendering trust in automatically generated code. Our research program can help achieve such a vision via analysis, verification, and test generation. Applications of repair studied in the program will include security vulnerability repair, patch transplantation across versions of major software systems such as Linux, as well as the use of repair in intelligent tutoring system that we have developed at NUS, for teaching programming.

Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree
- CV, including relevant courses taken and unofficial transcripts
- Project or research experience
- Names of two referees
The faculty members involved in this research program are Wei-Ngan Chin, Abhik Roychoudhury (Lead PI) and Ilya Sergey, all from NUS Computer Science. The research assistant will be located in the Computer Science Department of NUS, which enjoys a high degree of academic reputation.
Emails by interested applicants may be directed to Abhik Roychoudhury
abhik@comp.nus.edu.sg

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. IT Support Executive Job Description:

The staff is responsible for setup, monitoring and maintaining Servers, Computer Systems and Networks. He/She is expected to work under the guidance of the manager and resolve the issues independently from firm-wide problems to individual users, and be able to troubleshoot effectively, isolate the problem and dispatch the call to the next level, if necessary. · Maintain and administer computer networks and related computing environments including LAN, systems software, applications, hardware, and configurations. Ensure system readiness through routine maintenance tasks such as data backup, software updates and system monitoring.

· Manage IT Ticketing System, summary and reporting analysis periodically

Job Description
To perform physiological measurements for research subjects in the NUHS Cardiovascular Imaging Core Lab (CICL).
The Challenges
  • Perform echocardiography, vascular studies, ambulatory ECG (Holter) and other procedures for participants enrolled in research studies.
  • Data handling after each procedure: Entering measurements/results in the Cardiac Information System, spreadsheets and other databases, keeping records of all procedures done, backing up and ensuring integrity and privacy of data.
  • Perform off-line measurements and data analyses for research studies.
  • Interact with other CICL technologists, clinical research coordinators and other research staff to ensure smooth logistic flow.
  • Deal with research participants with courtesy and respect.
  • Maintain the cleanliness and orderliness of the working area and CICL in general.
The Requirements
Qualification
  • Trained cardiovascular technologist, possessing diploma in Medical Technology/ Biomedical Science/Nursing or equivalent
Experience
  • Possess over 2 years of experience as a cardiovascular technologist.
  • Experienced in performing transthoracic echocardiography.
  • Experienced in performing ECG and ambulatory ECG analyses.
Skills
  • Possess strong interpersonal skills.
  • Good written and communication skills.
  • Computer literacy skills.

Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Signium is an established global recruitment and placement agency which has a network of 44 offices, strategically located in 28 countries and supported by 150+ highly qualified consultants.

In the ASEAN Market, Signium International is represented by Signium Singapore.

Our team has extensive recruitment and placement experiences serving all ASEAN countries since 2008.

Visit us at https://www.signium.com/location/singapore/

","

About Us

At SIGNIUM, we grasp every opportunity to surprise others and ourselves by going beyond expectations to deliver that extra. We call it exceeding potential. To inspire and excite people, teams, even entire organizations. To bring companies’ strategies to life. To unlock potential, realize ambitions, and change lives.

SIGNIUM is a global partnership executive search and leadership consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

+70 years in Executive Search and Leadership Consulting, our 150+ consultants serve clients in more than 46 cities across 30 countries. We offer three core solutions.

·      Assessment and Succession

·      Executive Search

·      Leadership Development

Visit www.signium.com for more information

The Role

The role of the Research Consultant is integral to the success of SIGNIUM. Best-in-class research provides access to competitive market intelligence that equips our internal team to excel in the marketplace. The Research Consultant works closely with internal Partners/Directors to conduct name generation exercises for executive searches, provide business development support and execute specialty projects to map the competitive landscape.

We are currently recruiting several Research Consultants to join SIGNIUM’s South-East Asia region. SIGNIUM is a market leader in the Consumer, Financial Services, Industrial, Life Science and Technology sectors. The Research Consultant will have the opportunity to join this world class team.

Key Accountabilities

Specific responsibilities for this role include:

Identifying Candidates: The Research Consultant will work on projects spanning various industry sectors and job functions. The varied nature of each project requires the Research Consultant to hone their ability to think critically and uniquely about each role to identify the most relevant executives for each project. The Research Consultant will then utilize phone calls, search engines, printed resources, our proprietary database to effectively locate these executives.

Market Intelligence: Working closely with other members of the SIGNIUM team, the Research Consultant will work on special projects aimed to provide pointed market insights for business development and project execution purposes.

Data Maintenance: Good data is non-negotiable in our business. The Research Consultant will continuously update our proprietary database with relevant details and information. The continuous update of this system allows SIGNIUM to stay abreast of executive moves and marketplaces changes and trends.

Business Development Support to Partners and Consultants: The role of the Research Consultant begins before a project has been won. The Research Consultant will actively support Partners/Directors with business development activities. This support can include, but is not limited to, creating information packs to brief the Partner/Director, providing research support for specific client meetings, as well as proactively identifying potential candidates.

RESEARCH ASSOCIATE CHARACTERISTICS AND ATTRIBUTES

The ideal Research Consultant is a highly motivated and intellectually curious individual aspiring to build a successful career in Executive Search. An outside-of-the-box thinker and self-starter who is able to maintain meticulous attention to detail while understanding macro-level industry concepts and trends. This individual will possess the ability to work in a fast-paced and unstructured environment, balance multiple projects and produce best in class research in a timely manner.

Skills & Experience

·      1-5 Years’ experience as Admin/HR support executive, business/marketing/sales support functions, researcher in executive search business or any related business support functions.

·      Excellent communication skills with strong interpersonal, oral, and business writing skills.

·      Strong telephone presence and confidence.

·      Must be computer literate and knowledgeable of resources available on the Internet.

·      Must be comfortable operating in a highly professional environment.

·      Flexibility and team behaviour.

·      Energetic and motivated to succeed.

Other Skills

-         Communication Tools/Software - Skype, Zoom, MS Teams

-         Microsoft Office 365 - Word, Excel, Powerpoint

-         External Data resource & Media – Linkedin, FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram

Interested Candidate, please write directly to:

Lionel Teng

Managing Partner

Signium International Pte Ltd

Job Description

A research fellow position is available in the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health to support the Principal Investigators in research projects in the areas of statistical genetics and multi-omics.

The group focuses on epidemiology of common human diseases and complex traits. The position emphasize on analyses of longitudinal epidemiological data and high-dimensional data derived from high-throughput technologies such as genome-wide genotyping/sequencing, methylation, metabolomics, proteomics to understand the pathogenesis of one or more of these diseases.

The group is working on multi-omics data in several large collaborations, including National Precision Medicine Programme, Diabetes Study in Nephropathy And other Microvascular Complications (DYNAMO), and the Singapore Population Health Study. The National Precision Medicine Programme is a ten-year roadmap to prepare Singapore for precision medicine. Whole genome sequencing and methylation data will be generated in the next three years. Novel methods to process, perform quality control and association analyses will be the major focus. DYNAMO aims to determine the genes and processes involved in the development of diabetic kidney disease, to identify them for earlier intervention. We have measured genomics, lipidomics and proteomics across diabetic samples in the community and hospitals. Outcomes and phenotypic traits are to be analysed with the multi-omics data to derive insights on the pathways to developing diabetes complications. Multi-omics data are also being generated in participants from the Singapore Population Health Study. Here, we are looking at omics biomarkers change with changes in lifestyle and physiological factors.

Major duties and responsibility of the post includes taking the lead in major analyses, and guiding junior analysts in managing, extracting, analysing data from omics datasets. In addition, candidate is lead publication of results and findings in peer-reviewed journals. Furthermore, he/she will need to contribute to development and writing of research grant proposals.

Candidate must be an independent mature worker who is well-organized and has an eye for details. Candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. He/she must possess the ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals.

Qualifications

Proficiency in the following areas is essential:

  1. Any programming language to analyse large datasets in Unix/Linux environment.
  2. Statistical software (R)

The successful applicant is expected to possess at least a PhD in genetics, statistics, computational biology, bioinformatics, computer science or mathematics. Relevant experience in data analyses will be considered.

Recruitment is open immediately, and will continue until the position is filled.

For further enquiries, please contact Dr Sim Xueling at ephsx@nus.edu.sg. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

Department : Medicine

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 13747

column2: About the Institute of High Performing Computing (IHPC)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
The Institute of High Performing Computing (IHPC) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, committed to advancing science and technology, and develop leading edge applications through high performance computing and computational science. IHPC seeks to promote and spearhead scientific advances and technological innovations through computational modelling, simulation and AI, and to develop impactful applications to further economic growth and improve lives. IHPC’s research foci are in computing science and AI; large scale complex systems modelling; social and cognitive computing; and computational engineering mechanics, fluidic dynamics, electronics and photonics, materials science and chemistry.","The Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) Singapore is seeking an exceptional Computer Vision / Machine Learning Research Scientist to expand our top-notch AI team.

In particular, the research scientist will join the Centre for Frontier AI Research (https://www.a-star.edu.sg/cfar), led by 2 IEEE Fellows and Principal Investigators trained at HKUST, KU Leuven, MIT, NTU, NUS, Stanford and UNSW.

We are looking for a research scientist with experience in Computer Vision and/or Machine learning, coupled with strong self-motivation to aim for fundamental breakthroughs in advancing the science and engineering of intelligence.

The research scientist will work on long-term, ambitious research in Embodied AI using a combination of weakly supervised, unsupervised and neurosymbolic learning approaches. Experience with Embodied AI, scene graphs, knowledge graphs, relational learning, SSL or NLP is highly advantageous.

Job requirements:
  • PhD degree in Computer Vision or Machine Learning (or related discipline) with a strong track record in CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, NeurIPS, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI, TPAMI, IJCV or related. PhDs with a track record of the above-mentioned are encouraged to apply.
  • Strong programming skills and experience with Pytorch or Tensorflow
  • Strong computer vision and machine learning skills
  • Familiarity with NLP, or interest in AGI or developmental psychology would be pluses

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
RESEARCH ASSISTANT for DEPT OF MANAGEMENT AND ORGANISATION

Applications are invited for the following full-time position:
Research Assistant


Dr David P. Daniels (http://www.davidpdaniels.com/) at the Department of Management and Organisation in NUS Business School is hiring a research assistant. I would like to invite a bachelor's degree holder or postgraduate degree holder to join as a full-time research assistant (RA) from 1st July 2022 to 30th June 2023.

The general research topic is human judgment and decision making in social and behavioral contexts. Specific research topics may include diversity, negotiation, and prosocial behavior. Interested applicants with strong quantitative skills, prior research experience, and a desire to pursue a PhD in the behavioral sciences in the future are encouraged to apply for this position.

The specific responsibilities include:
- Assist with experimental behavioral research (e.g., assist with designing and testing experiments, programming surveys or other web-based experiments, recruiting and managing participants, creating IRB protocols, scheduling and running experiments)
- Conduct statistical/econometric analyses
- Conduct literature reviews and data searches
- Provide other research and editing support for various reports and documents
- Attend and contribute to research project meetings and discussions
- Support grant management (e.g., basic accounting)
- Perform other duties as necessary

The ideal candidate will:
1. Have experience or training in experimental behavioral research (using Qualtrics, oTree, Prolific, MTurk, R, etc.) OR econometric and statistical analyses (using R and/or Stata)
2. Be interested in working on projects in organizational behavior, negotiations, behavioral economics, social psychology, and their intersection
3. Be looking to explore whether or not to pursue a PhD
4. Have an academic background in Business, Behavioral Science, Psychology, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, and/or Data Science
5. Hold a bachelor's degree (required) or a postgraduate degree (a plus)

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree holder or postgraduate degree holder.

More Information

The stipulated working hours are 8.30am - 5.30pm, Mondays to Fridays. Telecommuting will be the default mode of working during the period of gradual resumption of operations at NUS. In the future, the candidate is expected to be physically present in NUS office during the stipulated working hours. Software and tools required for data analysis will be made available. Appointments will be renewable when necessary. Salary will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications, track record, potential, and experience.

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required.
In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

Contact list for further enquiries

Interested applicants should send a cover letter, curriculum vitae with complete contact information and any supporting documents to bizdpd@nus.edu.sg.

Please label your email with subject: 'Full-Time Research Assistant'.

Should you be shortlisted, you will be contacted directly for an interview. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.

Core Data Management activities:
  • Review and understand protocols, specifically related to the data management section, visit schedule and study design.
  • In collaboration with Researchers design Case Report Forms (CRFs / eCRFs) and CRF completion Guidelines (CCGs) as per study protocol.
  • Develop Data Validation Specification (DVS) & Data Review Plan (DRP) for each CRF
  • Perform comprehensive data management tasks including data review, writing and resolving data clarification queries
  • Provide DM expertise working with various cross-functional internal and external teams involved in data collection, entry, transfer and extraction.
  • Develop and maintain study documents.
  • Regular report on the status of the study and the collected data.
Clinical Data Management Systems (CDMS)/EDC, Programming & Technical Expertise:
  • Perform UAT for eCRFs, database development (EDC), edit checks and offline listings (R/SQL/Excel)
  • Perform programmer activities for technologies not requiring extensive programming.
  • Support data validation and extraction activities performed by Data Science Team & EDC Programmer
  • Contribute and support Data Science Team to develop study / cohort Data Catalogue with data dictionaries and README documentations.
  • Support data collection/integration and reconciliation of external data (lab, third party, etc)
  • Perform quality control audits to ensure accuracy, completeness, or proper usage of systems from Data Management perspective.
  • Support IT infrastructure development & maintenance activities by System Administrator & Software Developers
Lead Data Manager (LDM):
  • Operate as LDM for studies assigned independently in compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Develop & maintain Data Management Plan (DMP) for the study.
  • Project manager and be the primary contact for a study.
  • Develop & Implement proactive quality management plan/s.
  • Identify compliance issues and work with stakeholders/manager to ensure timely follow-up and resolution
  • Manage and deliver study KPIs (timelines & quality)
  • Supervise project/study staff for their optimal utilisation, efficiency and quality deliverables
  • Prepare training materials for data management activities and processes as required.
Project Management skills:
  • Provide project leadership & project management expertise - communicating with stakeholders, managing expectations, project planning, issue escalation, workload projections, and taking ownership of results.
  • Training & mentoring staff, providing guidance on data management concepts.
  • Lead/support continuous DM process improvements as assigned
  • Drive process standardisation across studies
  • Driving excellence, scaling the team's expertise on Data Management solution for real-world applications.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, high multi-functional, fast-paced environment.
Job Requirements
  • A Bachelor/Master Degree in Data Science, Life Sciences, Computer Science, Public Health or related field.
  • Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience working in academic research, pharma or CRO.
  • Experience working on longitudinal cohort studies as - Research Assistant, Data Manager or Programmer.
  • Basic experience using any programming language (PHP, SQL, R preferred)
  • Professional experience using MS Office tools (proficiency in excel preferred).
  • Organisational, numerical and analytical skills with keen attention to detail.
  • Project management skills with demonstrated ability to work in an environment with multiple projects and timelines.
  • Knowledge / experience on Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and Good Clinical Data Management Practices.
  • Good team player and communication skills.

column2: The Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine), a partnership between Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU) and Imperial College London (Imperial), is training a generation of doctors who will put patients at the centre of their exemplary medical care. The School’s primary clinical partner is the National Healthcare Group, a leader in public healthcare recognised for the quality of its medical expertise, facilities and teaching. Named after local philanthropist Tan Sri Dato Lee Kong Chian, the School, which was officially opened by Singapore’s Deputy Prime Minister Teo Chee Hean on 28 August 2017, is a model for innovative medical education and a centre for transformative research.

column1: <div>

column2:
Graduates of the five-year undergraduate medical degree programme that started in 2013 will have a strong understanding of the scientific basis of medicine, along with interdisciplinary subjects including engineering, technology, business and the humanities. Its first doctors will graduate in 2018 with a Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS), awarded jointly by NTU Singapore and Imperial.","

We seek a highly experienced Research Associate to lead laboratory administration and support R&D in organoid research, focused on novel engineering approaches and high throughput technologies.

The successful candidate will support the operations of the laboratory and research programmes focused on methods of developing improved organoid systems using high throughput technologies.

Key responsibilities:

  • To assist in cell biology workflows, specifically primary tissue and stem cell culture, working with 3D Organoid Models specifically gut intestinal, lung and skin organoids

  • To assist in other workflows including tissue collection, cryo-sectioning, immunostaining, FACS, DNA/RNA extraction, DNA cloning, viral/nonviral gene transfer, RT-PCR, qPCR, etc.

  • Perform laboratory administrative functions including procurement of laboratory inventories, replenishment of consumable materials and laboratory safety.

[Preferable but not required]

  • Animal husbandry and maintenance including record keeping of the research animal colony and update of project schedules based on the availability of the various required strains.

  • Bioinformatics experience

  • Computer coding

Competencies and requirements:

  • Master's degree in Biomedical Engineering/Biotechnology/ Biomaterials or other life science discipline

  • 3+ years experience as RA in academia/ industry

  • Extensive experience with mammalian cell culture

  • Publication record in international, peer-reviewed journals

  • 2+ years of experience in primary tissue handling, working with 3D Organoid Models, ideally Mouse Gut Intestinal Organoids, iPSC- derived Lung Organoids and Human Sebaceous Gland Organoids.

  • Experience in hydrogel formation by jet spraying, bioprinting and/or microfluidics

  • Track record in lab management, inventory management and ordering; ideally experience with NTU's online systems e.g. Ariba.

  • Track record as lab safety officer, ensuring standard operating procedures and safety regulations are followed and are up to date

  • Experience in histology procedures such as tissue processing, embedding, sectioning/ cryo-sectioning, and immunofluorescence staining

  • Experience with confocal microscopy, high content imaging, image processing and analysis using Fiji Image J, Matlab

  • Proficiency in data collection, data analysis, and data visualization/presentation - experience in SPSS/ Prism GraphPad

  • Highly motivated in mastering new knowledge domains, techniques, and approaches.

column2:
Graduates of the five-year undergraduate medical degree programme that started in 2013 will have a strong understanding of the scientific basis of medicine, along with interdisciplinary subjects including engineering, technology, business and the humanities. Its first doctors will graduate in 2018 with a Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS), awarded jointly by NTU Singapore and Imperial.","

A Temporary Research Assistant position (Computation Mass Spectrometry) is available immediately in the laboratory of Nanyang Assistant Professor Xue Li Guan (https://sites.google.com/site/lipidsinsystemshealthlab/).

Our research adopts a systems-based approach to elucidate the critical roles of lipids in infectious diseases and antimicrobial resistance. We capitalize on the integration of next generation mass-spectrometry based lipidomics, other -omics analyses, clinical microbiology and biocomputation to tackle this critical global health problem. The candidate will be involved in developing novel computational solutions for discovery lipidomics.

Qualifications/ Requirements:

  • BSc in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field

  • Interest in developing computation approaches to solve biological problems

  • Proficient in programming (Java, C/C++, Perl, Python, R, Unix shell scripts)

  • Familiarity with high performance computing platforms and clusters, statistical software (e.g. SPSS/SAS) and bioinformatics webtools.

  • Possess relevant skill sets to develop new computational approaches and/or algorithms to address novel biological questions.

  • The successful candidate should also be able to demonstrate independent and critical thinking, excellent communication and teamwork skills, and an enthusiasm for learning new things.

  • Proven track record with publications in international peer reviewed journals

  • Able to supervise students and staff and work as a team

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Short Description

The National Cybersecurity R&D Laboratory (NCL) is a shared national infrastructure that provides computing resources, repeatable and controllable experimentation environments, as well as application services for the cybersecurity R&D community. The infrastructure includes a cluster of 300 nodes that provides a wide range of provisioning mechanisms, security data and security services. NCL aims to provide a platform that fosters and encourages collaboration among researchers in academia, the industry as well as government bodies both locally and internationally through the sharing and validation of research outcomes. The laboratory was established in November 2015 and is funded by the National Research Foundation (NRF).

Job Description

-    Design and manage cloud-based computing system and network infrastructure
-    Setup and maintain backup system for system configuration and user's data/application
-    Working with other team members to collect overall system requirement
-    Preparing required documents for the vendor or provider based on system design requirements
-    Monitor and manage tasks of multiple ongoing projects
-    Present and demonstrate the new infrastructure setup to higher level management
-    Help engineers to communicate with other external parties (eg vendor, provider etc) if required
-    Continuously analyse and maintain the system to avoid security issues or attacks
 

Qualifications

-    Minimum a Degree and three (3) years of relevant working experience.
-    Experienced in Virtualization technologies (VMWare, VirtualBox, KVM)
-    Has knowledge in network devices (e.g., Firewall, Router, Switch) and Internet connection (VPN, Leased line)
-    Familiar with Windows and Linux OS (Ubuntu, CentOS)
-    Familiar with data storage systems (e.g., FreeNAS, LTO, NFS)
-    Experienced with project management software (e.g., JIRA, Trello)
-    Familiar with collaboratively document writing or management (e.g., MS Office, Google Office, OneDrive)
-    Enthusiasm for problem-solving and able to work in a fast-paced environment
-    Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively
-    Experience in private and public cloud environments (e.g., OpenStack, AWS)
-    CCNP certification or equivalent certification
-    Any project management certification
-    Experience working with the open-source project
-    Capability managing infrastructure configuration changes

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.
