Job Description

Duties and responsibilities

Applications are invited for Research Assistant (RA) positions at the Department of the Built Environment, National University of Singapore, to commence as soon as possible. Applicants should possess a Bachelor or M.S. degree in the field of construction, architectural and civil engineering, construction management, mechanical engineering, computer science, and/or a related field.


The RAs are expected to work on one or several research topics:
i.     Building Intelligence into 5G technologies
ii.    Deep semi-supervised learning and automatic generative design
iii.   Structural BIM and robot-aided construction
iv.    Robot-assisted construction progress monitoring
v.     Prefabricated Prefinished Volumetric Construction (PPVC) and 3D printing
vi.    5G-enabled robot system
vii.   Self-supervised learning and autonomous inspection
viii.   Provide guidance and overseeing the operations of 5G Centre
ix.    Paper Publications and Patents
x.     Any other job scope stipulated by Supervisor or Department

Qualifications

Qualifications & Skills Requirement

The appointee will assist in planning and implementing related research projects with PhD students and RAs within the research group and the 5G Centre, including conducting research, preparing research findings, writing report, providing staff guidance, running technical operations, patents and paper, etc. They should have comprehensive knowledge of 5G, MQTT network protocol, computer vision, deep learning, robot operating system, UAV and UGV control, quadruped robot, with a track record of peer-reviewed publications. They should have knowledge in programming including but not limited to C++, Python, etc. with strong analytical and critical thinking skills. The Ras & RFs should have proficiency in written and spoken English.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

Research Fellow (Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electronics Engineering)
The S-Lab for Advanced Intelligence invites applications for the position of Research Fellow. We are seeking a research fellow to join a university-level research centre collaborating with industry. The position is for one year, renewable subject to satisfactory performance. The Research Fellow will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms for multi-modality learning (e.g., text and video). Candidates are expected to have a strong background in relevant areas.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • To independently undertake research in natural langu processing and machine learning.
  • To produce research reports and/or publications as required by the funding body or for dissemination to the wider academic community.
  • To provide guidance and support to any students associated with the project.
  • To attend, contribute, and where necessary lead relevant meetings.
  • To undertake any other duties relevant to the programme of research.
  • Oversee and report project progress.
Job Requirements: 
  • PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent.
  • Candidates with a Master's in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering with relevant of working experience may also apply.
  • Strong background in natural langu processing and/or computer vision. Prior experience in multi-modality learning, multimedia retrieval is preferable.
  • Strong publication records in top-tier natural langu processing and/or computer vision conferences/journals, such as TPAMI, ACL, EMNLP, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICML and AAAI.
  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc.
  • Proven research ability as evidenced through a portfolio of publications and/or conference papers and/or patents.
  • Strong background in RD with self-motivation and initiative. Ability to develop and man RD projects with good understanding of industrial needs.
  • In-depth knowledge relevant to the project domain.
  • Demonstrated capability to conduct innovative research.                                                        
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The National University Hospital (NUH) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As Singapore’s first restructured hospital, NUH has been serving more than a million patients annually since 1985. NUH is a tertiary hospital with a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children, and a major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As part of an integrated academic health system, NUH is committed to transforming care, shaping the next generation of healthcare professionals and leveraging translational research to improve health outcomes. The hospital is also the principal teaching hospital for the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry.

The Case Management Officer will provide information and support to patients, who have a personal or family history of birth defects or genetic disorders.  He/She will also be responsible for the management and coordination of assigned research projects carried out in the division.
The Challenges
  • Collate information from patients, construct a complete pedigree by obtaining comprehensive individual family and medical histories
  • Organize and present the pertinent medical and genetic information to the health care team by writing detailed consultation reports to provide information on complex genetic concepts
  • Apply his/her knowledge of genetics and genetic disorders to effectively convey genetic, medical and technical information to the patient
  • Evaluate genetic information to identify patients/families at risk for specific genetic disorders
  • Assess family dynamics and identify emotional responses from the patient
  • Help patients understand the medical aspects of the genetic condition, as well as the psychological and familial implications of genetics
  • Counsel patients by providing them with information on options that are available such as genetic testing, disease management and prevention, and facilitate the patient's decision-making in a non-directive manner
  • Provide patients with resources for support and opportunities in research programs existing in the medical community
  • Support in the planning and coordinating of assigned research projects and activities
  • Participate in professional organizations/conferences to keep abreast of developments in genetics and genomics
  • Assume additional responsibilities as assigned by RO or higher management
Job Requirements
  • Master’s Degree in Genetic Counselling or equivalent
  • Experience in counselling
  • Be computer literate in Microsoft Word / Excel.
  • Analytical and with good communication skills (written & spoken)
  • Has initiative and able to work independently
  • Positive, motivated and able to perform under pressure
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
Please indicate in the subject title as: ""Applying for position of Case Management Officer, Paediatrics (Genetic Counselling)”
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

Applications are invited for several post-doctoral positions at the National University of Singapore (NUS) in the area of Automated Program Repair
These positions will be part of a Singapore Ministry of Education (MoE) Tier 3, multi-year research program named ""Automated Program Repair"" which has been funded 2022-2027. This is a large research program involving several research projects in analysis, verification, test generation and applications related to program repair.
To see work done on program repair at NUS, kindly see the webpage *https://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~abhik/projects/Repair/index.html * In the new program, we will take this work forward further. The vision of our research program is to retain the workflows of software construction as they exist today in the form of Continuous Integration (CI) systems, and yet support automated software evolution with formal correctness guarantees, thereby engendering trust in automatically generated code. Our research program can help achieve such a vision via analysis, verification, and test generation. Applications of repair studied in the program will include security vulnerability repair, patch transplantation across versions of major software systems such as Linux, as well as the use of repair in intelligent tutoring system that we have developed at NUS, for teaching programming.

Qualifications

The program will start latest by September 2022, and we request interested applicants to reach out to us early with the following information. Interested applicants need to have a PhD degree or should be submitting PhD thesis soon. - CV, including publications - research statement - names of two referees The faculty members involved in this research program are Wei-Ngan Chin, Abhik Roychoudhury (Lead PI) and Ilya Sergey, all from NUS Computer Science. The postdoc will be located in the Computer Science Department of NUS, which enjoys a high degree of academic reputation. Emails by interested applicants may be directed to Abhik Roychoudhury
abhik@comp.nus.edu.sg

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

SingHealth Polyclinics, a leader in family medicine, provides seamless, patient-centred and preventive healthcare that is affordable and accessible to all.

SingHealth Polyclinics' network of polyclinics provides primary healthcare services to the community. It plays an integral role in promoting a healthy lifestyle within the community and empowering families with the knowledge of common health issues, care and treatment options.
<div>
SingHealth Polyclinics is a member of Singapore Health Services (SingHealth) - a public healthcare cluster which also manages three hospitals and five specialty centres.

","

SingHealth-Duke-NUS Family Medicine Academic Clinical Programme in Singapore is looking for a full-time Research Assistant with the relevant experience to support the EmPaTHy Programme in conducting research in the field of people-centred care and digital health.

The EmPaTHy Programme aims to leverage on technology to transform delivery of patient care in primary care by focusing on preventive care, data-driven precision medicine, and people-centred care. The Programme will conduct research and training related to people-centred care and digital health, and translate the research findings into clinical practice. The research team’s expertise include: shared decision making, clinical decision support system, mobile health, technology enhanced teaching and learning, implementation science, mixed methods, and research and clinical ethics. The research projects will test a wide range of technologies with patients and healthcare providers in the primary care setting, including: mobile health, telehealth, clinical decision support system, electronic medical records, and artificial intelligence and big data.

The Research Assistant (RA) will work closely with the EmPaTHy Lead and Research Fellow to ensure successful implementation of the research projects conducted under the EmPaTHy Programme. The RA's principal role will be to execute research-related tasks to ensure the research projects are implemented according to the proposed plan, timeline and budget, in a scientific, ethical and efficient manner.

Job Description:

  • The chosen candidate will be an integral member of the EmPaTHy Programme, which comprises several research projects, with responsibilities including (not limited to) the following:
  • Work with research teams to prepare research proposals and apply for internal, national and international grants.
  • Support the research team in organising research training to build capacity e.g. seminars, workshops, webinars, e-learning
  • Provide support for research protocol development
  • Prepare and monitor research ethics application and post-approval reporting.
  • Prepare and monitor research budget and work with Programme Executive to ensure timely and ethical sourcing and procurement
  • Conduct literature review, entre data and maintain databases, transcribe audio-recordings, perform data analysis (quantitative data using SPSS and qualitative data using NVivo) and prepare progress and final reports of the project
  • Involve in research dissemination through preparing research reports and there will be an opportunity to present research findings and writing manuscripts for publications
  • Build academic networks and collaborations with researchers, clinicians and other stakeholders within and outside the institution, within and outside Singapore
  • Maintain the highest standard of professional conduct and record keeping in accordance with policies and procedures; 
  • Undertake other related duties as may be reasonably required by the EmPaTHy Programme lead

Qualifications:

  • A Master degree (by research or course work) in healthcare, digital health, social sciences, or other relevant disciplines
  • Experience in conducting research including grant application, literature review, field work, data analysis and ethics application
  • Proficient in office computer applications (e.g. Microsoft Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and research management and analysis tools (e.g. SPSS and NVivo)
  • Have published in peer-reviewed journals
  • Excellent in spoken and written English
  • Strong writing and critical thinking skills, as well as good organisational, communication and presentation skills.
  • A team player who is able to prioritize, multi-task and work collaboratively in a diverse environment
  • Have experiences working in the field of digital health and primary care will be an added advantage. 

Remuneration will commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience. Please submit your application:

  • Current/expected salary
  • Cover letter
  • Detailed CV including: personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications and oral presentations, and full contacts of 2 referees

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for an interview.

  • SingHealth Polyclinics: https://polyclinic.singhealth.com.sg

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:

The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow. The Research Fellow will work on a computer vision project. The Research Fellow will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms either for i) im/video understanding, ii) im/video generation, iii) 3D point cloud analysis, iv) few-shot learning and weakly supervised learning, or v) online/continual learning. The Research Fellow is expected to have a solid background in relevant areas.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • To independently undertake research in computer vision and machine learning
  • To produce research reports and/or publications as required by the funding body or for dissemination to the wider academic community
  • To provide guidance and support to any students associated with the project
  • To attend, contribute, and where necessary lead relevant meetings
  • To undertake any other duties relevant to the programme of research
​Job Requirements: 
  • ​PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent
  • Strong background in machine learning and computer vision
  • Strong publication records in machine learning or computer vision conferences/journals
  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc
​We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
The Institute of Microelectronics (IME) is a research institute of A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, with an aim to add value to Singapore’s semiconductor ecosystem by developing strategic competencies, innovative technologies and intellectual property, and enabling enterprises to be technologically competitive. R&D at IME focuses on the semiconductor technology chain, such as smart integrated circuit design, wafer fabrication process technology, packaging and assembly and reliability testing and analysis. IME has also established application-driven programmes with its R&D efforts focused in new technologies such as IoT on the Edge, Heterogeneous Integration, System in Package, Sensors, Actuators & Microsystems, Power Electronics and Medtech.","

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Associate. Key Responsibilities: The Research Associate's scope of work would include developing design optimization strategies for high-throughput heterogeneous accelerator system. The Research Associate is expected to undertake original research and has opportunities to collaborate with industry and top researchers around the world.This includes:
  • To study the performance bottleneck of a FPGA based accelerator system for visual perception
  • To devise design optimization framework for the accelerator system to achieve high-throughput performance
  • To validate the optimized FPGA based accelerator system using real-world dataset
Job Requirements: 
  • ​Possess a Master's degree in computer engineering, computer science and engineering, electronics engineering, electronics and telecommunication engineering, or related disciplines
  • Solid background in heterogenous system design
  • Strong experience in design space optimization of heterogeneous System-on-a-Chip (SoC)
  • At least 3 years of experience in the relevant field

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

98,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-cg-9392054,9392054,Research Fellow (CG),False,False,,,SGD,SingHealth Polyclinics,17-Mar-22,False,,29 days,52928775K,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"
SingHealth Polyclinics, a leader in family medicine, provides seamless, patient-centred and preventive healthcare that is affordable and accessible to all.

SingHealth Polyclinics' network of polyclinics provides primary healthcare services to the community. It plays an integral role in promoting a healthy lifestyle within the community and empowering families with the knowledge of common health issues, care and treatment options.
<div>
SingHealth Polyclinics is a member of Singapore Health Services (SingHealth) - a public healthcare cluster which also manages three hospitals and five specialty centres.

","

SingHealth Polyclinics (SHP) is a leading Academic Family Medicine Institution in Singapore aligned to the paradigm shift in national healthcare foci from hospital to community and from healthcare to health. We are hiring a full-time Research Fellow with the relevant experience to support a vibrant research programme focusing on people-centred care and preventive health, both at the individual and community levels.

The SHP Signature Research Programme (SRP) aims to leverage on technology to transform primary care by focusing on personalised preventive health measures to keep every person healthy and for those with existing medical conditions from developing complications. The SRP covers research, innovations and education of the persons served by the 9 polyclinics in SHP, empowering them to leverage on digital health and technology to better manage their health and medical conditions, especially those who are older and the vulnerable. The SRP will yield valuable information for the researchers to enhance shared decision making, user-friendly mobile health applications, and test emerging technology such as artificial intelligence and computer vision to reach out to more people in the community.

The Research Fellow will work closely with the Director of Research in SHP and SRP teams, including leading and developing projects to ensure their successful implementation at SPRINGs and SHP HQ. SPRINGs are the dedicated research facility at the newer polyclinics in SHP.

The Research Fellow will be actively involved in the following areas:

  • Analyse and leverage on existing polyclinic data to develop, evaluate and implement novel preventive health interventions in primary care
  • Co-design technology-based healthcare solutions to enhance patient’s experience and health outcomes in preventive care and chronic diseases
  • Conduct systematic reviews and meta-analysis/meta-synthesis to identify gaps and potential solutions to inform development and evaluation of health interventions
  • Design and conduct research evaluations using mixed methods and patient reported outcome measures
  • Translate research evidence into clinical practice using implementation science frameworks 
  • Collaborate with local and international academics, researchers and industrial research partners

More information:

  • SingHealth Polyclinics: https://polyclinic.singhealth.com.sg
  • SingHealth Research: https://polyclinic.singhealth.com.sg/research-innovation/pages/research-overview.aspx
  • Family Medicine Academic Clinical Programme: https://www.singhealthdukenus.com.sg/acp/familymedicine/research-overview 

Job Description:

The chosen candidate will be an integral member of several research projects with responsibilities including (not limited to) the following:

  • Work with research teams to conceptualise novel research ideas and develop research proposals leading to internal, national and international grant applications.
  • Lead and/or manage translational research projects in a transdisciplinary, interprofessional learning ecosystem
  • Assist the Director of Research to conduct research training to build capacity (seminars, workshops, webinars, e-learning) and mentor junior researchers, research assistants and clinical research coordinators
  • Provide support for research protocol development and research administration including ethics approval and budgeting
  • Conduct literature review, systematic review and meta-analysis and perform data analysis (statistical analyses and qualitative data analyses)
  • Disseminate research findings through writing research papers and reports, presenting research findings, publishing in peer-reviewed journals and media
  • Build academic networks and collaborations with researchers, clinicians and other stakeholders within and outside the institution, within and outside Singapore
  • Undertake other related duties as may be reasonably required by the SRP

Qualifications:

  • PhD in any of the disciplines: community or public health, digital health, social sciences, or other relevant disciplines
  • Have experience in primary care, public health, digital health, or interventional research
  • Possess a track record of lead or co-authorship of peer-reviewed publications
  • Excellent in spoken and written English
  • Proficient in research data management and analysis tools such as SPSS, Stata, and/or R, NVivo and/or Atlas.ti
  • Strong writing and critical thinking skills, as well as good organisational, communication and presentation skills.
  • A team player who is able to prioritize, multi-task and work collaboratively in a diverse environment
  • Ability to perform systematic reviews and/or meta-analysis would be an added advantage

Remuneration will commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience. Please submit your application:

  • Current/expected salary
  • Cover letter
  • Detailed CV including: personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications and oral presentations, and full contacts of 2 referees

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for an interview.

column3: Founded in 2000, Resolvo is the recognized market leader in providing comprehensive security assessment and testing services in Asia. We are both CREST-accredited and ISO/IEC 27001 certified in the provision of security audit and testing services.

Resolvo believes in providing excellent services to help our clients to secure their information investments. We approach each business challenge passionately and with commitment, striving to do the best in what we do best.

Together with our strategic partners, we seek to provide our customers with the assurance that their sensitive information assets and intellectual properties are well protected according to best practices. Our customers span across defense, financial, healthcare, logistics, manufacturing, media & information, public sector, oil & gas and technology sectors in Asia.
In Resolvo, we strongly believe that people are our greatest assets. We constantly seek to work with people who are highly motivated, with a passion for our customers and technology.
If you think you are the right fit to our company, check out our active job opportunities or submit your resume to us for potential opportunities in the future.

column2:
Defence research and development (R&D) is at the heart of what we do at DSO. As Singapore’s largest national defence R&D organisation, DSO is entrusted with the critical mission of developing technological surprises to enhance Singapore’s defence capabilities. From research to systems development, our defence engineers and scientists push the boundaries to develop game changing technologies and solutions that are not available in the market, or not available to Singapore. DSO also invest and explore emerging technologies to ensure the nation’s defence and national security capabilities are future ready. With more than 50 research areas across the domains of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace, DSO shapes the future of defence with our imagination and dare-to-do spirit in the relentless pursuit of the next big idea.","
DSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore’s largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation, with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace.
The Sensors Division undertakes research and development in a wide range of sensor technologies, including radar, acoustics, electro-optics and underwater, to provide the SAF with a recognised battlefield situation picture.
People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.
Signal Processing Engineer (Speech)
In this role, you will:

• Survey and understand state-of-the-art speech processing algorithms
• Design and develop novel algorithms for speech processing
• Conduct experiments as part of project team to evaluate algorithm’s performance
• Support transition of algorithms from scientific development tools to real-time software environments to facilitate integration to operational systems
Requirements:
• Bachelor's Degree in Electronics/ Computer Engineering/ Mathematics/Computer Science
• Passionate in R&D of signal and/or speech processing
• A “Can-Do” attitude and strong team player
• Good communication, inter-personal and problem solving skills
• Proficient coding skills in MATLAB, Python and etc.
• Knowledge and Experience in Machine Learning and proficiency in ML toolkits such as PyTorch and TensorFlow
• Experience working with real-world datasets for machine learning projects will be an advantage
• Experience in Linux operating environment will be a plus

A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

('Research fellow' is similar to 'post-doctoral researcher', in the terminology of some other countries.) The appointee is expected to work closely with Associate Prof. YU Haifeng (http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~yuhf) on issues related to distributed systems security and distributed computing. A key goal of the research will be to produce high-impact academic publications in premier conferences (such as CCS and SP) and journals in the area. Please see http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~yuhf for some example prior publications from Associate Prof. YU Haifeng's research group. The salary is generous and is internationally competitive.

Qualifications

- At least a PhD degree from a good university

- Good publication record

- Fluent in written and spoken English

- Ability and dedication to do world-class research

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: School of Computing

Department : Department of Computer Science

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 13446

103,computer research,/en/job/associate-director-technology-9370243,9370243,"Associate Director, Technology",False,False,10000,14000,SGD,ETH Singapore SEC Limited,20-Mar-22,False,,,201016935D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,CREATE Tower,"

 The Singapore-​ETH Centre (SEC) was established by one of the world’s leading universities - ETH Zurich (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich) and the National Research Foundation Singapore in 2010.

The centre provides a multicultural and interdisciplinary environment to researchers working on diverse themes focussed on sustainable and liveable cities, resilient urban systems, and patient-​centric healthcare. The centre is home to a community of over 100 doctoral, postdoctoral and professorial researchers working in three main programmes - Future Cities Lab Global, Future Resilient Systems, and Future Health Technologies – and a range of related research projects.

As part of the National Research Foundation's CREATE campus (Campus for Research Excellence and Technological Enterprise), members of the SEC also benefit from opportunities to engage with colleagues from top universities based in the campus.

","

Context

Future Cities Lab (FCL) Global is a research community with the mission to shape sustainable future cities and settlement systems. We are 120 people strong and hail from over 35 countries with diverse backgrounds, including architecture, urban design, engineering and environmental, computer, material sciences working in multidisciplinary teams on the common mission.

FCL Global is part of the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) and ETH Zurich and was established in partnership with Singapore’s National Research Foundation (NRF), Nanyang Technological University (NTU), National University of Singapore (NUS), and Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD). FCL Global has two hubs, one in Singapore and another Zurich, and strong international partner network spanning academia, government, industry and civil society.

Work closely with another Associate Director, Technology based in Zurich, and helping coordinate programme activities across both hubs.

Job Description

The Associate Director, Technology is integral to the FCL Global community. Focus on bringing advanced technologies into research activities through demonstration, capacity building and research tool development. Research tools are showcased in our Engagement Platform and are especially important to our work. Existing examples include those designed to assess the energy intensity of buildings, sustainable mobility, urban and rural land-uses around megacities, ecological footprints and urban heat island effects.

The Associate Director, Technology should be familiar with the software development life cycle and methodologies, with experience in project management. Enjoy creative thinking, working with researchers on city-related themes and interacting with stakeholders in government, industry and civil society.

Duties and Responsibilities

The scope of work shall comprise of but shall not be limited to:

1. Software Projects

· Evaluate existing digital tool ecology and develop protocols for improving interoperability

· Identify new project requirements in dialogue with leadership team and research groups

· Design project architecture that responds to the needs, is robust, easy to maintain and scale

· Organise work schedules for the development team ensuring projects are completed in time

· Identify risks and draft contingency plans

· Guide, mentor and supervise junior research and development team-members

2. Building Research Capacity

· Support and help develop the Engagement Platform vision

· Operationalise the vision including linking content and technological developments

· Lead technology integration across research activities generally, and specifically in geospatial research (GIS-based tool development) and design thinking (e.g. serious gaming, analytics, user-interfaces and user-experience design)

· Support data management spanning software and policy development

· Initiate and contribute to scientific grant writing related to emerging research themes

· Inform research community on emerging technologies and industry trends, and support innovative teaching and learning initiatives.

3. Leadership & Administration

· Provide leadership on technological matters related to FCL Global in both hubs

· Provide leadership to the technological expertise in the various research modules

· Identify, support and coordinate spin-off opportunities emerging from research activities

· Assist with Engagement Platform budgeting and relevant recruitment

· Liaise with IT department to maintain and improve infrastructure

· Develop workflows and systems to capture, analyse and visualise information on research outputs, KPIs and impacts

· Support external stakeholder liaison (industry, private institutions, public entities, etc.)

Necessary Requirements

· Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related field with minimum of 3 years’ managerial experience

· Previous experience working as a software developer

· Previous experience working in a similar role

· Familiar with the development of 3D (Unity) and geospatial (GIS) applications

· Good diagnostic and troubleshooting skills

· Excellent attention to detail

· Good communication skills

· Clearly articulate ideas/thoughts

Desirable Attributes

· Scientific data analysis/visualisation tools

· Scripting and programming languages such as R, python

· Simulation studies and models

104,computer research,/en/job/research-officer-dmstbt-9347105,9347105,Research Officer (DMSTBT),False,False,,,SGD,National Cancer Centre Singapore Pte Ltd,19-Mar-22,False,,,199801562Z,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,11 Hospital Crescent,"

The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) has evolved over the past 20 years to become one of the leading regional centres for cancer treatment and research. It has pioneered the one-stop multi-disciplinary approach to cancer treatment and is now home to oncologists, surgeons and researchers, dedicated to the care and treatment of a growing number of cancer patients.

Today, NCCS see close to 65 per cent of the public sector oncology cases in Singapore. To deliver the latest cancer care and treatment, clinicians work closely with researchers who conduct robust cutting-edge clinical and translational research which has received international recognition.

NCCS strives to be a global leading cancer centre, and shares its expertise and knowledge by training the next generation of medical professionals.

","

SingHealth Duke-NUS Institute of Biodiversity Medicine (BD-MED) is a newly established Joint Research Institute under the SingHealth and Duke-NUS Academic Medicine partnership. BD-MED will focus on the science of plant genomics and biology in regional herbs and food plants with the mission of “translating biodiversity studies to impact medicine and health”. We are looking for a dynamic individual with a passion for food sustainability, plant biology to empower our team towards becoming a global leader in translational biodiversity medicine.

Your responsibilities will include:

- Extraction of plant nucleic acids & relevant NGS library preparation.

- Assist PI in researching and establishing water based agri-tech systems for various herbs & consumer greens to increase yields and production sustainably.

- Monitor and perform minor tasks in managing germplasm and research garden.

- Assist researchers in collating data and literature review in various research projects.

- Contribute to project management, presentations, manuscript preparation & submission for publications.

- Assist with general laboratory housekeeping, provide technical support and establish SOPs to ongoing research projects and maintaining good safety hygiene.

- Participate actively in scientific discussions, present research outcomes and organise outreach programmes to the scientific community and public.

Requirements:

- Bachelor / Master Degree in plant biology with an aptitude for research, preferably with 1 year of relevant work experience.

- Candidates with working knowledge in plant biology, genetics & agri-tech will be favorable.

- Working knowledge of NGS and associated applications, plant DNA/RNA extractions, RT-PCR etc. Training will be provided.

- Some working experience in therapeutic/ community gardens will be advantageous.

- Good interpersonal communication skills with written, oral communication and computer skills.

- Candidate with an entrepreneurial mindset will be highly desirable.

- A good team player who is motivated, mature, resourceful, energetic, and work collaboratively in an interdisciplinary team and diverse workforce.

A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The appointee is expected to work closely with Associate Prof. YU Haifeng (http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~yuhf) on issues related to distributed systems security and distributed computing. A key goal of the research will be to produce high-impact academic publications in premier conferences (such as CCS and SP) and journals in the area. Please see http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~yuhf for some example prior publications from Associate Prof. YU Haifeng's research group. The salary is generous and is internationally competitive.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

Qualifications

- At least a Bachelor's degree from a good university

- Fluent in written and spoken English

- Ability and dedication to do world-class research

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: School of Computing

Department : Department of Computer Science

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 13448

column1:
","
Overview*
  • To assist in the Department’s (Haematology non-therapeutic) research efforts.
  • To assist in other duties as needed by the Haematology Division.
Job Responsibilities*
You will be responsible for the following:
  • Ethics, Regulatory and Essential Documents:
    • Ensure that the necessary Ethics and Regulatory approvals (if applicable) are obtained before the initiation of the study.
    • If required, coordinate the submission of study agreement contract to the Research Office (RO). Ensure that the agreement is signed by the sponsor, Principal investigator(s) and RO prior to the start of patient enrollment.
    • Assist the Principal Investigator (PI) in the initiation of the study by preparing for the Site Initiation Meeting and obtaining the signature of the study team on the Delegation of Responsibility and Signature Log.
    • File all relevant correspondences.
    • Ensure the Investigator files and all the essential documents are properly maintained.
  • Research Protocol:
    • Review and understand all assigned protocols.
  • Recruitment/Informed Consent Process:
    • Initiate and maintain screening, enrollment and subject identification logs. Monitor recruitment progress and update PI and study team regularly.
    • Where applicable, screen for potential study subjects, check potential subjects with the attending doctor and assist at the screening visit.
    • Assist the investigator in the informed consent process. Obtain signatures and dates from the subject and/or witness. Provide a signed copy to the subject.
    • Document in the case notes that informed consent has been obtained before any study procedures.
    • File original signed informed consent in the designated folder.
    • Assist the investigator in checking the results to ensure subject's eligibility.
  • Biological Sampling:
    • Ensure that adequate clinical supplies and logistics are in place throughout the study.
    • Ensure that biological samples are properly collected at the stipulated time points, accurately labeled and processed.
    • Responsible for the transportation to and storage of the samples at the correct labs/collaborators.
    • Maintain the biological sample logs
  • Case Report Forms (CRFs)/Databases:
    • Extract information from medical records for electronic and/or hardcopy databases/CRFs
    • Complete CRFs promptly and accurately. Obtain the investigator's input whenever necessary.
    • Respond to data queries regarding CRFs corrections, revisions and clarifications and ensures resolution of data queries.
    • Oversee scheduling and conduct of monitoring and audit.
    • Collaborate with investigators and collaborators in providing accurate data for analysis
    • Assist PI in collating data for analysis pertinent to presentations and publications.
    • Work closely with the investigators in ensuring data confidentiality and credibility
  • Supervisory role
    • Managing the coordinators
    • Assist in the training of new coordinators
  • Patient Support:
    • Assist the respective disease head haematologists in organizing events, patient booklets, gatherings for patients and caregivers
    • Point of liaison for compassionate drug programs 
    • Tumour Board:
      • Assist the haematologists in coordination of the Tumour Board
      • Assist the doctors in getting the Tumour Board forms ready for discussion and upload
      • Ensure the logistical smooth running of the meeting is
Requirements*
  • Enrolled Nurse or Diploma /Degree in biomedical/health science or related field
Experience:
  • Phlebotomy experience preferred
  • 3 to 4 years of clinical research experience preferred
  • Have experience in DSRB and HAS regulations
Skills:
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills with patients and colleagues
  • Good work attitude, organized, able to multi-task, work independently and perform well under pressure
  • Leadership abilities
  • Computer proficiency is essential – MS Word, Powerpoint and Excel

108,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-healthcare-artificial-intelligence-and-data-analytics-9406863,9406863,Research Fellow (Healthcare Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,23-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

Research Fellow (Healthcare Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics)

The above position is now available to support the Principal Investigator, Assistant Professor Feng Mengling, for his research in the areas of healthcare data analytics and AI solutions.


Dr. Mengling Feng (https://www.mornin-feng.com/) is truly a cross-disciplinary scientists, who is currently a faculty member of the School of Public Health, School of Computing and School of Medicine, National University of Singapore (NUS). He is also the Senior Assistant Director working directly with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) at National University Hospital (NUH). Dr. Feng is also an affiliated scientist with MIT. His research is to develop effective data analysis and machine learning methods to extract actionable knowledge from medical big data to improve the quality of care. Dr. Feng's work was recognized by both well-established journals, such as Science Translational Medicine, and top international conferences, such as KDD, AAAI and AMIA.


Cross-disciplinary and International AI Lab

The selected candidates will be working in a cross-disciplinary team consists of data scientists, physicians, post-docs, PhD students and well respected faculty members from NUS, NUH and SGH. The candidates will be working on healthcare projects funded by our Ministry of Health, Health Promotion Board and AI Singapore. As Dr. Feng is an affiliated scientist, his lab constantly work with faculties and students from the Harvard-MIT Health Science Technology division. Dr. Feng has over 20 joint publications with Harvard and MIT between 2017 and 2019. He has also been organizing the annual NUS-MIT Healthcare AI Datathon (www.nus-datathon.com) , which were covered by many local news channels.


Potential Industrial and Overseas Exposure
Dr. Feng collaborates closely with various local and international industrial partners. Members in Dr. Feng's team often have opportunities to work as affiliated scientists in our partnering companies, such as MSD, PingAn, Google, Intel, Nvidia, IBM, SAP, Philips, local and international start-ups.


Responsibilities 
Major responsibility of the selected candidate is to apply and develop machine learning and AI technologies to solve healthcare challenges raised by our clinical collaborators. The selected candidate will also be involved in managing, extracting and pre-processing data for various projects.
 

Qualifications

Required personal skills:
1. An independent and self-driven worker and a fast learner
2. Well- organized and has an eye for details
3. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
4. Ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals


Essential technical skills:
1. Excellent academic record
2. Knowledge and experience in statistical analysis or machine learning
3. Programing language: Python or R or C++


Good proficiency and experience in the following areas is a plus:
1. Experience with the PL-SQL/Trans-SQL
2. Knowledge and experience in GPU-based computation
3. Strong in Mathematics
4. Strong foundations in machine learning
5. Candidates with strong publication record in the field of machine learning are preferred


The successful applicants are expected to possess at least the PhD Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics and preferably with relevant experience.


This position will be initially available for one year. The grade of appointment will be accorded based on candidate's academic qualifications and years of relevant experience.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: National University of Singapore

Department : Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health

Job Description:
The Challenges
  • Collecting clinical trial data by aaccessing patient's medical records to extract information on current and past medical history, medications, laboratory, imaging results.
  • Provide clinical trial support such as data entry and transcription of information on source documents, paper case report forms (CRFs), or electronic CRFs.
  • Manage clinical trials through review, computerization, cleaning and auditing of clinical data and in compliance with standard operating procedures.
  • Validate clinical trial data to ensure consistency, integrity and accuracy.
  • Reviewing patient records together with clinicians, radiologists, pharmacists and other members of the HORG team to address sponsor queries.
  • Pharmacy audits and spot checks to ensure compliance of drug prescriptions and pharmacy processes with clinical trial requirements.
  • Liaising with clinical CRCs to ensure compliance of informed consent forms with standards set by ethics committees and regulatory authorities
The Requirements
  • Degree in Nursing, Biomedical Science, Health Science or related field
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills with patients and colleagues
  • Good work attitude, organized, able to multi-task, work independently and perform well under pressure
  • Computer proficiency is essential – MS Word, Powerpoint and Excel
Interested applicants are invited to email a detailed resume stating your current and expected salary.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

110,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-r00005369-9385430,9385430,Research Fellow - R00005369,False,False,,,SGD,Nanyang Technological University,15-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604393R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

S-Lab for Advanced Intelligence invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms for unsupervised and self-supervised learning and the task of object detection and semantic image segmentation
Job Requirements:
  • PhD degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent
  • Candidates with a Master's Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering with relevant years of working experience may also apply
  • Strong background in machine learning and computer vision
  • Prior experience in object detection, semantics image segmentation, unsupervised and self-supervised is preferable
  • Strong publication records in top-tier machine learning or computer vision conferences/journals, such as TPAMI, IJCV, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICML and AAAI
  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

  • Resolve queries on data inconsistencies
  • Review case report forms for completeness and consistency
  • Work in collaboration with study team to ensure trial preparedness
The Requirements
  • Possess a Diploma/ Degree in Life Science or Nursing
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team
  • Good communication skills
  • Meticulous and possess excellent organizational skills
  • Computer literate

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

The School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow. The Research Fellow will work on a computer vision project. The Research Fellow will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms either for i) im/video understanding, ii) im/video generation, iii) 3D point cloud analysis, iv) few-shot learning and weakly supervised learning, or v) online/continual learning. The Research Fellow is expected to have a solid background in relevant areas.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • To independently undertake research in computer vision and machine learning
  • To produce research reports and/or publications as required by the funding body or for dissemination to the wider academic community
  • To provide guidance and support to any students associated with the project
  • To attend, contribute, and where necessary lead relevant meetings
  • To undertake any other duties relevant to the programme of research
​Job Requirements: 
  • ​PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent
  • Strong background in machine learning and computer vision
  • Strong publication records in machine learning or computer vision conferences/journals
  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc
​We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

As an academic hospital, SGH plays a key role in nurturing doctors, nurses and allied health professionals and is committed to innovative translational and clinical research to provide the best care and outcomes to patients.

Job Description

You will be working with a dynamic team of data scientists, clinician investigators, and health services researchers and research associates, biostatisticians, registry managers to harness the power of healthcare data and data science to advance diagnosis, treatment, and outcomes of patient care. You main responsibilities includes but not limited to the following:

  • Creating and maintaining data pipelines for easy access of curated data for analysis
  • Conducting quality checks on the data to ensure data meet the highest quality standards
  • Performing data cleaning and wrangling to prepare the data for machine learning modeling
  • Performing exploratory data analysis to help see the big picture behind the data
  • Assisting data scientists to build and test machine learning models
  • Disseminating data analysis results by presentations to relevant stakeholders or in the form of scientific manuscripts

Job Requirement

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, and Information Systems, Soft Engineering or any related computational disciplines or equivalent
  • Advanced proficiency in Python, R, Java code writing, extensive knowledge of ML frameworks, libraries, data structures, data modelling, and software architecture, and Hands-on experience with SQL database design
  • Demonstrated technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
  • In-depth knowledge of mathematics, statistics, and algorithms
  • Familiarity with healthcare database management systems and processes as well as healthcare data governance policies and regulation will be an advantage

118,computer research,/en/job/research-fellow-biostatistician-9408542,9408542,Research Fellow (Biostatistician),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,23-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The National University of Singapore invites applications for a Research Fellow position in the Department of Medicine, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine. 

Purpose of the post

We are looking for a biostatistician with 3 years of contract to analyze high-dimensional molecular assay data for clinical biomarker discovery in cardiovascular diseases. The staff will be involved in biomarker studies across a multitude of local and cross-country cohorts of patients under care for heart failure, coronary artery disease, and acute coronary syndromes.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

The main duties are:

  1. Drive the statistical analysis plan for high-dimensional, quantitative molecular data sets and prioritize diagnostic and prognostic markers (proteins, metabolites, and non-coding RNAs in blood circulation) for specified clinical endpoints or endophenotypes
  2. Integrate blood biomarkers with other cardiac imaging modalities to make inference of the connections between circulating markers and cardiac function phenotypes
  3. Direct collaboration with clinicians and presentation of data analysis outcomes

We expect an ideal candidate to:

  1. Be fluent in advanced statistical and machine learning methods, especially optimization and Bayesian statistics
  2. Have solid background in molecular biology and statistics, especially in high-dimensional data analysis
  3. Be proficient in low-level computer languages and linux/unix servers
  4. Have excellent communication skills and demonstrate records of good scientific writing
Qualifications

The applicant should:

  1. Have a Ph.D. degree in biostatistics, computational biology, bioinformatics, or any related disciplines
  2. Be able to work independently and have excellent organization skills to deal with a number of collaborations and data analysis support; and
  3. Excellent communication skills and proven record in scientific writing

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

Department : Medicine

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 12316

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

  • Conduct research for the project '3D-Assisted Next Generation Face Analysis'

  • Demonstrate good leadership in leading a research team to come up with independent research ideas

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

128,computer research,/en/job/research-assistant-healthcare-ai-and-data-analytics-9407358,9407358,Research Assistant (Healthcare AI and Data Analytics),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,23-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

Research Assistant
For 'Healthcare Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics'

The above positions are now available to support the Principal Investigator, Assistant Professor Feng Mengling, for his research in the areas of healthcare data analytics and AI solutions.
Dr. Mengling Feng (https://www.mornin-feng.com/) is truly a cross-disciplinary scientists, who is currently a faculty member of the School of Public Health, School of Computing and School of Medicine, National University of Singapore (NUS). He is also the Senior Assistant Director working directly with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) at National University Hospital (NUH). Dr. Feng is also an affiliated scientist with MIT. His research is to develop effective data analysis and machine learning methods to extract actionable knowledge from medical big data to improve the quality of care. Dr. Feng's work was recognized by both well-established journals, such as Science Translational Medicine, and top international conferences, such as KDD, AAAI and AMIA.


Cross-disciplinary and International AI Lab
The selected candidates will be working in a cross-disciplinary team consists of data scientists, physicians, post-docs, PhD students and well respected faculty members from NUS, NUH and SGH. The candidates will be working on healthcare projects funded by our Ministry of Health, Health Promotion Board and AI Singapore. As Dr. Feng is an affiliated scientist, his lab constantly work with faculties and students from the Harvard-MIT Health Science Technology division. Dr. Feng has over 20 joint publications with Harvard and MIT between 2017 and 2019. He has also been organizing the annual NUS-MIT Healthcare AI Datathon (www.nus-datathon.com) , which were covered by many local news channels.

Potential Industrial and Overseas Exposure
Dr. Feng collaborates closely with various local and international industrial partners. Members in Dr. Feng's team often have opportunities to work as affiliated scientists in our partnering companies, such as MSD, PingAn, Google, Intel, Nvidia, IBM, SAP, Philips, local and international start-ups.

Responsibilities and requirements
Major responsibility of the selected candidate is to apply and develop machine learning and AI technologies to solve healthcare challenges raised by our clinical collaborators. The selected candidate will also be involved in managing, extracting and pre-processing data for various projects.

Required personal skills:
1. An independent and self-driven worker and a fast learner
2. Well- organized and has an eye for details
3. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
4. Ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals
Essential technical skills:
1. Excellent academic record
2. Knowledge and experience in statistical analysis or machine learning
3. Programing language: Python or R or C++

Good proficiency and experience in the following areas is a plus:
1. Experience with the PL-SQL/Trans-SQL
2. Knowledge and experience in GPU-based computation
3. Strong in Mathematics
4. Strong foundations in machine learning
5. Candidates with publications in the field of machine learning are preferred
 

This position will be initially available for one year. The grade of appointment will be accorded based on candidate's academic qualifications and years of relevant experience.

Recruitment is open immediately, and will continue until the positions are filled.

Qualifications

The successful applicants are expected to possess at least the Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, and preferably with relevant experience.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.
