A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

Perform a variety of research activities which include planning, organizing, and conducting research studies under the supervision of the Principal Investigator(s):

  • Apply machine learning, deep learning and reinforcement learning techniques to analyse large-scale electronic health records, and data from mobile/wearable or other digital devices.
  • Conceptualise new ideas and develop plans for independent research which could have a considerable influence and impact in medical informatics and health data science.
  • Write high-quality technical/methodological research papers, present research outcomes and develop connections with local and international researchers for collaboration work.
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior researchers, graduate students with occasional educational/instructional activities.
  • Perform other academic duties as required by the Principal Investigator(s).
Job Requirements
  • PhD in statistics/biostatistics/computer science or related areas with good mathematical knowledge and excellent research experience in machine learning.
  • Proven track record of publications (as the first author) in reputable technical journals and/or top-tier machine learning conferences.
  • Possess good programming skills in R and Python.
  • Have interest in applying statistics and machine learning to solve real-world medical problems.
  • Able to conduct independent research as well as support team research activities.
  • A strong team player with the ability to work harmoniously with a diverse workforce.
Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
ABOUT SERC
Science and Engineering Research Council (SERC) of A*STAR promotes public sector research and development in the sciences and engineering. At SERC, we:  
  • Support world-class research in A*STAR institutes in a wide range of fields including communications, AI data science, cybersecurity, modelling and simulations, materials, chemicals, microelectronics, manufacturing technologies and metrology;  
  • Plan and promote research in strategic areas to create knowledge and innovation that drive the development of knowledge-intensive industries;   
  • Eng an extensive network of industry partners via various programmes to facilitate a seamless flow of technologies from conception to commercialisation.  
JOB DESCRIPTION
  • A Senior Officer / Assistant Head in Infocomm Cluster of SERC is required to support the strategising and managing of A*STARs RD initiatives in digital technologies, such as: 
  • AI and Data Science 
  • Communications (eg. 5G) and Internet-of-Things
  • Digital trust technologies (e.g. privacy preservation and distributed ledger technologies) 
  • Cybersecurity Digital Twinning and Modelling Simulations 
  • Quantum Computing The officer will be part of a dynamic Infocomm Cluster team which shapes public sector research and innovation to deliver economic and societal outcomes for Singapore through:
  • Strategic planning, coordination, and collaborations in digital technology RD with Ministries Public ncies partners, research Institutes, Institutes of Higher Learning, and industry sectors  
  • Long-term RD planning and stakeher engments that shape and contribute directly to the national RD nda  
  • Technology foresighting and masterplanning to optimise RD investment portfolio and ensure alignment with national priorities   RD programme strategy development and design, which entails convening relevant public ncies, enterprises, and research entities (within A*STAR and from Institutes of Higher Learning) into collaboration programmes and securing necessary manment support and resources for programme initiation  RD programme execution and manment, including planning for subsequent technology translation and commercialisation  
  • Strategic development and reviews of digital technology capabilities in A*STAR Research Institutes   ??         Research proposals evaluation, project reviews and grant manment
JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • Background in Engineering, IT or Computer Science, with preferably 2 or more of working experience in these fields   
  • Ability to think strategically and analyse issues from different angles   
  • Knowledge in a broad range of digital technologies, digital industry, their trends, challenges, and potentials   
  • Passion in shaping research and innovation in digital technologies to bring about economic and societal outcomes for Singapore   
  • Proactive learning attitude, attention to details and results-oriented 
  • Comfortable with delivering outcomes in complex environment within challenging timelines

A qualified candidate will be self-motivated with strong technical and analytical skills as well as possess practical and hands-on approach to engineering process control in the areas of electroplating, clean processes and defect reduction and yield.
Responsibilities:
  • Systematic troubleshooting of process and equipment-related problems
  • To take charge of new tools technical assessment and equipment cum process startup
  • Drive continuous improvement projects (CIP) to achieve better quality and lower cost.
  • To set-up appropriate process and product control plan and out of control action plans (OCAP)
  • Provide technical training to related staff on best-know practices in terms of process control
  • Yield analysis and continuous process improvement
Job Requirement:
  • Bachelor or higher degree in Electrical and Electronics, Material, Physics or Chemical engineering
  • Minimum 3-5 years of hands-on semiconductor experience (preferably in electroplating and bonding processes)
  • Possess computer software skills (i.e. JMP, Minitab, SQL, Visual basic, etc)
  • Knowledge in problem solving and quality control skills (i.e. SPC, RCA, DAMIC, DOE, etc)
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

  • Develop temporal logic based estimation/observation methods for physical faults and cyber attacks in cyber-physical systems
  • Design resilient cooperative reinforcement learning control laws for cyber-physical systems with the presence of physical faults and cyber attacks
  • Write high-quality research papers based on research results
  • Establish practical accurate and secure cyber-physical platforms with embedded systems
Job Requirements: 
  • ​PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other related areas and thereafter have completed at least 5 years of University or industrial research work

  • In-depth domain knowledge in formal analysis, system modeling, fault detection, feedback control, reinforcement learning
  • Rich engineering experience in embedded systems (ARM, Linux, embedded software development, embedded hardware design)
  • Advanced programming skills (C/C++, Python, MATLAB, etc.)
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

The Laboratory Executive will work closely with the Division of Allergy, Immunology & Rheumatology team to ensure the smooth running of clinical research studies, in particular an upcoming large nationwide study to assess immune responses of children to the COVID-19 vaccine. His/her primary role will be to perform laboratory assays for biosamples relating to the clinical studies and contribute to increasing and maintaining high quality, scientifically robust research within the Department of Paediatrics, NUS.

1) Laboratory Experiments for Research Study

a) Follow established protocols and perform experiments in an accurate and reproducible manner, including cellular biology techniques such as blood processing, PBMC isolation, whole blood assay to analyze B and T cell responses.

b) Prepare samples and buffer and perform other lab duties as required such as laboratory safety management to maintain high level of safety standards for the department.

2) Administrative Work

a) Conduct laboratory housekeeping, procurement and inventory maintenance, maintain the highest standard of professional conduct and record keeping in accordance with policies and procedures to ensure smooth running of the department's laboratory work.

3) Other Ad-hoc Duties

a) Assist with any other duties of similar nature that are delegated by the Principal Investigator to facilitate other team projects in the department.

Qualifications
  1. Degree in Biotechnology/Medical Science/Biomedical Science/Nursing
  2. At least two years of laboratory work experience
  3. Experience in Immunology research (cellular biology techniques) is desirable
  4. Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  5. Highly motivated, energetic, meticulous and diligent
  6. Have a positive attitude towards learning and self-development
  7. Be able to work independently and in a team, have an investigative nature, attention to detail and record keeping
  8. Competency in basic computer literacy skills
  9. Good manual dexterity skills
More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

Department : Paediatrics

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 9075

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Project Officer.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Research on the below areas
    • Different deep-learning and machine learning based domain-specific acceleration and nanophotonic computing design
    • Optical or electronic architecture-level design, device-level design and domain-specific acceleration
  • Implement these deep-learning based algorithms and perform experiments/evaluation for domain-specific acceleration nanophotonic computing systems
  • Collaborate with other team member(s) for more efficient outcome delivery
  • Perform administrative works assigned by the PI to ensure the smoothness of the project.
Job Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s or above in Computer Science/Engineering or Electronic Engineering at a top-tier university
  • Experience in machine learning, deep learning, nanophotonic design, nanophotonic devices, design automation, embedded systems, real-time systems, computer architecture, computer-aided design, etc or related fields
  • Entry level candidates are welcome to apply
  • Experienced applicants are preferred
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

291,computer research,/en/job/research-engineer-%7C-%5Bresearch-and-project-management-office%5D-i2r-9389914,9389914,"Research Engineer | [Research and Project Management Office], I2R",False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",17-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
We’re looking for innovative and process oriented individual with good knowledge in research office administration, process compliance and experience in project information data analysis and visualization. The Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Understands well the grant calls information, guidelines and T&Cs, ensures compliance to grant eligibility and T&Cs for all grant applications.
  • Coordinates review of grant T&Cs, and clarify any doubts with grantor.
  • Defines timelines for internal review and approval SOP of grant calls; and communicates to researchers for grant applications.
  • Administers the internal technical review, verification of application documents; review and approval of applications by senior management and A*STAR Research Office.
  • Administers grant awards acceptance by senior management.
  • Responsible for filing and maintenance of grant application and award acceptance documentations. Updates of all grants applications and status in internal portal.
  • Liaising with A*STAR Research Office, grantors and internal stakeholders on grant applications and award acceptance matters.
  • Monitoring, reporting and analysis of grant application activities; prepares reports and dashboards for update to management.
  • Reviews and improves SOPs and templates related to internal grants application approval and award acceptance.
Job Requirements
  • Minimum bachelor degree, preferably in the computer/data science or engineering field.
  • 3 – 5 years’ working experience.
  • Experience and/or keen interest in work related to governance/policy/research administration, especially in the research & development sector, is an advantage.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities, able to translate business/process requirements into operation.
  • Meticulous, resourceful, able to multi-task, work independently and deliver results under tight timelines.
  • Able to interact with people at all levels (researchers, management and operation functions).
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (e.g. Word, PowerPoint and in particular Excel).
  • Familiar with data analytics and visualisation tools, such as Tableau; experience in design and development of data backend and data visualisation dashboard is an advantage.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Senior Executive,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg/JobDetails.aspx?ID=2%2bFCBXdZKSBILtwoGKhkRg%3d%3d,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: About Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: A*STAR is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
The Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, focused on developing high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance the competitiveness of Singapore’s manufacturing industry. It collaborates with various multinational and a wide range of local companies in the precision engineering, medtech, aerospace, automotive, marine & offshore, electronics, logistics, general manufacturing and other sectors.","

Job Description:

column1: Polymer Technology Group (PTG) is inviting applications for Research Scientist position in high performance composite manufacturing research. The applicant should have strong fundamentals in computational structural mechanics, material characterization, and interest in developing process techniques that brings out the best value for different fibre reinforced polymer (FRP) composite systems.

Successful applicants are expected to conduct multi-disciplinary research, where optimizing for lightweight performance, manufacturability and designing for circular economy friendly composites will need to be integrated. Fresh PhD graduates with prior working experience in aviation composite structures are welcomed to apply.

The scope of work includes, but not limited to:
??         Project initiation, planning execution and management
??         Process development for thermoplastic or advanced FRP composites, typically forming technologies compatible with prepreg laminates.
??         Process simulation and structural analysis via FEA; Design modifications on process tooling for better parts.
??         Materials characterization, thermal analysis and mechanical testing on composite materials and structures.
??         Design and conduct experimental research to improve on processing techniques and/or material performance.
??         Regular review of research and commercial developments in related manufacturing technologies
??         File patents & know-hows on new development activities, publish in refereed journals and attend approved conferences.
??         Conduct risk assessment, develop safe work procedures for modified systems and processes, and provide training to staff and students.
??         Interact and present findings to research program collaborators and industry adoption partners.
Job Requirements:
??         PhD in Mechanical/ Aeronautical/ Materials Engineering
??         With 2 years of post-doc research or 2 years of industry work experience in composite processing, composite laminate design or structural characterization.
??         Strong in experimental research and familiar with thermal and mechanical characterization for polymer composites.

??         With experienced in Computer Aided Design (Solidworks, Creo), Finite Element and Optimisation Packages (Abaqus, Ansys), Process Simulation (Moldflow, Timon 3D) or Programming Languages for data analysis and scripting (Python, Matlab).
??         Proactive approach in adhering to the health and safety practices of laboratories and workshops.
??         Strong publication track record that commensurate with experience.
??         Team player with good interpersonal, presentation, writing and communication skills.

??         Applicant should have genuine passion for process related research and is comfortable with physical activities, like mold changes, process equipment/system set up and operations, performing essential machinery maintenance and safety checks and working with high temperature processes.

",[],Senior Manager,,2 years,Doctorate (PhD),,"Full-Time, Contract",,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg//online.aspx?ID=5100,70100,Singapore,sg

Access to data is crucial for AI-empowered businesses. However, in an age of heightened user privacy awareness, access to data is not easy. The TrustFUL research program aims to bridge this gap by developing new a trustworthy federated learning paradigm characterized by fairness, transparency, accountability, robustness, security and privacy-protection. School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.
Key Responsibilities: 
The Research Fellow is required to conduct research and development work on federated learning, especially focusing on the aspect of explainability in federated learning, under the project TrustFUL - Trustworthy Federated Ubiquitous Learning:
  • Conduct independent research in the field of federated learning, focusing on incentive mechanism design
  • Help supervise PhD, master and undergraduate students, and R&D staff
  • Help with federated learning technical platform design and development
  • Help with collaboration with existing industry partners
Job Requirements: 
  • PhD degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Mathematics or other related disciplines from a reputable university
  • Good publication track record is a must
  • Previous research experience in explainable AI related fields preferred
  • Previous research experience in the field of federated learning will be advantageous
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

• Hands-on installation of technologies, setting up development environment, coding from scratch, automating build and deployment
• Other ad-hoc duties as assigned

• Experience building highly scalable, distributed systems
• Experience in API design and implementation (REST, GraphQL, etc)
• Good database schema design experiences (SQL/NoSQL)
• Good to have message queue development experience (zeroMQ etc)
• Good to have experience in DevOps culture and practices
• Ability to work on cross-functional projects
• Ability to collaborate effective with remote teams
• Can work independently with minimum guidance
• Excellent written and oral communication skills

The Joint NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) invites applications for the position of Research Engineer.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Work with research team to provide technical solutions
  • Integration, developing, testing, and debugging system
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with research fellows, research associate, and hardware engineers to determine optimal development path
  • Carry out entire system design including component selection, system integration, and engineering test
  • Help with system evaluation, user testing and deployment
Job Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related discipline
  • Proficient in Python and C/C++ programming
  • Experience in implementing machine learning and deep learning method
  • Knowledge of Architecture design and optimization of software and hardware for AI
  • Sufficient experience in building, debugging and testing iOS and Android applications
  • Knowledge and experience in IoT system development is preferred
  • Experience with back-end system (e.g. Python Django, PHP Laravel, Ruby on Rails), integrating services using AJAX, RESTful APIs, and front-end web development is preferred
  • Strong sense of responsibility and work with minimal supervision
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal skills and teamwork
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Conducting research for the project “3D-Assisted Next Generation Face Analysis”
  • Potential topics to be assigned include
    • accurate dynamic 3D reconstruction of facial shape, and motion
    • inference of underlying personal attributes including but not limited to gender, , emotions and moods

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
Prestige BioPharma (PBP) is a Singapore based pharmaceutical group focusing on development of biosimilars and new antibody therapeutics. Visit https://www.prestigebiopharma.com/Over the last few years, we have achieved a breakthrough in the R&D of our pipeline products and established a strong presence and network with customers and suppliers worldwide, actively securing into more and more global pharmaceutical markets.","

Data and Automation Engineer (Reporting to Director of R&D)

Role

The Data and Automation Engineer will work across science and technology to solve complex scientific data problems in a dynamic research environment. They will assist in designing, implementing, and maintaining the tools and infrastructure to organize and empower our scientific data processes and automate our workflows. They will work with scientists to enable seamless collection, organization, sharing, and processing of the data we produce. The ideal candidate will have a background working with life science organizations, experience with a variety of scientific data types, and expertise in automation and integration tools.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with scientists to understand their workflow, data, and automation needs to drive deployment of technology solutions.
  • Develop solutions leveraging and configuring commercial or custom processes to solve business problems.
  • Work collaboratively with internal IT colleagues to build a cohesive data system within the company.
  • Introduce, support and maintain a variety of informatics tools for laboratory instruments, commercial software, and cloud infrastructure to facilitate scientific research.
  • Perform data-centric business analysis and provide pragmatic solutions.
  • Execute and automate standard scientific and statistical analyses.
  • Other duties, as assigned.

Requirements + Qualifications

  • Degree in a relevant scientific or computational field (chemistry, biology, computer science, bio/cheminformatics)
  • 3+ years work experience in a scientific or software/technology role
  • Direct work experience in scientific software administration, automation, or tool development, for example compound registration, assay results management systems, laboratory information management systems (LIMS), and desktop scientific tools
  • An understanding of drug discovery or biotherapeutic development and associated scientific principles and processes
  • Attention to detail, an ability to manage small scale projects, and the perseverance to follow projects to completion.
  • Preferred experience:
  • chemical and biological data and protocols (screening assays, HPLC, LC/MS, binding, CD, etc.) and automation
  • scientifically relevant coding language
  • cloud infrastructure and dev-ops principles
  • A demonstrated ability to think logically and critically
  • Outstanding organizational, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills are critical.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, startup / small company corporate environment is a plus.

Research Engineer I (Computer Engineering/Electrical Electronic Engineering/Mechanical Engineering)
The Data Manment and Analytics Lab (DMAL) at School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE), Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, is seeking 1 motivated IoT research engineer in developing an Cloud AI-based platform to perform intelligent manment and operation for data centres and smart buildings.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • Develop hardened interfaces to devices, sensors, and software, including monitoring, execution, and self-healing processes
  • Research, create, test, and document IoT/IIoT solutions
  • Design, code, and test features of IoT/IIoT devices and platforms
  • Provide solutions to issues related to the connection and communication of networks and platforms
  • Analyse user needs and work as service designers
  • Problem-solve issues with remote/on-site deployments
  • Work closely with tech leader on system design and development
Job Requirements: 
  • Bachelor in Computer Engineering, Electrical and Electronic Engineering or Mechanical Engineering related major from a recognised university
  • Firm understanding of AI, common IoT architectures and principles
  • Proficient knowledge of sensors and communication protocols (e.g. Modbus, OPC, MQTT)
  • Experience with embedded systems like esp8266/32 or Arduino will be a plus
  • Proficient in a server-side programming langu (e.g., Python, Java, or Go)
  • Familiarity with databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MongoDB), experience with any time-series database (e.g. InfluxDB, TimescaleDB) will be a huge plus
  • Experience in software platform development and API designs
Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Key Responsibilities: 

We are seeking a project officer to join a university-level research centre collaborating with industry. The position is for one year, renewable subject to satisfactory performance. Successful candidates will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms either for i) 3D vision, ii) neural rendering or iii) point cloud processing. column1:
","
A Research Associate position is currently available in the NTU-PKU Joint Research Institute (NTU- PKU JRI).
NTU-PKU Joint Research Institute mainly focus on joint research in Multi-Modal Big Data Analytics for Smart Cities. The research will support Singapore’s Smart Nation vision that harnesses technology and data to improve living standards, strengthen communities, and create more business opportunities. The project involves the use of AI for skin quality assessment and face simulation.  It involves face detection & landmark extraction; classification of acne, pigmentation, & wrinkles; and simulation of skin tone, texture, & homogeneity of partial faces.
Job Responsibilities
  • The Research Associate will conduct research on Computer Vision, Image Processing, and Multimedia Forensics for security and surveillance applications. The roles of this position include:
  • Research into Visual Search and Video Analytics related work, including object detection, person re-identification (reID) & tracking, and search & retrieval.
  • Creation of large-scale datasets for research and algorithm evaluation
  • Be part of a research team in the execution of funded research projects
  • Assist in drafting of proposals for research grants in the above areas
Job Requirements
  • Masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science & Analytics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Research experience in Computer Vision, Pattern Recognition, Deep Learning, and working with large-scale datasets
  • Experience with object detection & segmentation, person re-identification, and domain adaptation & generalisation is essential
  • Experience with scripting with game engines (eg. Grand Theft Auto, Unity) and the creation of synthetic datasets would be highly advantageous.
  • Proficiency in software such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, OpenCV, and programming languages such as C/C++ and Python, as well as Linux (eg. Ubuntu) is essential.
  • Knowledge of GPU computing, CUDA programming, optimization (eg. with TensorRT), and industry experience in engineering software development would be an advantage.
  • Good inter-personal skills, with the ability to work with people from varied backgrounds
  • Proficient in English
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Hiring Institution: NTU

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

  • Collect datasets and conduct experiments on the datasets

  • English writing and speaking skills

Continental-NTU Corp Lab is looking for a responsible and talented Research Associate (RA) to support research aiming to develop AI-enabled methods and tools to improve current testing workflow for Continental products. This project will explore possibilities in applying the cutting-edge research in AI (such as reinforcement learning) to automatic testing toolkits with better coverage and less time spent, compared to traditional manual testing method. And thus help accelerate and secure the developing process. The RA will likely be involved in research areas mainly related to reinforcement learning, computer vision, and software/hardware testing.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • Conducting research in cutting edge AI domains (mainly related to reinforcement learning) and software/hardware testing
  • Developing and integrating AI algorithms into the real development progress
  • Participating in co-operation with Continental's development team
  • Preparing academic publications such as pattern and research paper
  • Contributing to writing and presenting seasonal and annual report
Job Requirements: 
  • Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering
  • Strong background and research experience in artificial intelligence, software engineering, automatic testing, Hardware Design
  • Excellent background and experience in programming language, especially python
  • Good communication and report-writing skills
  • Strong responsibility for research and work
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be ified.

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Senior Principal Research Scientist.Key Responsibilities: The Senior Principal Research Scientist to work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics. The role entails the responsibility of project planning, scheduling and formulating operation manment policies, coordination with stakehers for operations manment and organization of cybersecurity events like hackathons, seminars etc. The job also requires coordination with researchers for preparation and submission of reports.
Job Requirements: 
  • ​A PhD in IT, Computer Engineering, or any other relevant field
  • 12 of experience after PhD , preferably in cybersecurity research or IoT system architecture, including at least 5 of project manment experience. Applicants with a master's and a minimum of 16 working experience will be considered
  • A proven track record of international publications in relevant fields
  • Familiar with IoT, virtualization and distributed systems
  • Experience in international research collaboration, security information and event manment (SIEM), malware analysis, machine learning, cyber systems (CPS), or security architectures/frameworks is a plus
  • Proficient in technical reporting/presentations, have good verbal communication skills and be ability to work independently and in a team to realize the proposed works
Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1:
","
Research Fellow (Computer Science/Engineering, Electronic/Electrical Engineering) #SGUnitedJobs #RIE
Programme Summary

The new Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) offers fresh graduates and mid-career job seekers a variety of contract work-and-train opportunities, typically on a two-year basis, in key capability areas in the public sector. The positions offered by NTU under this programme aims to support the development of science and technology talents as they are key to the nation’s ability to meet future challenges and respond to shifts in the global economy.
Successful applicants are employed full-time and receive structured and on-the-job training. By developing in-demand skills, they will be ready to pursue more job opportunities when the economy recovers after the Covid-19 crisis.
About Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China.
The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ageing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.
Over the next five years, the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in ageless aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility.
These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.
Job Description
  • Carry out research in the field of knowledge engine, graph embedding, relationship prediction, online learning, representation learning, and self-supervised learning
  • Help to prepare and submit project proposals related to knowledge graph construction, and knowledge graph mining

The School of Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering (MAE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow. The Research Fellow will work on a hyperspectral imaging and spectroscopy project for the development of a crop health monitoring and nutrient analysis system. The Research Fellow is expected to work with the PI and other team members for doing R & D and take key role for the development and optimization of the proposed system
Key Responsibilities: 
  • Perform research in experimental optics and develop novel approaches to crop health monitoring, nutrient analysis and instrumentation.
  • Conduct and coordinate research within NTU and PFSAP in line with its research strategy and under the supervision of the PIs and Collaborators.
  • Manage the research project in a team-based, cross-functional research environment, which include mentoring students and working with research fellows, collaborators and technical and other support staff.
  • Publish research outcomes in appropriate journals of international standing; Attend and present research findings and papers at academic meetings, and to contribute to the external visibility of the Centre.
  • Draft research report for PIs and undertake specific roles and management functions as may be reasonably required by the PIs.
  • Attend meetings and to participate (where necessary) in other committees and working groups.
  • Ensure compliance with health and safety in all aspects of the research work
​Job Requirements: 
  • Ph.D. in Optics, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Electronics Engineering, Precision Engineering, Computer Engineering or related discipline with optics and instrumentation background
  • Previous experience in hyperspectral imaging, laser spectroscopy, LIBS, and image processing desirable
  • Expertise in handling and maintenance of high power CW and pulsed laser systems is essential
  • Possess good programming, Optical instrumentation, automation and image processing skills (e.g. Electronics, LabView, Zemax, OSLO, TracePro, MATLAB, Python, ImageJ)
  • Proven publication track record would be an advantage
​We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Research Fellow (Computer Science/Engineering, Electronic/Electrical Engineering) #SGUnitedJobs #RIE
Programme Summary

The new Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) offers s and -career job seekers a variety of contract work-and-train opportunities, typically on a two-year basis, in key capability areas in the public sector. The positions offered by NTU under this programme aims to support the development of science and technology talents as they are key to the nation’s ability to meet future challenges and respond to shifts in the global economy.
Successful applicants are employed full-time and receive structured and on-the-job training. By developing in-demand skills, they will be ready to pursue more job opportunities when the economy recovers after the Covid-19 crisis.
About Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China.
The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Langu Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.
Over the next five , the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in less aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility.
These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.
Job Description
  • Carry out research in the field of knowledge engine, graph embedding, relationship prediction, online learning, representation learning, and self-supervised learning
  • Help to prepare and submit project proposals related to knowledge graph construction, and knowledge graph mining
  • Mentor research assistants and students involved in the projects
  • Write papers and reports based on the requirements of the projects
Requirements
  • PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, Electronic/Electrical Engineering, or related areas
  • Research/working experiences on knowledge graph, graph embedding, and self-supervised learning
  • Strong programming skills in Python
  • Familiar with PyTorch and/or Tensorflow
  • There will be a 6-12 months industry attachment

The Centre for Smart Platform Infrastructure Research on Integrative Technology (SPIRIT) of Nanyang Technological University, is a translational RD institute funded by National Research Foundation and supported by Smart Nation Programme Office and GovTech, to develop the Smart Platform Infrastructure to enable applications in Video Analytics, Wireless Sensors Network and other areas required by Singapore as a Smart Nation. Through cutting-edge systems research, SPIRIT Centre aims to enable translational efforts in data science and analytics for solving public sector challenges through innovative solutions.
Job Responsibilities
The successful applicant will be responsible for the development of software platform to support Smart Nation applications.
Key responsibilities include:
  • Design and implement natural langu processing (NLP) algorithms and models, e.g., embedding, named-entity recognition (NER), coreference resolution and parsing
  • Application of NLP in knowledge and information retrieval, and relevancy ranking with spatiotemporal consideration
  • Conduct “translational” research to apply the state-of-the-art solutions at scale for real-world challenges
  • Documentation and scientific reporting
Job Requirements
  • PhD in Computer Science
  • Experience in artificial intelligence (AI) model construction and system development
  • Passionate about the research in AI, and technology innovations and applications
  • Experience in text processing such as NLP will be an added advant
  • Proficient in one or more programming langus (e.g. Python, C/C++, etc.) and research packs/modules
  • Experience in big data processing and analytics
  • Good track record in publication is an advant
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

  • Precision Measurement Experts  / NorthEast / AMK / $6K

Research Fellow (Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering/Mathematics) (R00007080)
Access to data is crucial for AI-empowered businesses. However, in an of heightened user privacy awareness, access to data is not easy. The TrustFUL research program aims to bridge this gap by developing new a trustworthy federated learning paradigm characterized by fairness, transparency, accountability, robustness, security and privacy-protection. School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.
Key Responsibilities:
The Research Fellow is required to conduct research and development work on federated learning, especially focusing on the aspect of federated learning incentive mechanism design, under the project TrustFUL – Trustworthy Federated Ubiquitous
Learning:
  • Conduct independent research in the field of federated learning, focusing on incentive mechanism design
  • Help supervise PhD, master and under students, and RD staff
  • Help with federated learning technical platform design and development
  • Help with collaboration with existing industry partners

Job Requirements:
  • PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mathematics from a reputable university
  • Good publication track record is a must
  • Previous research experience in game theory / mechanism design / communications preferred
  • Previous research experience in the field of federated learning will be advantous

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
﻿JOB DESCRIPTION
  • We are looking for a Researcher/Developer with strong track
  • record of Extended Reality based research and development in
  • advanced manufacturing domains.
  • Successful candidate will take the lead in building wearable
  • vision-based systems and to push forward the research domain
  • of XR and its use cases.
  • The team seeks a high-performance individual who excels in
  • areas related to XR, SLAM, 3D optimization.
  • Such capabilities should be demonstrated through strong
  • publications, and/or successful project outcomes.
JOB REQUIREMENT
  • Bachelor/Master/PhD in Computer Science and Engineering or related fields; in particular Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Photogrammetry
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a research and development role
  • Proficient in C# programming, Unity development and knowledge relating to XR technologies are strong plus points
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Research Associate (Urban Unmanned Traffic Manment Risk Factors for UTM Implementation)
Air Traffic Manment Research Institute invites applications for the position of Research Associate for the project on unmanned traffic manment (UTM). The project will focus on the investigation of implementable UTM strategies that is suitable for Singapore, as well as other factors that should be considered in order to implement UTM in Singapore. The Research Associate will serve as team leaders for the research team working on the safety/risk and manment strategy aspect of the project, respectively.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Work with the research team focusing on the development and implementation of UTM strategies, while taking Unmanned Aircraft's performance requirements and 3rd party risks into consideration
  • Man and coordinate team members for the on-time completion of project milestones and deliverables
  • Report to the Principal Investigator on Research Progress of the research teams
  • Prepare quarterly (administrative) progress report to the funding ncy
  • Prepare technical report to the funding ncy
  • Prepare research publication on the relevant area
  • Accomplish required milestones and deliverable
Job Requirements:
  • Master from acclaimed university in the field of applied mathematics, aeronautical engineering, aviation, computer science, or other relevant majors
  • Excellent programming skill in Python/C++/Java
  • Strong quantitative ability and experiences in optimization, planning, motion control, or decision-making
  • A creative thinker with innovative and curious mind as the program covers fast-changing research areas
  • An independent researcher and a good team player as well to achieve top-notch results of the multi-disciplinary program
  • Minimum of one (1) year experience in leadership position
  • Good written and verbal presentation skill in English
  • Experienced in project manment, production of administrative and technical reports, and presentation to external parties
  • Good record of peer-reviewed research publications
  • Good understanding of aviation terminologies and regulations
  • Able to achieve monthly/quarterly deliverable/KPIs assigned
  • Able to thrive in a high-volume, deadline-driven work environment
  • Willing to accept and perform last-minute job(s) and administrative tasks contributed to the program
  • Able to fulfill multi-tasking requirements, and to accept new job scope in relevant fields
  • Experience with drone flying (UAPL her), air traffic manment, and risk analysis is preferred
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Junior Executive,,1 year,Master's Degree,,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Associate--Urban-Unmanned-Traffic-Management---Risk-Factors-for-UTM-Implementation-_R00005819-1,70000,Singapore,sg

The School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering invites application for the position of Research Fellow. The Research Fellow will work on a A*STAR IAF PP project to conduct the research on development of modeling, simulation, analysis and control techniques.
Responsibilities
  • Development of data-driven traffic models, including network dynamic models, public transportation models and vehicle platooning models.  
  • Development of data-driven network peter estimation techniques.
  • Development of real-time closed-loop traffic signal control strategies.
  • Development of public bus manment methods.
  • Development of vehicle platoon control methods.
  • Development of emergency handling techniques.  
Requirements
  • PhD in Computer Science/Engineering on data analytics, systems and control, operations research, applied mathematics specialized in optimization
  • 1-year research experience in related area
  • Expertise in traffic modeling, simulation, analysis or control
  • Knowledge in basic simulation tools and optimization tools
  • Publication track record is good.
  • Proficiency in English
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Research Fellow (Power Systems/Renewable Energy Management/Optimization/Control Systems)
Energy Research Institute @ NTU invites applications for the position of Research Fellow.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Core expertise: Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, DER Analytical Tools
  • Design and develop deep learning/AI-powered DER analytics & renewable energy/load forecasting tools to enhance distribution grid operations
  • Interval forecasting of renewable power sources & load forecasting tools suited to small geographical areas (e.g., at the level of customers or aggregation areas) to capture the uncertainty, and adequately addressing the requirements of robust/stochastic optimization formulations
  • Research into state-of-the-art solutions in AI-powered DER analytics, deep learning architectures, and generate innovative ideas that can be implemented for distribution grid management
  • Artificial Intelligence/Reinforcement Learning-based analytics & forecasting for distribution grid operations and energy management
Job Requirements:
  • PhD Degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, specialized in Power Systems/Renewable Energy Management/Optimization/Control Systems
  • Minimum 2 years of experience
Proficiency:
  • Programming languages (e.g., R, Python) in view of the abovementioned analytical concepts and techniques
  • Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, Pandas, Numpy, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
  • Experience with building and maintaining Big Data, using open-source technologies such as Hadoop and Cassandra
  • Actor-critic methods, Markov Decision Processes, Monte Carlo Tree Search, Policy Gradients, model-based acceleration, and deep learning (neural networks)
  • Proven skills in Machine Learning (Supervised/Unsupervised/Semi-supervised/Reinforcement Learning); e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, Support Vector Machine (SVM), Random Forest (RF), Bayesian model, neural networks, etc
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Hiring Institution: NTU

Job Description

Fraunhofer IDM Centre@NTU is a leading international research centre for applied Visual Computing at Nanyang Technological University.
We invite applications for a Senior Research Engineer position for immediate intake to work in the area of applied R&D in Virtual Reality. In particular, successful candidates will have a leading role in creating Virtual Reality applications for industrial and professional training use cases. Fraunhofer IDM Centre@NTU offers state of the art research facilities and access to top equipment and provides a vibrant and solution driven research environment with opportunities to work in industrial relevant projects.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Research, software development and application design for Virtual Reality applications including but not limited to professional training simulators and serious games
  • Collaboration with industry and academy
  • Presentation of results to internal and external stakeholders including TV media
Job Requirements:
  • MSc in Computer Science with focus on Virtual or Augmented Reality
  • 6 years of experience in applied R&D in Virtual Reality
  • Expert in C#, Unity and software development for VR headsets (HTC Vive, Oculus Quest 2, ...)
  • Familiar with 3D modelling software (e.g. Autodesk Maya, Cinema 4D)
  • Experience in mobile game design and application development
  • Experience in delivering Virtual Reality solutions for professional training simulations and educational applications
  • Experience in presenting results to TV and print media
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

344,computer research,/en/job/senior-research-scientist-technical-lead-section-manager-worknow-9387397,9387397,Senior Research Scientist / Technical Lead / Section Manager #WorkNow,False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",16-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Background

The Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) develops high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance the competitiveness of Singapore’s manufacturing industry. It collaborates with various multinational and local companies in the Precision Engineering, MedTech, Aerospace, Automotive, Marine, Oil & Gas, Electronics, Semiconductor, Logistics, and other sectors.
The Adaptive Robotics & Mechatronics (ARM) group in SIMTech focused on providing key technologies and expertise for the development of robotics and automation systems. We envisioned to be the leading innovator and most respected automation technology partner for Singapore industry.
The ARM group consists of four teams focusing on research in robot manipulation, mobile robotics, actuation and control as well as design and simulation. Our main research and competencies areas include mechanism design and analysis, thermomechanical modelling, actuator design, real time control design, software architecture design, and artificial intelligence.
  • The robot manipulation section works on research and technology development in new robotic mechanisms and intelligence including force control end-effector modules, adaptive grippers, robotics manipulation and AI for material handling.
  • The mobile robotics section works on development of scalable reconfigurable mobility platform technologies to achieve mobile robot building blocks to quickly customize and synthesize task optimized mobile robots.
  • The actuation and control section uses multi-physics multi-objective optimization approaches to improve control performance as well as the development of new motors and drive electronics.
  • The design and simulation section works on technology development in automation methodologies, electromagnetic, thermofluid & vibration analysis, virtual prototyping & system design optimization as well as multi-physics modelling & simulation.
SIMTech, a research institute under the Agency for Science Technology and Research (A*STAR), is inviting applications for Senior Research Scientist position in the following areas:
  • Industrial Robotics / Reconfigurable robots / Adaptive handling
  • Robotics for Construction/Build Environment
  • Traction Motor design and/or Drives electronics control and development
Responsibilities
  • Identify new research trends in the research community and establish a research team and research roadmap to pursue research in these emerging areas
  • Pushing research boundaries within own research area and to lead the planning and execution of the research roadmap
  • Develop research proposals to secure research grants
  • Lead major initiatives/programmes/projects to push translational research.
  • To engage industry to identify industry needs and technology gaps; Identify and/or support strategic projects, opportunities and propose technical roadmap aligned with business and customer requirements
  • Work in a team of multi-disciplinary experts to execute and deliver on project deliverables
Required Background
  • PhD degree in mechanical/electrical/electronics engineering or computer science.
  • 5 years’ experience in executing and/or managing R&D projects in the relevant area of expertise
  • Knowledge and experience in some industrial sectors are preferred
  • Recognized as a technical expert in research domain and able to influence the research community locally and worldwide
  • Proactive team player and technically motivated to solve problems, innovate and deliver to internal and external customers
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to spark ideas and generate fresh concepts and inspire peers
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Manager,,5 years,Doctorate (PhD),,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg/JobDetails.aspx?ID=XkGV5fpnXYvWm5%2fF5Y7giw%3d%3d,70000,Singapore,sg

The Rehabilitation Research Institute of Singapore (RRIS) invites applications for the position of Project Officer. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 

  • Conduct research for the project 'Towards Data-Driven Ability Gap Modelling'. The project aims to develop computational models for learning and predicting the physical abilities and competencies of individuals to perform previously unobserved tasks, via the use of deep learning methods in conjunction with 3D motion-captured datasets.
  • Carry out extensive amounts of software coding on the latest research platforms.
  • Build and showcase research demo systems.
  • Conduct data collection and processing.
  • Involved in writing research papers.

 
Job Requirements: 

  • Bachelors degree in computer science or related discipline, with good honours classification or equivalent
  • Strong programming skills in C/C++ and Python
  • Previous experience in a related project, or experience with the latest deep learning platforms, is a bonus
  • Communicates well in English

346,computer research,/en/job/user-experience-designer-9408989,9408989,User Experience Designer,False,False,,,SGD,Singapore Post Limited,22-Mar-22,False,,20 days,199201623M,,,2001 - 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"
As Singapore’s designated postal operator, Singapore Post (SingPost) provides mail services to homes and businesses throughout the country, besides pioneering e-commerce and logistics solutions across the Asia Pacific region and beyond. SingPost’s diversified offering includes retail, storage, financial services and integrated business services in addition to its traditional postal activities, and the company now operates in 19 markets with over 7500 employees around the world.

The origins of SingPost can be traced back to 1819, when a single mail office was established to serve the newly-founded British trading post of Singapore. Demand for postal services soon began to grow, and the ‘Post Office’ was officially established as a government department in 1858. To learn more about SingPost’s heritage, please visit https://160.singpost.com/. Today SingPost is listed on the SGX-ST, with its largest shareholders being Singapore Telecommunications Limited (21.8%) and Alibaba Group Holding Limited (14.5%).

Being Singapore’s designated Public Postal Licensee (PPL), a position that was renewed in 2017, SingPost is responsible for managing the country’s 57 post offices, 743 street posting boxes and 11,050 POPStation lockers across 156 locations, as well as issuing stamps, maintaining the national postal code system, processing and delivering average 3 million mail items daily.

SingPost takes a proactive approach to diversifying its operations, while also ensuring that its various subsidiaries and services are seamlessly integrated. In addition to SingPost’s eCommerce business, an ecommerce enabler that provides brands and retailers with integrated ecommerce solutions, SingPost offers  logistics and fulfilment services to businesses through Quantium Solutions across the Asia Pacific region. Another business, Speedpost provides international shipping to more than 200 destinations across the globe and courier services within Singapore, while CouriersPlease delivers parcels throughout Australia, and Famous Holdings offers international freight consolidation and forwarding. Lock+Store offers self-storage solutions in Singapore, Hong Kong and Malaysia. Together, these end-to-end solutions result in a unified organisation with a firm foothold in a wide range of strategic markets, and a shared vision to become a global leader in both communications and e-commerce logistics.

SingPost has received international recognition for the quality of its operations, including awards for customer care, investor relations, digital innovation and e-commerce. Innovative and forward-thinking, SingPost has successfully developed a globally competitive postal and logistics infrastructure which is perfectly positioned to keep pace with Singapore’s ambitious plans for the future.","
The headcount is required to translate user research into design recommendations for customer (user) interfaces, wireframe user flows, develop prototypes and validate product solutions with customers (users), with the purpose of improving user experience across all customer touchpoints.Job Scope
  • Enhance digital interfaces and experience for existing customer touchpoints.
  • Design and co-create digital products using Lean, Agile and user-centred design methodologies.
  • Build intuitive, easy-to-use and accessible solutions to resolve customer painpoints and fulfilment their needs for a positive experience throughout their journey with SingPost.
  • Work towards end outcomes of building impactful customer experiences, creating engagement opportunities and enhancing customer stickiness.
  • Set targets and metrics to measure improvement in User Experience. Examples of such indicators could be Customer Satisfaction, Net Promoter Score, Adoption Rate Visits/Clicks, Search Usage etc
  • Optimise data and insights to enable business stakeholders to justify business decisions, new business opportunity streams, customer-interfacing cost investments and ROI.
Job Responsibilities
  • Capture and analyse customer and business data, mined through usability testing (remote and lab), heuristic analysis, competitor reviews, ethnographic studies, surveys etc, to support design recommendations
  • Enhance digital interfaces and experience for existing customer touchpoints. Examples of touchpoints could include, but is not limited to, websites, applications, digital kiosks, shipment creation portals, customer communication channels etc.
  • Sketch information architecture, wireframe and prototype to design seamless user flows, process flows and intuitive user interfaces
  • Be able to effectively communicate design ideas to product owners, developers and end users
  • Adopt lean and agile learning and testing approaches using user validation with recruited participants
  • Be responsible for creating and evolving a bank of reusable assets
  • Work with developers, vendors and cross-functional teams through all stages of the agile/scrum development cycle processes
  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards
  • Build clickable prototypes to demonstrate UI flow and mocks.
  • Be responsible for improvement of customer experience (CX) and user experience (UX) scores that measure satisfaction level, net promoter score, ease of navigation, adoption rate etc.
Experience and Credentials
  • A degree with preferred field of study or major in Computer Science, Design, Consumer Psychology or Behavioural Science
  • Professional certificate or advanced diploma in UX Design or UX Research courses will be a bonus.
  • At least 3 to 6 years of experience in UX design and product development
  • Worked in Agile and UX development environment, or innovation labs
  • Relevant industry experience in an ecommerce or logistics industry would be an advantage.
  • Hands-on experience in gathering requirements, conducting user research, usability testing, wireframing and delivering prototypes
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Possess a user-centric mindset in developing precise, value-driven solutions
  • Demonstrates good teamwork, openness and flexibility to co-create or re-engineer changes
  • Strong communication and influencing skills
",[],Manager,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)', 'Flexible benefits']",https://singpost.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/externalCareersSite/job/SingPost-Centre-Level-07/User-Experience-Designer_R-100421-3?source=Jobstreet,70000,Singapore,sg

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.
