School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Senior Research Engineer to work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics.
Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Research Engineer position entails the responsibility of designing network architecture for IoT systems and honeynet, managing IoT systems and honeynet for threat analytics, packet and payload analytics and reporting related to IoT systems. The job also requires conducting research, preparing reports and publishing papers.
Job Requirements: 
  • Master's degree in Computer Science /Computer Engineering /Information or Communication Science/Engineering
  • Applicants with Bachelor of Science/Bachelor in Engineering and minimum of 10 years working experience in the domain of security and/or networks will be considered. Less experience may also be considered if the applicant has research experience in the specific domain of IoT security
  • Proven research competence and publication record
  • Familiar with network design, system management, IoT networks and systems with deep knowledge in packet and payload analysis in the context of networks and systems
  • Familiar with tools and techniques applicable to IoT systems and/or cybersecurity
​We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","

The Strategic Centre for Research in Privacy-Preserving Technologies & Systems (SCRiPTS) invites applications for the position of Research Engineer I. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 

  • Design and development of privacy and security related system platforms, both from scratch and from open sources.
  • Design and develop software that meets specified standards of end-user requirements.
  • Design and develop system software that meets specified standards of end-user requirements.
  • Implement cloud systems, web services, API software and middleware for the Centre's privacy preserving technologies and machine learning platforms.
  • Build flexible and reliable applications on cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Microsoft Azure; as and when required by the team.
  • Learn to utilise advanced privacy preserving technologies.


Job Requirements: 

  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in computer science/ engineering or related fields.
  • Proficiency in programming languages Java, C/C++ is a must.  Experience in other programming languages and/or frameworks such as Python, Go, Spring will be an advantage.
  • Proficiency with using common Linux distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL etc. (including shell scripting) is a must.
  • Proficiency and experience with modifying open sources and/or developing system software platform for security/privacy such as clusion library or openSSE is a must.
  • Proficiency in installing, configuring and using SQL database is a must.  Experience in other data processing technologies such as NoSQL, Hadoop will be an advantage.
  • Experience on networking, communication protocols and socket programming is a must, as this is needed to develop backend messaging requirements for certain privacy libraries

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of  Senior Research Engineer.
Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Research Engineer (SRE) will work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics. The SRE role entails the responsibility of monitoring IoT systems and honeynet for threat activities and incident response, behavioral analysis of threat activities and incidents in IoT systems and honeynet and identification of tactics, techniques and procedures of threat actors in the honeynet. The SRE also requires to conduct research, preparing reports and publishing papers.
Job Requirements:
  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field
  • Applicants with Master of Science/Master in Engineering and a minimum of 6 working experience in the domain of security and/or systems will be considered
  • Applicants with Bachelor’s in Computer Science /Computer Engineering /Information Or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field and minimum 10 of working experience in various software development projects and/or security/analytics related development projects in the industry. Less experience may also be considered if the applicant has research experience in the specific domain of IoT security
  • Proven research competence and publication record will be considered as an advant
  • Familiarity with machine learning tools and techniques related to anomaly detection
  • Familiarity with identification of cybersecurity events, trends and patterns in IoT systems
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: ScienTec Personnel focusses on professional/specialist recruitment and general staffing across all industries in key functions such as Administration, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, HR, Technical, and Engineering. A division of ScienTec Consulting Pte Ltd, the group has since its inception in 2001, redefined the standards of HR services by transforming organisations across Asia Pacific with its 4 principal services: Staffing, Executive Search, Outsourcing and Consulting. The group's 20 industry awards and 600+ customer testimonials are the result of its high service standards centered on its core value of 'People First, Always'.

It has 2 other business divisions – ScienTec Search which specialises in senior leadership and specialist search for key industries such as Biotechnology, Pharma, Medical Devices, Consumer Healthcare, FMCG, Technology and Engineering; and ScienTec Consulting, the group’s HR consulting division, which provides services such as Recruitment Process Outsourcing, Social Media Recruitment, Payroll Services, Work Pass Applications, Compliance Framework and Legislation Practices.

ScienTec has won more than 20 industry awards such as Recruitment Agency of the year, Best Client Service, Best Candidate Experience, Etc. In addition, we are the overall winner for Asia Recruitment Grand Winner – Recruitment Agency.
ScienTec is part of Will Group (https://willgroup.co.jp/en/profile/group.html) and candidates’ applications may be used by our affiliated companies for the sole purpose of recruitment.

  • Responsible for the cloud of the projects from initiation to  implementation
  • Research on business and application requirements, review organisational Cloud infrastructure as well as design and implement the cloud architecture to meet current and future requirements
  • Experience in technical expertise in the area of Infrastructure Services, with appreciation in one or more areas of Infrastructure Management, Cloud Computing and DevOps Engineering concepts

column2:
Dynamite Games is an indie game studio specialising in mobile game development on Unity and Html5. In less than 2 years, we have grown from 11 members to 100+ and shipped more than 2 dozen games growing our daily active player base by the thousands every month. We also build other creative products that compliment our business model and aspire to drive it to the next level. With such a trajectory, we have every intention to keep the momentum going for the good work done by the talented and enthusiastic game lovers in the studio.We have Dynamite Games makers in Singapore(HQ), Malaysia, Vietnam and Taiwan. We have battle-tested entrepreneurs and leaders leading each functional department from developing games to marketing and operationalising them. We look forward to bolstering our engineering capabilities with this listing.","

Responsibilities:

· Does extensive market research and dissection of game products and potential game mechanics.

· Working alongside other game designers to assist in the creative processes of game ideas and problem-solving.

· Design fair and balanced math models, systems/content based on the overall game creative direction to meet the KPI requirements;

· Create effective documentation for all systems designed in a clear manner & make it understandable for the entire development team;

· Maintain a data-driven design methodology for systems/content design through careful analysis of user feedback and key metrics to adjust gameplay and balance;

· Collaborate effectively with other departments of the development team (Tech, Art, QA, Product, etc) to create the best product possible;

Requirements:

· Degree in Game Design, Computer Science or any relevant field.

· 1-2 year(s) working experience or have shipped at least 1-2 game(s) as a designer or relevant fields.

· A proactive team player who can communicate clearly and constructively.

· Capable of working in a dynamic environment with shifting priorities.

· Knowledgeable in math concepts such as Probability and Statistics.

· High level of competency in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace software tools, especially Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets;

· Ability to create detailed and effective documentation as well as basic mock-ups based on UX design theories;

· Comprehensive knowledge and a deep passion for games across multiple genres of PC/mobile games and relevant game design theories;

Bonus Points:

· Experience working with game engines such as Cocos Creator and Unity;

· Experience working with agile production methodologies and relevant project management tools such as JIRA;

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
The Affective and Social Intelligence Group focuses on developing and applying new intelligent systems that are capable of recognizing emotions from multi-modal visual and non-visual (voice, language) cues. To attain to a new height of our research impact, we seek to pursue advanced research building next-generation machine intelligence incorporating socio-technical considerations including but not limited to empathy, value, goal and strategy. Our research is highly interdisciplinary, and we seek to establish leadership in the intersection area of Empathy AI, Affective Computing and Computational Social Science.
The candidate will assume the responsibility as a lead researcher who shall contribute to the architecture and systems development, and lead in research activities including critical literature review, theoretical analyses, appropriation and evaluation of these systems in potential applications. The candidate will also have opportunities to work closely with the lead investigators, research scientists and engineers, collaborators and experts from the industry partners, to engage in both the basic research as well as translational research activities that bring the research outcomes into real-world impact.
JOB REQUIREMENT
  • A PhD degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Computer Engineering / Information Systems / Computational Social Science or equivalent
  • A compelling scientific publications track record and demonstrable independent research capabilities
  • Hands-on experience in using machine learning, deep learning frameworks and models
  • Proficient with programming languages (e.g., Python, C/C++, Matlab)
  • Cross-disciplinary research experiences are especially valued
  • Candidates with no relevant working experience are welcomed to apply
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Senior Executive,,2 years,Doctorate (PhD),,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg/JobDetails.aspx?ID=w4l8szYN5Aht5qtb4lgFYQ%3d%3d,70000,Singapore,sg

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

368,computer research,/en/job/specialist-associate-health-screening-coordinator-9402712,9402712,Specialist Associate (Health Screening Coordinator),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,22-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description


- Take consent from research participants before performing any research procedures. 
- Perform health screening procedures including Venepuncture, Urinalysis, Foot assessment, ECG, Vision test, Handgrip measurement, Spirometry, Fundoscopy and Anthropometric measurements according to work instructions and Standard Operating Procedures. 
- Proper handling and preservation of biological samples. 
- Perform data entry and data QC of health screening data forms and reports. 
- Verify cash and clinical consumables daily. 
- Maintain clinical inventory and equipment. 
- Conduct home visits (depends on types of project). 
- Conduct face-to-face and phone interviews with participants. 
- Post health screening telephone follow-up call.    
- Generate and prepare health screening reports to be mailed to participants. 
- Ensure the safety and protect the privacy of research participants by ensuring proper work practices. 
- Any other duties as assigned by the supervisor. 

Qualifications


- Degree in Life Sciences or relevant field from a recognised institution. Diploma holders of Life Sciences discipline or registered nurses may apply. 
- Willing to work 42 hours week from Monday to Friday and every Saturday morning (half a weekday will be given as off-in-lieu). Work hours are subjected to changes depending on project needs. 
- Willing to work at Bras Basah Complex and NUS. 
- Ablility to interact with people of various age groups and background. 
- Meticulous, proficient in English and fluent in spoken Mandarin or Malay or Tamil , to communicate with non-English speaking participants (Most of our participants in this Cohort revisits are elderly and some of them don't speak English). 
- Phlebotomy skill would be an advantage. 
- Comfortable using computers and tablets for data collection. 
- Successful candidate will be appointed on 1 year contract in the first instance and renewable subject to funding and performance. 

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.[1]

[1]  MOM Updated advisory on COVID-vaccination at the Workplace, subject to changes in accordance with the national COVID-19 measures

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health

Department : Dean's Office (SSH Sch of Public Health)

column1:
","
School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) is looking for suitable candidates to join them as Research Associate.The Research Associate will design and implement a blockchain-based system for secure and privacy-aware distributed machine learning. The first part is about the training process of a model, in which parties upload privacy-preserving updates (e.g., privacy-preserving gradients/features) to the blockchain. The second part is to track and conserve the accumulated privacy cost, since throughout the lifetime of a party's data, each uploaded privacy-preserving update can cost the privacy budget of the party's data. The third part is that after a model is trained, we need to have a market for securely exchanging models.
Key Responsibilities: 
  • Design and implement a blockchain-based subsystem for secure and privacy-aware federated learning;
  • Design and implement a blockchain-based subsystem for saving and tracking user data's privacy cost spent in machine learning
  • Design and implement a blockchain-based secure market for exchanging machine learning models.
  • Apply blockchains to 6G wireless communications and intelligent reflecting surfaces
Job Requirements: 
  • ​A master's degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or Electronic/Electrical Engineering
  • Good communication and coordination skills
  • Positive working attitude and a good team player
  • Strong sense of responsibility and able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Self-motivated and able to multi-task
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Junior Executive,,1 year,Master's Degree,,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Associate--Computer-Science-Engineering-Electronic-Electrical-Engineering-_R00008931-1/apply,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Responsibilities:
  • To design and develop deep learning-driven capabilities for intelligent edge computing services in 5G-and-beyond industrial Internet-of-Things networks.
  • To design and develop data-driven capabilities for industrial 5G and- beyond communications.
  • To design and develop theoretical performance analysis frameworks for 5G-and-beyond industrial Internet-of-Things networks.
  • To testbed and evaluate the feasibility of intelligent edge computing services and data-driven industrial 5G-and-beyond communications for industrial partners and stakeholders based on practical scenarios and requirements from industry.
  • Translate factory automation related emerging technology use case requirements into grant and project proposals.
  • To address industry needs by overseeing, leading, presenting and delivering intelligent edge computing services and data-driven industrial 5G-and-beyond solutions to member companies and stakeholders
  • Writing of technical reports and presentation of technical solutions and results for grant applications.
Job Requirements:
  • PhD in wireless communications and networks, computer science, electrical & electronic engineering, electrical & computer engineering, and related fields.
  • Good knowledge and experience of data analytics and machine learning/deep learning techniques to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Good knowledge and experience in communication protocol stacks and networks in general, and wireless communication networks.
  • Good knowledge and research experience in 5G communications, multi-access edge computing, and applied machine learning in wireless communications.
  • Good programming experience in Python, MATLAB, Mathematica.
  • Team player and strong interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong track record in leading research publications.
  • Motivated self-starter with a strong enthusiasm to learn.
  • Results-oriented with a strong sense of ownership in delivering for members and stakeholders.
  • Prior experience working in data-driven related wireless communications projects is a plus.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Research Scientist II/lll (Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics Group)SIMTech
Background
The mission of the Adaptive Robotics and Mechatronics (ARM) group in the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) is to provide key technologies and expertise for the development of robotics and automation systems. The main research and competencies areas include mechanism design and analysis, thermomechanical modeling, actuator design, real time control design, software architecture design, and artificial intelligence. The group consists of four sections focusing on research in robot manipulation, mobile robotics, actuation and control as well as design and simulation.
In particular, the actuation and control section works on technology development in motion control for high performance systems, and the design and optimization of new electromagnetic motors and drive electronics of power drivetrains. Typical applications are in the electronics, semi-conductor and automotive sectors.
SIMTech, a research institute under the Agency for Science Technology and Research (A*STAR), is inviting applications for Research Scientist position in the following area:
  • Design and development of power electronics, power converters
Responsibilities
  • Identify strategic projects, opportunities and propose technical roadmap aligned with business and customer requirements
  • Recognized as a technical expert in research domain and able to influence across teams/divisions to deliver technically
  • Keep informed about cutting-edge technology within specific technical area to envision future innovation in technology roadmap
  • Lead major initiatives/programmes/projects to advance the technology and/or industry applications.
  • Lead and manager team members to execute research roadmap based on business and industry requirement
Job Requirements:
  • PhD degree in mechanical/electrical/electronic engineering or computer science.
  • With 5 years’ experience in executing and/or managing R&D projects in related electronics domain
  • Proactive team player and technically motivated to solve problems, innovate and deliver to internal and external customers
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Knowledge and experience in automotive sector is preferred.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column1:
","
Research Associate (Computer Science/Engineering) #SGUnitedJobs #RIE
Programme Summary

The new Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) offers s and -career job seekers a variety of contract work-and-train opportunities, typically on a two-year basis, in key capability areas in the public sector. The positions offered by NTU under this programme aims to support the development of science and technology talents as they are key to the nation’s ability to meet future challenges and respond to shifts in the global economy.
Successful applicants are employed full-time and receive structured and on-the-job training. By developing in-demand skills, they will be ready to pursue more job opportunities when the economy recovers after the Covid-19 crisis.
About Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China.
The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Langu Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.
Over the next five , the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in less aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility.
These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.
Job Descriptions
  • Conducting research in the area of federated learning for the Internet of Things applications from security and efficiency aspects
  • Writing high-quality research papers targeting prestigious conferences and journals in the relevant fields
  • Coordinating research projects and mentoring PhD students and research assistants involved in the projects
  • Preparing and writing some project proposals related to research projects
Requirements
  • Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
  • Candidates with Bachelor’s in relevant field may be considered for Research Assistant role
  • Strong scientific publication profile and record
  • Strong research responsibilities in project manment
  • Strong programming skills on Python and Matlab
  • There will be a 6-12 months industry attachment

column2: About Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology (IMCB)

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology (IMCB) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Biomedical Research Council, established as a premier molecular and cell biology institute with a strategic focus on use-inspired research in the following areas: cancer cell signaling and therapies, cell biology and therapies as well as innovative technologies for disease modelling and target validation. Our mission is to grow and energise the local biotech ecosystem, supporting Singapore’s biotech inflexion by fostering collaborations with industry, developing new innovative technologies and spin-off companies. We are also a talent incubator, having trained many prominent biomedical scientists in the biotech ecosystem today.","

column1: Job Description

The Neurodevelopment Research Centre serves as a test lab where we invite children and their parents to come for neuropsychological assessments, behavioral observations and bio sampling. A Research Assistant position is currently available in the Nanyang Environment Water Research Institute. This position is under the research project on Scale-up the Fabrication of High-Performance Aquaporin (AQP)-based Biomimetic Hollow Fiber Membranes for Water Reuse Desalination.
Job Responsibilities
  • Provide day-to-day support in the operation lab for biomimetic hollow fiber membrane fabrication
  • Conduct laboratory study to develop hollow fiber membrane assembly
  • Perform water sample analysis
  • Perform aquaporin preparation
  • Prepare progress reports and presentations
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor's from a reputable university in chemical/environmental engineering
  • Relevant research experience on membrane technology, especially in gas separation
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Computer proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Able to execute individual tasks and work in a project team
  • Water treatment process knowledge is preferred
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
The Berezovsky group at Bioinformatics Institute seeks to hire a Research Officer to work on research projects involving computational modelling of protein allostery and in silico drug design. The group’s various contributions towards fundamental understanding of protein allostery (Curr Opin Struct Biol. 2019, 56:18; PLoS Comput Biol. 2018, 14:e1006228; Structure. 2019, 27:866; J Phys. Chem. B. 2021, 125:3763) and biomedical application (Trends Pharmacol. Sci. 2018, 39:49; Curr Opin Struct Biol. 2020, 62:149) are well recognized in the field. We have recently embarked on a project focusing on the computational design and prediction of potential allosteric drugs to target important proteins involved in cancers and COVID-19. The Research Officer will work together with the team in this cutting-edge research. For more information please visit https://www.a-star.edu.sg/bii/research/bsmd/pebm
Job Requirements:
  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences, biological sciences or related fields
  • Basic computing/programming skills is preferable but not necessary
  • Experience and knowledge in structural biology is preferable
  • Independent, open-minded personality, and willingness to work in a team is a must
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

A Research Associate position is available in the Centre for System Intelligence and Efficiency, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Job Responsibilities:
  • Conduct research and development on state-of-the-art image classification, as well as its applications on vehicle systems
  • Conduct research and development on related hardware using such as camera
  • Conduct research and development on road cleanliness monitoring, as well as its applications on vehicle systems
  • Create database for automatic data/video recording, sorting and reporting
  • Prepare technical reports and presentations to report the research outcomes to public stakeholders
  • Liaise with Engineers from industry partner
Job Requirements:
  • Master's degree in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering with a related background in image classification
  • Demonstrated independent research skills in computer vision, especially in image classification
  • Excellent programming skills in Python or C++, Pytorch
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Familiar with the state-of-the-art methodologies for image classification
  • Organized and detail oriented
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Senior Research Engineer.
Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Research Engineer (SRE) position entails the responsibility of designing and developing analytics tools for threat intelligence in IoT systems and honeynet, automation of detection and analysis of threats and incidents in IoT systems and honeynet. The SRE also requires to participate in research, preparing reports and/or publishing papers.
Job Requirements:
  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field
  • Applicants with Master of Science/Master in Engineering and a minimum of 6 working experience in the domain of security and/or systems will be considered
  • Applicants with Bachelor’s in Computer Science /Computer Engineering /Information Or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field and Minimum 10 of working experience in various software development projects and/or security/analytics related development projects in the industry. Less experience may also be considered if the applicant has development experience in the specific domain of IoT security
  • Familiarity with design and development of data analytics packs, tools, dashboards and strong programming skills with experience in prominent langus (like Python, C/C++, Java, JS), database technologies (SQL, NoSQL), design of APIs, web programming and/or UI/UX

column1:
","
Research Associate (Computer Science/Engineering) #SGUnitedJobs #RIE
Programme Summary

The new Work and Skills Immersion Programme (WSIP) offers s and -career job seekers a variety of contract work-and-train opportunities, typically on a two-year basis, in key capability areas in the public sector. The positions offered by NTU under this programme aims to support the development of science and technology talents as they are key to the nation’s ability to meet future challenges and respond to shifts in the global economy.
Successful applicants are employed full-time and receive structured and on-the-job training. By developing in-demand skills, they will be ready to pursue more job opportunities when the economy recovers after the Covid-19 crisis.
About Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) and Alibaba Group officially launched the Alibaba-NTU Singapore Joint Research Institute (JRI) in February 2018. This is Alibaba’s first research institute on AI outside China.
The joint research institute seeks to combine NTU’s human-centred AI technology which has been applied to areas such as health, ing, homes and communities, with Alibaba’s leading technologies including Natural Langu Processing (NLP), computer vision, machine learning and cloud computing to explore further technology breakthroughs and real-life AI solutions.
Over the next five , the JRI will push the frontiers of AI to change the current technology-centric philosophy of AI research into one which is human-centric. The goal is make AI to become more effective, accessible and inclusive so that it can address future societal needs in less aging, new lifestyles and human-centered mobility.
These AI and cloud technologies will be developed and tested on the NTU Smart Campus to demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions before taking them to the market in Singapore and rest of the world. The program dovetails with Singapore’s ambition to train AI and data-science talent to support the country’s “Smart Nation” vision and its transformation to “Industry 4.0”. The JRI are led by researchers from NTU-UBC Research Centre of Excellence in Active Living for the Elderly (LILY) and the School of Computer Science and Engineering.
Job Descriptions
  • Conducting research in the area of federated learning for the Internet of Things applications from security and efficiency aspects
  • Writing high-quality research papers targeting prestigious conferences and journals in the relevant fields
  • Coordinating research projects and mentoring PhD students and research assistants involved in the projects
  • Preparing and writing some project proposals related to research projects
Requirements
  • Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
  • Candidates with Bachelor’s in relevant field may be considered for Research Assistant role
  • Strong scientific publication profile and record
  • Strong research responsibilities in project manment
  • Strong programming skills on Python and Matlab
  • There will be a 6-12 months industry attachment
",[],Junior Executive,,2 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Associate--Computer-Science-Engineering---SGUnitedJobs--RIE_R00007213-1,70150,West,sg

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Senior Research Engineer.
Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Research Engineer (SRE) position entails the responsibility of designing and developing analytics tools for threat intelligence in IoT systems and honeynet, automation of detection and analysis of threats and incidents in IoT systems and honeynet. The SRE also requires to participate in research, preparing reports and/or publishing papers.
Job Requirements:
  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field
  • Applicants with Master of Science/Master in Engineering and a minimum of 6 years working experience in the domain of security and/or systems will be considered
  • Applicants with Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Computer Engineering /Information Or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field and Minimum 10 years of working experience in various software development projects and/or security/analytics related development projects in the industry. Less experience may also be considered if the applicant has development experience in the specific domain of IoT security
  • Familiarity with design and development of data analytics packages, tools, dashboards and strong programming skills with experience in prominent languages (like Python, C/C++, Java, JS), database technologies (SQL, NoSQL), design of APIs, web programming and/or UI/UX
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The S-Lab for Advanced Intelligence invites applications for the position of Research Associate. 
We are seeking a research associate to join a university-level research centre collaborating with industry. The position is for one year, renewable subject to satisfactory performance. The Research Associate will conduct research and develop advanced deep learning algorithms for self-supervised learning. Candidates are expected to have a strong background in relevant areas.

Key Responsibilities: 
  • To independently undertake research in computer vision and machine learning.
  • To produce research reports and/or publications as required by the funding body or for dissemination to the wider academic community.
  • To provide guidance and support to any students associated with the project.
  • To attend, contribute, and where necessary lead relevant meetings.
  • To undertake any other duties relevant to the programme of research.
Job Requirements: 
  • Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent.
  • Candidates with Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equivalent with relevant years of working experience may also apply.
  • Strong background in machine learning and computer vision. Prior experience in self-supervised learning is preferable.
  • Strong publication records in top-tier machine learning or computer vision conferences/journals, such as TPAMI, IJCV, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICML and AAAI.
  • Knowledge of scientific or engineering software like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, etc.    
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The CAP Group at School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE), Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, is seeking 1 motivated Research Fellow with AI knowledge background. The Research Fellow will be responsible for the research and development of our machine learning systems, towards smart grid and green data center.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Conduct cutting-edge research and development in the machine learning field
  • Publish high-quality papers in high-impact journals and conferences
  • Transfer advanced technologies to real-world applications (smart grid, data center operation, etc)
  • Conduct literature review and write high-quality surveys
  • Present research insights to team members and external partners
  • Produce and file technical disclosure (TD) and intellectual property (IP)
  • Mentor PhD or Master students to improve their research skills
Job Requirement:
  • PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related disciplines
  • Possess at least one of the following two skill sets:
  • Set A
    • Hands-on research experience in machine learning field
    • Experienced on multi-modality learning or transfer learning
    • Skills of deploying and managing AI models on edge and cloud
  • Set B
    • Research experiences in smart grid controlling and energy trading
    • Master electrical engineering skills, e.g. construct and modify Matlab Simulink or Opal-RT models
  • Prefer candidates with publications in top-tier venues such as NIPS, ICML, AAAI, etc
  • Highly competent in algorithms and programming; Strong coding skills in Python
  • Work and collaborate well with team members
  • Ability to work independently and proactively
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
We are looking for a candidate who is familiar with and have experience in natural language understanding, and machine translation. A candidate is required to combine research and development skills to advance the machine translation performance.
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Computational linguistics or related areas
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python/ C++ /Java)
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing theory and applications
  • Familiar with problems related to language processing for different languages, understand the nuances of languages, problems and limitations of state-of-the-art methods and approaches for NLP applications.
  • Team spirit and problem solving ability
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) invites applications for the position of Senior Research Engineer.
Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Research Engineer will work on a project related to Smart Nation IoT-system Threat Analytics. The SRE role entails the responsibility of developing tools to automate malware detection, prioritization and analysis and developing sandbox environments to replay and attribute malware samples. The SRE also requires participating in research, preparing reports and/or publishing papers.
Job Requirements:
  • PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field
  • Applicants with Master of Science/Master in Engineering and a minimum of 6 working experience in the domain of security and/or systems will be considered
  • Applicants with Bachelor’s in Computer Science /Computer Engineering /Information Or Communication Science/Engineering or any other relevant field and minimum 10 of working experience in various software development projects and/or security/analytics related development projects in the industry. Less experience may also be considered if the applicant has development experience in the specific domain of IoT security
  • Familiarity with tools and techniques applicable to malware detection and analysis, strong programming skills with experience in prominent langus (like Python, C/C++, Java, JS), database technologies (SQL, NoSQL), design of APIs, and/or system-level programming
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column1:
","
Research Associate (Applied Mathematics/Aeronautical Engineering/Aviation/Computer Science)
Air Traffic Manment Research Institute invites applications for the position of Research Associate for the project on unmanned traffic manment (UTM). The project will focus on the investigation safety risk factors that should be considered to implement UTM in Singapore, develop and perform risk analysis to determine the existing level of risk, the determination of performance requirements to ensure an acceptable level of risk is achieved, as well as development of UAS airworthiness requirements. The RA will serve as team leaders for the research team working on the UAS safety/risk and airworthiness aspect of the project, respectively.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead the research team focusing on 1) UTM safety and risk manment and 2) Development of UAS Airworthiness Requirements
  • Perform investigation of relevant risk factors for the Singapore UTM airspace, develop and perform risk analysis to determine the existing level or risk, and the determination of performance requirements to ensure an acceptable level of risk is achieved
  • Man and coordinate team members for the on-time completion of project milestones and deliverables
  • Report to the Principal Investigator on Research Progress of the research teams
  • Prepare quarterly (administrative) progress report to the funding ncy
  • Prepare technical report to the funding ncy
  • Prepare research publication on the relevant area
Job Requirements:
  • Master from acclaimed university in the field of applied mathematics, aeronautical engineering, aviation, computer science, or other relevant majors
  • A creative thinker with innovative and curious mind as the program covers fast-changing research areas
  • An independent researcher and a good team player as well to achieve top-notch results of the multi-disciplinary program
  • Minimum of one (1) year experience in leadership position
  • Good written and verbal presentation skill in English
  • Experienced in project manment, production of administrative and technical reports, and presentation to external parties
  • Good record of peer-reviewed research publications
  • Familiarity with risk analysis, acceptable level of safety (aviation), and airworthiness is a must
  • Good understanding of aviation terminologies and regulations on aviation safety, specifically in risk analysis and airworthiness requirements, is a must
  • Experience with drone flying (UAPL her), risk analysis and airworthiness is preferred
  • Hands-on skills with programming langu (e.g., MATLAB, Python), Finite Element Software (e.g., ABAQUS, LS-Dyna) and Computational Fluid Dynamics (e.g ANSYS-Fluent) is preferred
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

1) ​​Plan research works and perform laboratory based tasks for the research project

2) Perform statistical analysis and prepare progress and final report for research project​​

3) Involve in safety management in the laboratory

Qualifications
  • A good university degree in Science
  • Minimum of 1 year of relevant working experience
  • Able to perform molecular and cellular biology techniques such as SDS page, western blot, ELISA, cell culture and basophil activation test
  • Have knowledge of computer applications, e.g. SPSS, MS office, PowerPoint and Excel
  • Have experience in immunology research and statistical analysis
  • Positive attitude - Able to work independently and as a team
  • Meticulous, able to work well under pressure and commitment to meeting tight deadlines
More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

Department : Paediatrics

Employee Referral Eligible: No

410,computer research,/en/job/associate-clinical-research-coordinator-contract-9392244,9392244,Associate Clinical Research Coordinator (Contract),False,False,,,SGD,SingHealth Polyclinics,18-Mar-22,False,,29 days,52928775K,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"
SingHealth Polyclinics, a leader in family medicine, provides seamless, patient-centred and preventive healthcare that is affordable and accessible to all.

SingHealth Polyclinics' network of polyclinics provides primary healthcare services to the community. It plays an integral role in promoting a healthy lifestyle within the community and empowering families with the knowledge of common health issues, care and treatment options.
<div>
SingHealth Polyclinics is a member of Singapore Health Services (SingHealth) - a public healthcare cluster which also manages three hospitals and five specialty centres.

","

The Centre for Research in Child Development (CRCD) at National Institute of Education (NIE) in collaboration with SingHealth Polyclinics has recently launched the BE-POSITIVE study (Beginning Early: Singapore’s Ongoing Study starting in Infancy of Twenty-first-century skills, Individual differences and Variance in the Environment). Primary goal of this study is to better examine the interaction between home and school influences to understand child development and academic success, starting in ages 0-4 years. In this study, we invite children and their parents to come for neuropsychological assessments and behavioural observations.

Responsibilities:

  • Handle queries/screen potential/interested participants and provide relevant information as and when required
  • Assist with consent taking and/or data collection wherever necessary which will primarily involve children ranging from 0-4 years and their parents/caregivers
  • Schedule appointments visits with study participants
  • Perform data entry and maintain proper study-related documentation
  • Assist with logistics and administrative tasks
  • Ensure compliance to study protocols, established procedures and timeline

Requirements:

  • Diploma in Life Science/Nursing
  • Minimum 1-2 years of experience will be an advantage
  • Ability to read and write in English and Mother Tongue is essential for communication with parents
  • Team player - To work with a large enthusiastic team with Principal Investigators, Clinical Research Coordinators and project managers
  • Proactive, willing to learn, possess good communication skills and able to multi-task
  • Enjoy working with young children
  • Basic computer skills to administer computer based experiments
",[],Non-Executive,,1 year,"Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)', 'Regular Work Hours']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9392244&advertisement_id=9390615&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,701702,Bukit Merah,sg

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
We seek highly motivated research scientists with talents and inclination to conduct cutting-edge research, develop and execute research strategies in Physics-based AI to combine AI/Machine Learning with physics (e.g. physical/mathematical models, equations).
Job Responsibilities
  • Build world-class capabilities and excellence in Physics-based AI to be recognized by international research communities
  • Work with scientists with both AI and physics background in IHPC to develop fundamental physics-based AI framework and algorithms, and publish high impact papers to advance science
  • Execute programmes to ensure timely delivery of project milestones with high-quality outcomes
Requirements
  • PhD degree in Computer Science/Electrical & Electronics Engineering/Computer Engineering or equivalent
  • Research experience in one or more areas of AI, such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Graph Neural Networks, Generative Adversarial Networks, Statistical Learning.
  • Strong track record of research in AI and Scientific Computing
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

  • Expert knowledge in optimization and programming would be a plus
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

416,computer research,/en/job/chemist-9403140,9403140,Chemist,False,True,,,SGD,,22-Mar-22,False,,,,,,,,,"
A company that was incorporated in 2009 and commenced operations in Singapore, with our core business in sales and distribution of FMCG products.
In line with the business expansion program, we are now seeking for qualified and dynamic professional to join our family and grow with us!
Our MISSION statement
1. To make a difference through our people, working together across boundaries.
2. Be righteous by upholding the highest standards of integrity in all our actions.
3. We encourage development and reward performance.
","
JOB SUMMARY
The incumbent shall be responsible to undertake research and development work, particularly in the area of extraction of material from botanical products. This will require experience and skill in utilizing various technology in undertaking his or her role to meet company’s objectives.
The role shall work closely with key senior personnel and management in understanding the needs of the company and meeting timelines in producing desired research results. The main duties of the incumbent can be summarized as follows:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Performing extraction of material or materials from botanical products by various methods
  • Optimization of extraction methods, purification of separated components and their analysis
  • Analysis of isolated compounds and interpretation of the obtained results
  • Keeping the necessary documentation (logs, reports, etc.) in orderly manner on the work carried out
  • Selection or development of analytical methods for determining the physicochemical and technical properties of substances and the improvement of these methods
  • Performing physicochemical and technical tests of raw materials, semi-finished products and products
  • Maintaining a database of raw materials and samples and its updating
  • Proper care and usage of equipment and the workplace, including maintenance of equipment to ensure proper calibration of equipment
  • Compliance with health and safety rules, fire safety and internal regulations
  • Other ad-hoc assignments by reporting
JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • Diploma / Degree in chemistry or related study
  • Knowledgeable in the chemical analysis
  • Experience in extracting compounds from plant material by various techniques (cold extraction, supercritical fluid extraction, solvent extraction, steam distillation)
  • Knowledgeable in use of various laboratory equipment including spectrometers and spectrophotometers, specifically with HPLC and/or GC-MS
  • Experience in conducting research work independently
  • Proper and accurate record keeping of all tests and experiments performed and ensuring timely reporting
  • Good computer skills (MS Office)
  • Ability to work in a team, creative thinking in resolving issues, diligent in work attitude, and accurately capture data
  • Able to organize work in a systematic manner, responsible attitude, honesty in the implementation of assigned tasks, reliable and committed in undertaking assigned tasks
  • Able to work under time pressure and to withstand stress by various techniques (cold extraction, solvent extraction, steam distillation) would be advantageous.
",[],Junior Executive,,2 years,"Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9403140&advertisement_id=9401511&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70170,Central,sg

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Job Description:
Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) develops high-value manufacturing technology and human capital to enhance the competitiveness of Singapore’s manufacturing industry. It collaborates with various multinational and local companies in the precision engineering, medtech, aerospace, automotive, marine, oil & gas, electronics, semiconductor, logistics, and other sectors.
The Manufacturing System Division (MSD) creates system technologies for autonomous manufacturing and resilient and responsive supply chain applications. We are looking for a highly motivated research engineer to work in the area of cyber-physical automation. The successful candidate will be trained and involved in developing Automation/Software/Electrical control technology and system for Industry 4.0 manufacturing and supply chain applications. 
The roles include:
  • To understand customer requirements and propose solutions with feasible scope and effort
  • Research and develop Automation/Software/Electrical control technology to solve problems in manufacturing and supply chain context
  • Design, understand and troubleshoot machine electrical & control systems
  • Design and develop Programmable Logic Control (PLC) program for automatic machine control & processes
  • Software integration and participate in the overall application lifecycle
  • Test and deploy systems at customer site
  • Support the customer in troubleshooting and technical support
  • Installation and commissioning of special purpose machine or system
Job Requirement:
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical or relevant disciplines
  • With 2 years or more relevant working experience in machine assembly, manufacturing & automation
  • Ability to work independently to translate research ideas into solutions
  • With Programming skills in PLC with IEC 61131-3 standard, C#, Python programming
  • With Machine HMI programming, electrical control design, robot programming
  • With Industrial communication protocol like EtherCAT, Ethernet/IP, Profibus, Modbus and any others
  • With Autonomous vehicle and experience will be considered as an added advantage
  • Prior experience in automation and manufacturing industry will be a plus
  • Able to deliver under tight schedule
  • Good team player with both research and engineering ethics
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column4: About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.

NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).

Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.

Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.

column1:
","
Research Fellow (Electrical and Electronics Engineering/Computer Science/Computer Engineering)
A Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering.
Job Responsibilities
  • Conduct the research on the development of the decision-making function which performs optimal dispatch of distributed energy resources (DERs) which include storage batteries, renewable solar PV systems and standby diesel generators (reserve only) for participation in the reserve market, frequency regulation market and peer-to-peer energy trading among the buildings with demand side management capabilities
  • Develop methodologies for forecasting load and solar PV output, for scheduling of DERs as well as for a P2P energy trading platform; design smart contracts for P2P energy trading; propose a cost-effective and scalable network architecture to support Ethereum; and introduce a novel incentive mechanism to promote P2P energy trading
Job Requirements
  • PhD degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering or Computer Science/Engineering
  • Expert knowledge in power electronics converters and power systems especially in the design of distributed energy resources, forecasting and frequency regulation controller for electricity market participation
  • Hardware experience will aid in the execution of the project
  • Experience with energy storage systems, renewable energy resources, electric vehicles and/or OPAL-RT is highly recommended
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Strong analytical and conceptual abilities
  • Able to work independently and in a team to realize the proposed works
  • Able to publish conference/journal papers and commit your time in the project, our project ends on 31 March 2022 and project extension is possible subject to the approval by the funding agency
  • Able to present effectively the work accomplished to EMA and ESG representatives
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Manager,,3 years,Doctorate (PhD),,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://ntu.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Careers/job/NTU-Main-Campus-Singapore/Research-Fellow--Electrical-and-Electronics-Engineering-Computer-Science-Computer-Engineering-_R00007047-1,70000,Singapore,sg

  • Monitoring and maintaining the global production cloud environments

  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems, or related experience.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","

One Research Fellow (postdoctoral) position is available immediately in the Computational Digital Pathology Lab (CDPL) of Bioinformatic Institute (BII), A*STAR, Singapore.
Novel imaging analysis methods and the advancement of Artificial Intelligence are making it feasible to extract quantitative information from Digital Pathology images. New knowledge, skills, and approaches are urgently required to develop novel, efficient and reliable computational tools for emerging challenges in biological and biomedical studies. Our CDPL is dedicated to the development of new solutions in this field. Currently, we are expanding our team and seeking enthusiastic scientists to join us!
For a research overview of our unit, please refer to https://www.a-star.edu.sg/bii/research/ciid/cdpl
General requirements:
  • Self-motivated scientist/Ph. D graduate to pursue a scientific career. Independent and passionate about biological image processing projects;
  • Good team player. Able to undertake independent research projects under the direction of the PI together with other team members;
  • Hold a Ph.D. in a relevant field of computer vision, image processing or machine vision, or other relevant fields;
  • Good general knowledge and concept of science and engineering;
  • Excellent scientific/technical writing skills and communication capability;
  • Prior experience in working with image analysis projects (Industrial or academic).
Specific technical requirements:
  • Excellent experience, knowledge, and skills in one or two following programming languages, i.e., Matlab, C/C++, Java or Python;
  • Excellent knowledge and skills in digital image processing;
  • Deep understand of AI learning, machine learning and data science with hand-on skill and experience.
  • Skills for numerical computational algorithms; Strong in mathematics theories.
  • Rigid and logical thinking of scientific problems;
  • General understanding of machine learning, pattern recognition, and artificial intelligence is a plus, but not compulsory;
  • Basic knowledge of cell biology or pathology is a value-add;
  • Present research achievements at internal/external seminars and conferences
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column1: 423,computer research,/en/job/trading-executive-9353355,9353355,Trading Executive,False,False,4000,6000,SGD,Bright Ruby Resources Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,,200923603R,,,51 - 200 Employees,,Republic Plaza,"<div>

column3: Established on December 18th, 2009 in Singapore and with registered capital of USD 265 million, BRIGHT RUBY RESOURCES PTE LIMITED (BRR) is a large-scale commodity trading company. BRR mainly deals in international trading of commodities, including iron ore, PCI coal and finished steel products. Since January 2010, BRR has been granted by the Bureau of International Enterprise Singapore (IE Singapore) the ""Global Trader Programme"" (GTP) statue. Taking the advantage of the naturally-endowed geographical location and strategic focus on commodity trading and shipping here in Singapore, BRR procures iron ore and PCI coal globally and sells to major steel mills in China.

Major suppliers of BRR include Vale, Robe River, One Steel, Hamersley Iron Pty, Prime Mineral Exports, New Zealand Steel, etc. BRR’s trading volume of iron ore alone in 2012 amounts to 25 million tons; in 2013, BRR’s trading volume of iron ore is expected to exceed 30 million tons. BRR’s sales revenue in financial year 2011 - 2012 (July 2011 - June 2012) amounts to USD 3.8 billion, as compared to the sales revenue of USD2.9 billion in the previous financial year.
With the continuing expansion of BRR’s commodity trading volume, we sincerely invite those, who have lofty aspirations in international trade and international trade settlements to join us!

column1:

Job Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for meeting sales targets for Iron ore and coal etc
  • Responsible for information research and collection, including market information, customer information, partner information
  • Responsible for arranging the reception of the customers and the negotiation of the project; preparing the quotation, signing the contract
  • New customers development, and maintaining the good relations with existing ones
  • Work closely with back-office functions, Trade executions, Credit, to ensure all targets are met with defined risk parameters
  • Any other ad-hoc duties assigned by the management

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor degree or above, international trade, business English related professional;
  • At least 3 years’ experience in business operations in the field of trade, import and export of commodities, and priority of foreign work experience;
  • Familiar with the trade operation process and related laws and regulations, with the field of trade expertise;
  • Have a higher level of English, a better level of computer operation, a certificate and other related trade operation certificate is preferred;
  • Has a good business development capabilities and business negotiation skills, strong public relations, with a strong sense of professionalism, team spirit and independent ability to work, the courage to open up and innovation.
